text: Overrated and expensive. Small Fry is better. The burgers are good for the most part. Don't order lettuce on your burger, if you do you are subjected  to a huge chunk of thick dry lettuce leaves with the core still attached.  The fries are absolutely dreadful: fried within an inch of their lives... tasteless unseasoned sticks. Although I think sticks might have been tastier to eat.  Milkshakes are good as the drinks selection. The music is way too loud... the curse of overly confident average restaurants that sell fast food.

Simple burgers, but so damn good! Double cheeseburger, good meat/cheese to bread ratio... I was an instant fan!  The line was very long but it moves very fast and food comes out fast so don't let the line discourage you!
A tasty burger, great for the 20 something millennial crowd, too hip for my taste but I like the concept.
More crisp, more meat focused, and less mushy than Au Cheval (not to mention shorter waits!)

My friend and I happened upon Small Cheval while wandering from our Airbnb in Bucktown on our first day in Chicago. I'd heard great things about the original Au Cheval and was excited to try the famed burger with less hassle (especially since there were few restaurant options on the stretch of Milwaukee Ave we'd walked). The inside is simple and cute, and the menu is equally minimal. The order line and the food service were both quick, and our burgers, fries, and shakes arrived quickly. The burger, of course, was great--hearty, plenty of cheese sauce, topped with nice pickles and tomatoes. The shake was rich AF and perfect to wash it down with. The fries weren't quite as crispy as I like, but still good. I'm curious to see how it would all stack up to the original! We also wanted to take advantage of their cheap shots, but alas it was too early in the day. Next time!

I love this place! The beer options are great and the burger is delicious, It doesn't sit to heavy and its the perfect portion of meat and cheese. My only recommendation would be a slight improvement with the fries. Otherwise this still is one of the best burger spot in Chicago!
Great burger,  but suggest not to get the bacon here.  It isn't very crispy.  The bacon at Au Cheval and Bavette's will change your life, but unfortunately it's not the same here.

I can't claim to be a burger connoisseur as I eat them once in a blue moon, but I thought Small Cheval was good. I liked the no frills experience and communal seating in the main dining area. The burger was probably a little overpriced for what you get.

I'm a huge fan of their burgers and fries. The shakes are not so great though so I would say skip out on those. One of the perks is they have super cute and spacey outdoor seating for those beautiful weather days.

A nice option for those of us who don't have the patience to wait around at Au Cheval.  Located conveniently in Wicker Park with street parking around, Small Cheval is easy to spot with their large, iconic design on the exterior. We arrived around 615 PM on a Saturday night and there was a line out the door, though we expected as much.  We waited for about 30 minutes and then got to the front and ordered from their simple menu: cheeseburger or hamburger ("housestyle" with dijionnaise, pickles, and onions), fries, and a large cocktail menu to order from... or in our case, milkshakes (vanilla or chocolate available, and you can add a shot of a number of liquors into it). There was some seating on the inside, though it was dark and not particularly cozy. Everyone was headed to the large outdoor patio and we followed suit. We found a spot at one of the many long tables available. The food came out relatively fast - within 10-15 minutes. Everything was as delicious as you'd expect with that Cheval name attached to the place!

I haven't been to Au Cheval, but this was one of the best burgers I've had. It takes a little while for the line to move, but there's plenty of space out back for seating. They have a cool selection of beers, shakes, etc. It's all about the Cheeseburger cheeseburger.
Get the house style cheeseburger! It's savory and delicious. You have to respect a place that focuses on doing one thing very, very well.

I dropped by here on my way home from the airport. At around 9:30 pm on Monday, it was pleasantly empty. The lady at the front desk taking orders was very friendly. I had been to Au Cheval before. The burger here is basically the exact same burger (minus the egg option) but in a fast food fashion.  I like their burgers very much, but I also do not think they're the best burgers out there (see my review of Au Cheval). My belief that this place is a little hyped remains unchanged.  Nonetheless, the food/drink hit the spot for me. I had the cheeseburger plus bacon, the fries, and a cup of Founders. After a week of traveling, nothing screams "Chicago!!" in your ears like a good old American cheeseburger that you can get at Cheval. I sat outside in the patio enjoying the warm summer night, sipping my beer and munching on my fries/burger. I loved every moment of it. God bless Chicago, good to be back.

Never got to try Au Cheval (due to long lines, but will attempt to at some point) so this review won't be a comparison between the two. I knew this place was popular so I wasn't at all surprised with the $10 cheeseburger--it came out pretty tasty, but I don't know if it was really worth $10. I liked the chewy bun of the burger though! There was a nice patio area for people to share tables and eat under cute lights, with the cta train passing every now and then. The line also moves really efficiently so I wouldn't stress if you see a lot of people trailing out of the restaurant. Overall, the burgers are good and worth a try, but it's lil overhyped.

Wow! Kind of a hidden spot. We grabbed two of their burgers one Friday night to go. My boyfriend was upset because we had to drive to pick it up and ended up losing our parking spot. He told me it better be the best burger in the world since we ended up parking like 5 blocks away and guess what, it truely did end up being the best burger ever! It's similar to au cheval but with a bit of heat. The meat is excellent and the bun unique. I really enjoyed the jam like spread as well as pickles on it.  Oh and their fried pickles were the best too! Super light for a fried item.

Looking for a much quicker, but fairly comparable experience to au cheval? Small Cheval totally does the trick. They have a pretty decent sized restaurant and large patio with tons of seating. The big picnic tables and cute tea-lights make for the perfect outdoor Chicago eating experience in the summer.  The wait staff was super efficient and kind. The menu is extremely limited, but honestly I think they would be doing themselves a disfavor if they were to make it any larger. It's perfect for what they're doing here. The food was simply delicious! Though I did miss having the egg option available.  I had the cheeseburger with bacon, house style and fries. Obviously added on some garlic aioli to both, and had a fantastic dining experience overall.

TLDR: Small Cheval: A Redemption Story. Simple burgers, AIOLI, (optional boozy) rich milkshakes.  I was not a fan of au cheval. At all. (See previous review about au cheval) So, I was extremely reluctant to try small cheval as it was going to be as salty as au cheval in my head. But I decided to give it a chance after seeing some fellow yelpers that didn't like au cheval say small cheval was better, and I'm glad I did! Small cheval is located in a cool part of bucktown/wicker park. It's a small standalone brick building, matching the aesthetic of its location. We went down for lunch on a Saturday afternoon, and I expected the worst. Au cheval boasts 5 hour waits on the weekends, but small cheval had a small line out the door that zoomed by quickly (10-15 min wait tops). The menu itself is pretty simple with the choice of a cheeseburger, hamburger, and fries. The restaurant boasts tons of alcohol choices and option for boozy milkshakes. I got a cheeseburger house style with a side of fries and a chocolate milkshake...a little pricy coming to a total of about $18. After another short 10 min wait or so, the food came out piping hot. First thing to note, the burgers are all double patties, so they're pretty hearty. There isn't anything too fancy about the burger as it comes pretty bare, even with the pickle and condiments added when you get it house style. But it's a pretty damn good burger. Second, the fries were crisp and given in a large quantity. GET THE AIOLI WITH YOUR FRIES, you will NOT regret it. If I could put that aioli on all my food for the rest of my life, I would not be upset. Third, the milkshake was thick and rich, the whipped cream on top adding a nice fluffy topping.  It started to get busier after we sat down to eat, and we noticed a cool patio out back to eat. Overall, the burger was a nice and solid, albeit pricy, meal that satisfied my burger craving in a way that au cheval did not. It was not over salted or over seasoned, and I appreciated the raw simplicity of small cheval. It almost makes me want to go back and give au cheval another chance.........almost.
Expensive and it sucked, why? Go compare this to Maxwells Burgers, it's the same but at least Maxwells tastes better and doesn't cost over 10 bucks, wtf...

Shout out to my AirBnB host for suggesting Small Cheval because these burgers were DELISH! Super juicy burgers, crispy fries, and yummy milkshakes. It is a little bit on the pricey side but the food is really simple and tasty.

The burger is awesome, Albeit on the smaller side.  The fries have the right amount of salt.  This place is pricey though.    There was a line to get in so people apparently have no problem shelling out the money.  Just high enough to send me elsewhere.   Now I can only afford White Castle for a while...
Hands down one of the best burgers I have ever had with good fries and beer in a chill setting.

The perfect burger! If you don't want to wait 2 hours to get a table at Au Cheval for their burger...Go to Small Cheval. Incredibly courteous staff, best burger in town and a laid back vibe. It's also very busy, but nothing like Au Cheval. Expect a 15-20 min wait to order. I go at least once a week as I crave this burger!
Perfect simple menu with an amazing burger! I love places that make 1 thing really well and this is exactly that!

I've been wanting to try this place for years and I decided today to finally give it a try. So disappointed :( First of all, the burger was pretty great, but it wasn't anything special. . For the price, you can definitely get a better burger. If you can, go to Shake Shack, In-N-Out, Kumas, even Wendy's. They have a better burger for a better price.

If what you want is a really good burger. This is a pretty good choice.  They seem to have worked out the kinks on inventory and handling the crowds. The lines move fairly quickly and the food quality is consistent. A $3 shot of whiskey is always a bonus. The fries are solid and the garlic aioli is a nice option.  Outdoor space is great and people are totally digging the vibe. I'd go back for sure.  There may very well be a better burger in Chicago, but Small Cheval can hold its own as a very convenient choice for me.

Small cheval Vs Au Cheval? Small all the freaking way!  Seriously,  read my review on Au Cheval if you don't believe me... but,  dude,  I just didn't like Au at all! Thankfully I gave Small a chance and was wow'd by them! Their burger was perfectly cooked,  not slathered in sauce like the one at Au, and the vibe is so much less pretentious. It's more chill...come in, eat,  chat for a bit with your hipster friends and leave shortly after.   Oh and did I mention you won't wait four hours to sink your teeth in a delicious Patty?  Quicker,  much,  much quicker than their counterpart.   Go!

Can't believe I've lived in the hood for 2 years and never came here! So good. Maybe not quite to the level of Au Cheval (no eggs here people), but still delish. Definitely get a milkshake - I like to think of myself as a connoisseur of the milkshake as I spent three summers making the things.  Pick a nice day to go and sit outside!

I WANT TO EAT HERE EVERY. DAMN. DAY. I'll never understand the people who just don't get this place because this is by far my favorite burger AND it's gluten free friendly people!! I've started to prefer this location to Au Chavel since this one wraps your burger in the perfect lettuce wrap if you can't enjoy the bunny goodness.  I think the price point can be a little high, but you know I keep paying it. I love that you can get a shot when you order your food and that they have a great selection of sodas, beers, and a cider too. There's really no words for me to put into this review. I JUST LOVE YOU, DAMNIT!

I'm happy I finally got to try out Small Cheval. I love that the menu is tiny. Seriously, you go here to eat a burger and fries. The place is small, but has ample seating. The weather was amazing today so we sat outside. Even though the line was out the door, I never felt like the seating area was over-packed. The service is speedy & the workers were incredibly nice. My friend really wanted a beer, but the line was out the door. A worker came and let him order a beer through her instead of waiting in the line. Both of us loved the burger! It was perfectly cooked and the sauce they use is delicious. I've been to Au Cheval, but I like the vibe of Small Cheval better.
Simple menu of just burgers, fries and shakes done really well. Like *really* well. Even the ketchup is amazing. This is no greasy spoon restaurant. And if you want booze, they have that too.
Can't eat enough burgeeeeeeeeeerssss... so quick and delicious! Basically the same burger you get at Au Cheval minus that insane waite!

Small Cheval is solid but still a notch below Au Cheval. The burgers are pretty different, less buttery rich, no fried egg, which actually make them much better go-to burgers than their counterpart, Au Cheval which can only be reserved for special once (twice?) a year treats. Went on a Saturday late afternoon and no lines, which is a huge plus. The fries were very good, but lacked that extra crispness on the outside. Same amazing garlic aioli dipping sauce. Great stop if you're craving an all around decent burger that doesn't sit too heavy in the stomach.

You know a place must be good if there's a line forming out the door. I went during dinner time on a Saturday night (in the summer too!) so it was super busy.  Small Cheval is in a prime location with ample outdoor seating. I loved seeing all the babies and doggos hanging out together with their parents outside.  It's so clean for how many people go in and out-- good job on keeping keeping the condiment area looking like it's nobody's business. With a bajillion people pumping that garlic aioli dispenser every other minute, I really have to commend Small Cheval for being on top of it.  Service was pretty good too. I appreciate any eatery that can keep their cool and treat everyone with respect through all the craziness. I have to admit though... my burger was only delicious because of the condiments I slathered onto it. If you look at my pictures, the hamburger looks verrrrrry plain. I got it with all the complimentary toppings but still *shrug shrug.* I am convinced the only reason why this burger was so delicious was because of the garlic aioli and ketchup.  ALSO, this is NOTHING like the Au Cheval burger!!! Do not come here for that! It's far less decadent, and much more plain. It kind of reminded me of a very naked In N Out?? Like it could've been In N Out but it couldn't.

Quick, speedy and helpful employees. I suggest sitting outside, because inside can get hectic and loud. Outside seating on a nice summer day is the way to go. One of, if not thee tastiest burger I have ever had in Chicago. Fries and Milkshakes are also delicious and should accompany your order. Will definitely be back.

Oh, that burger!  I mean, if you're going to hit up Small Cheval, you don't really have a ton of options... but why would you want any more options than that burger?   Some wonderfully perfectly crispy fries on the side?  Yes please!  And maybe a shake?  Hmm, how about a spiked shake with a shot of whiskey or some other tequila?  Now you're talking! Admittedly, I was a little disappointed to not be able to include a fried egg on my burger at Small Cheval to really make it an Au Cheval burger... but to be able to enjoy this awesomeness without the hour and a half wait, it's all good! Burger from Small Cheval, you're my burger in shining armor... and I will be back to enjoy your greasy delicious goodness time and again! *****FIVE STARS*****
Spectacular burger. Had high expectations and they were surpassed! Outside of the burger, the garlic aioli adds a nice touch to the fries and the vanilla shake doesn't disappoint.

The burgers here are mediocre at best, but the vibe is excellent for hanging out after work, sporting events, etc. The only real downside I can think of is the fact that the L passes right behind the outdoor seating area, so you'll have to (most likely) pause your conversation lol.

1000% the best burger I have ever had. The cheese was melted perfectly and complimented the patty along with the bun for the perfect trifecta. In my boyfriends words: "if there is one thing that would make me permanently move to this city it is that burger"
Always have to stop when I'm in the neighborhood. Not as good as Au Cheval in my opinion, but the second best burger I've ever had. Will be back as always!

Small Cheval's burgers are awesome. They're juicy, seasoned perfectly, and just taste very good. The fries were also very delicious. The menu should be a bit bigger (only had 3 items) and their service should be better (the employees didn't really help with my order).

This gem always has a fast-moving line as it seems to have perfected the idea of having a few solid items that they cook well! It sits perfectly near the 606 Trail, so it's a great stop-a-long. Burgers, fries, shakes, and beer! No frills - simple, easy, and delicious. it's a great place for take-out although their patio is lovely for a summer day. It gets loud inside given how small and cozy it is, though is great outside (barring the occasional train noise). I'm only giving it a 4 because the last two times have not been as exceptional as the many times before. By that, I mean I am being nit-picky and the burger patty was cooked a bit more than it typically is.

Love bringing out of town guests here. When a place serves only burgers, fries, shakes and beer, you know they're good at what they do. Crispy, salty fries, dijonnaise (do not pass on that) and god I could drink the garlic aioli by the bucket. Lots of outdoor seating but communal seats inside, where you'll be crowded by the long line and loud music. Go and thank me later.

Alright so here's the scoop. If you're venturing here in replacement of the OG big papa Cheval with high expectations, lower them juuuuusttt a tad.  I suggested this location with a group of friends after our hearts were set on that of who shall not be named. To avoid over an hour to two and a half hour wait on a Sunday, we decided to try lil bro instead after much much word around town. To reiterate, if you're looking for the similar to spot on version, it's not here. Although the style is similar with a double patty, the bacon(extra 2.00) is NOT pork belly and just all around a good/more decent burger.  Don't get me wrong, it was a great burger in a fast food style sit down location. Service was friendly and the price was still relatively high, but I am firm believer in getting what you pay for, and this meat, is quality all day.  If we must do comparisons I'll say it's a step below big bro and a step above Five Guys. It'll do the trick for a burger fixing and booshie budget when you just don't have 2 hours to wait at their counterpart.  My friends were impressed considering the nick of time we had. However, I kept getting the, "it wasn't the same, it just wasn't the same." Okay, it's NOT the same. But can you honestly duplicate perfection? I digress.  Overall, if you're in a crunch of time, come here. If you have all day and no set plans, you already know which way to go.

They are a small menu lol.. I would suggest the cheese burger house made (includes the toppings) and a side of fries.. also their shakes are really good! They have a few choices for condiments.. the aoli is good!! They have seating inside but when it is nice out they open the back area.. it's really cute.. simple but nicely decorated with some greenery and patio lights... it's nice for a first date, hanging out etc. the staff noticed that we were celebrating a birthday and we got free shakes! That was very sweet! We come here often and if you like burgers I would suggest it! The patties are juicy! It is a double patty!!

I was happy that the food lives up to the raves but the line is a negative. I made sure to get there just as they opened and decided to get the food to go.  I don't live far from it - I knew the food would not suffer for a short trip home.  Very hot day  - sitting outside not what I wanted to do-inside too crowded.  Vanilla milkshake, fries, hamburger with house toppings and garlic aioli were all delicious. The aioli can go on fries or burger. The price is way up there for this kind of food, but I didn't mind once I tasted it.  This is a little gold mine.  I hope it stays consistent because they could become complacent with all their success.
Burgers are solid...love that 'micro-brew' ketchup...make sure you get a shake with that meal!!!

Fun little whole in the wall joint with a great patio. Limited menu is fine as they focus on what they do best ( Burgers, fries and shakes). Great burgers- wish there was a veggie burger option but the burger and fries were delicious. Kids sized burgers available even though they don't advertise it. Great choice for a very casual place right off the 606.

Great burgers and fries! Definitely worth the wait, and although the lines look long, they get your order in very quickly so it goes faster than you'd expect. The house ketchup isn't my favorite, but they also provide Heinz, thank goodness. Didn't try the milkshakes, but they have good beers on tap and in cans. My friends and I sat outside on the patio, which was much better than the slightly stuffy atmosphere inside.

Though I have never been to Au Cheval I can only imagine it's as good as people say from eating at Small Cheval. Great place to swing by with friends especially when other places like Big Star in Wicker Park are packed. They offer drinks including boozy shakes and a rather decent selection of beers and cocktails.  The food menu is simple consisting on hamburgers, cheeseburgers, and fries. Honestly, there isn't much more to ask for. The burgers are delicious and you have unlimited access to delicious condiments including garlic aioli, special ketchup, regular Heinz ketchup, and mustard. The garlic aioli is by far my favorite part. Delicious on the burger but also a great dipping option for the fries.  Overall, one of my new favorite spots in Wicker Park. Great place to grab drinks, eat outside on the patio, and take a load off. I would definitely recommend it you just can't go wrong!

Yes! This was a hit! Came at lunch time mid-week with my family and we each devoured a delicious burger and fries. When I'm taking in so many calories it better be worth it, and this was definitely worth it. Their menu is simple and to the point: Just do a few things and do them well. Guy who took my order was friendly and welcoming. The Pixies were playing on the stereo.
Fantastic burger in cool little hut. Bun was perfect and sirloin mix very tasty.  Nice outdoor seating and parking wasn't a haze!  Cannot wait to come back!

This was my favorite burger for awhile until recently my visit wasnt as expected. The quality of the food wasnt as good as previously and it was a disappointment. I dont know why but the food tasted different to me, almost seemed like a different type of burger meat was used. Hope they bring back the old stuff.

LITTLE SISTER Au Cheval's sibling location fits in nicely with the quick, cheap eats (okay, cheap-ish) section of Wicker Park. This spinoff of the big brother full-service restaurant is smaller yet still serves a dynamite burger...albeit not a cheap one.  At $10, 'inexpensive' isn't a word I'd use to describe their succulent double cheeseburger, but holy smokes does it hit the spot after logging a few solid hours of pinball at the nearby Emporium barcade. Beer, burgers (with or without cheese--bacon is an extra $2), fries, shakes.  And that's it!  You really don't need much more since the burger prepared house-style (pickles, grilled onions, dijonaise) is more than enough to quell those drunk, late night hunger pangs. Patio is cute.  My Bell's draft was $7, which is steep but I was elated to see my preferred beer of choice on tap.  I didn't have time for the fries or a shake, but rest assured I'll hit those up on my return visit as I definitely plan on coming back. Sorry folks, no photos this time around; too preoccupied with devouring that double chee to bother with any pictures.  I'll snap a couple on my next trip, guaranteed!

If you love the burger goodness of Au Cheval, but don't want to give up four hours and your first-born child to grab food, go to Small Cheval. They just have your basic cheeseburger as opposed to the creative variations of its parent restaurant. The fries are amazing, too (make sure to get that garlic aoli). I've heard their milkshakes are great, but I haven't tried one.  I really dislike that people are commenting that the burgers are greasy. You're ordering a burger in America, not a kale salad. I'm not saying to myself, "I want to feel good about myself and get a refreshing meal. Let me go to Small Cheval!" No, this is a meal where you'll love what you're eating, but you will hate yourself afterwards (in a good way). If you hate yourself so much that you feel a punishment is necessary, they serve Malort.

I had an awesome lunch at Small Cheval Friday afternoon. The burger had multiple layers of flavor and was perfectly cooked. The bun was soft but not soggy. I usually don't like mustards but I said yes to the dijonaise on the burger and I'm glad I did. It complimented the onions and juicy thin patties really well. The fries were also delicious. Perfectly salted and piping hot. I had water to drink but they had one of those awesome soda machines that lets you get a bunch of different varieties of various sodas. Super cool. I'll definitely be back.

I had passed this place numerous times on my commute and was always interested. Always has a line out the door. Finally got it after hearing some good things and have to say I don't see what's so impressive about it. It costs $14 for a cheeseburger and fries and I found the burger to be somewhat comparative to a burger from Culvers. The fries were amazing though.

wait...i haven't reviewed this yet?  i've eaten here probably 40 times. i guess that's really all you have to know. i've eaten at the original & hate it-because of the service (why are there so many service industry snobs?) and stupid crowds.  the burgers are everywhere-including 3 greens-& they always taste exactly the same as they should.  anybody who says one is better than the other does not know what they are talking about. huge fan of the shakes & fries as well.  don't be an idiot & wait in line at peak times.  i have never had to do that because i am logical about when i eat at the best restaurants in chicago.

People and service was great. The outdoor eating area is cool. Love the sting lights and the music that's played. The burger..... very disappointing. Pricy, which I don't mind paying if its wroth it. Actually feel bad giving the food a bad rating cause the place, people and atmosphere were great.

Went into small cheval, was greeted by a nice lady making sure my parking was good to go so I don't get a ticket :) we order two cheese burgers and fries and it took less than 5 minutes!!! Fast service and nice people!

I gave Au Cheval 5 stars for their delicious burger, and as such, I have to give Small Cheval a 4-star rating. Don't misunderstand this as a slight or disappointment because the burgers are still great, but for me it does not come close to the glorious Au Cheval version. This is slightly smaller with slightly more dijonnaise sauce (maybe too much), and the bacon is not as thick/juicy. No egg available here (but this was expected/known). But still very much better than an average burger. I suppose that I would have enjoyed the burger a lot more if I didn't have the original last week :). Fries are good and a sizable portion at only half the cost compared to Au Cheval. Will definitely return here for another burger when the waits at Au Cheval are too long!

Great little joint with 3 menu items! Let me start off by saying the atmosphere indoors & out is very inviting. The line moved quickly and the staff seem to really enjoy working there. The burger was delicious but I wish they used a decent ketchup like Heinz. Not sure the brand but I did not like it so I only used mustard, you add your own condiments. The fries were bland to me but the burger made up for that but again they could have been better with a good ketchup.  The drink menu is simple as well.  We will be back.

I'm probably going to get some flak for this review, but I really don't get the hype about this place. Take this with a grain of salt, because I had the same feeling about the Au Cheval burger, but the burger here is only slightly better than average, but nothing to write home about. To me the burger tasted greasy, which wasn't helped by the mayo heavy sauce. The meat was good, as was the cheese, but overall, no real flavors to talk about. The fries are good - no argument there, but overall I can't really recommend waiting in line for this burger. But then again, hundreds of other review tell me I might be crazy, so give it a try for yourself. See if it lives up to the hype!

Not much food on the menu, but they do burgers (and fries) and they do them well. Burger was delicious, and the bun in particular was perfect. Decent amount of sauces to choose from. They have a decent beer selection too. Great outdoor area for seating in warm weather.

This place does not disappoint! The cheeseburgers are scrumptious! I crave a good cheeseburger every once in a while and this place just hits the spot. We gave this place a try after our second shot at trying to eat at Au Cheval but the waiting times for a table are ridiculous. So glad it led us to this place.

Small Cheval was recommended by--get this--my three year-old niece.  The cheeseburgers are her favorite.  I too have found fandom in not only the cheeseburgers (w/ bacon), but also the fries and vanilla milkshake.  The fries taste like you're biting into a Jay's potato chip - it's crazy good. One thing to note if you get overwhelmed by rich foods - ask them to go easy on the mayo.  I couldn't finish my burger because it was all cheese and globs of mayo at the end.

Decent Burger, similar to 5 Guys. Great if you're in the area but not worth going out of your way for and parking isn't great (Meter only and not lots of it). I'd go 4 stars but don't like places that don't list prices for things like drinks especially since it's a way to hide very high prices. Just tell me, I'll still buy it. I dislike tricks and games. Getting very burned out on Burgers and they don't offer a Grilled Chicken option for the Health Conscious like Lockdown or Kuma's.
Found free street parking. Kind of pricey, but that's to be expected. My burger was good. I split an order of fries with my husband. The garlic sauce was really good. I'd be back if we lived closer.
Amazing as hell, best ingredients on a burger ever. Cooked perfectly and mouth watering with every bite. Probably the top 3 best burgers I have had in Chicago, without the wait.
Really tasty burgers and really good shakes. I also noticed the staff to be super friendly and the place itself was very comfortable.
This place is so so good! The cheese burger with bacon is oh my gosh!! They have this garlic aloi sauce for your ch see burger. There is no other way to explain but I will show a picture.

The burger here has some great qualities, but It's not my favorite Chicago burger. The meat is seasoned well, and the size of it is manageable.  This burger is better if you like simpler type burgers (nothing wrong with that), but I'm actually one of those people that likes a thicker patty, special cheeses and items like fresh jalapeños on my burger.  My boyfriend loves the burger here, so I've been here many times over the last few months.  My weakness is their fries. I find their hand cut fries addicting. I recently learned that the fries are fried in beef fat, so now I know why these taste so different from most other fries I've had. Dipping those fries into the aioli sauce just enhances the experience even more for me, but the fries are good plain as well. I highly suggest ordering one of their thick milkshakes and adding a shot of alcohol to it.  The milkshakes should not be missed when you pay a visit here.

My favorite burger, ever (disclaimer: I have yet to try Au Cheval)!  I LOVE Small Cheval!!! I get the cheeseburger with house toppings, a vanilla or chocolate shake (they're both sublime), and USUALLY fries (because YOLO).  The garlic aioli dipping sauce is awesome, but they also have Sir Kensington condiments!  They're usually busy but very efficient.  Yum! Pro tip: The cheeseburger is actually a double, by default.

Very tasty burger. I'm gluten free and they wrapped the burger beautifully with lettuce and paired my lunch with a cider. The ambiance is fun in their courtyard. Everyone I encountered was very pleasant. I will come back!

Not as glitzy as Au Cheval but everytime I walk past I just wanna park the dog, grab a beer and drown in garlic aouille drenched fries.  The burger definitely hits the spot, but lines can get extremely long.

I usually won't leave a review after only 1 visit, but my cheese burger was so great at Small Cheval that I am totally confident in giving this joint an easy 5-stars rating. I'm tired of deciding between 10 different burgers on a menu. How about just doing 1 thing really really well? That is exactly the case here.  To start, the burger is actually a double-double. The patties are thin with a nice crisp to them and the melted cheese is generous but not overwhelming. The buns are fresh and the condiments are nothing exotic, only what you would expect. This is everything a cheese burger is supposed to be and at a reasonable price. Simply an all-American classic executed to perfection.  The line was pretty long (we waited probably 20 minutes to order) but was absolutely worth it. Once our order was in, it maybe took 10 minutes for our buzzer to go off. The fries were hot,  fresh, and enough to share between 2 people.

First of all, if you're looking for an identical West Loop Au Cheval burger experience, this isn't it. But don't let that defer you because let me tell you, these are DELICIOUS. Definitely in their own way though. No runny eggs and the bacon isn't the same, but again, it's bacon, stop complaining!! The space is much more casual and there's a counter to order at. They have a condiment station, which I personally love, and  oh em gee their garlic aioli is something! So good, I'm drooling just thinking about it.  If you're looking for casual eats, this buttery burger joint is the place to be.

Burger connoisseur's such as myself can be delighted by the simple tastes found here. I had heard rumors of its tastiness. Finally, I had to come check it out on my own. A vanilla bean whiskey milkshake and golden fries make the perfect accompaniment to this stunning burger.  This burger met and exceeded expectations. I come from cattle country. I take beef and burgers most seriously. This burger had me driving back through the city in traffic just to come back for another round. No joke. I drove to the city, a 3 hour adventure just for this burger. You will not be disappointed. You may become addicted. This is easily my favorite burger spot. Au Cheval is probably great, but I'll never know because this is what burger heaven is like. No frills. Just thrills. Make sure you try the Garlic aoli and sir Kensington ketchup.
This was probably one of the best bacon burger I've ever had. The pickles, onions, bun, EVERYTHING was delicious lol ..... it was a sexy F-ing burger!

Definitely just ok and not as good as the original Au Cheval. Would rather wait 1 - 2 hours for the original. Burger was ok, fries were soggy and not crisp. Vanilla shake was ok and garlic aioli was good. Good place to grab a quick bite if you're in the hood.

Small Cheval is the best thing Chicago has to offer. JK I barely scratched the surface of this wonderful city, but YO! SMALL CHEVAL IS. A. MUST. I came here with a bunch of friends for a casual dinner after a loooong day of drinking. I was drunk, yes, but I think as a sober person, I would absolutely enjoy this place just as much. I came, got in line, saw the simplest menu ever, and decided to just go all in. I got the cheeseburger with bacon, as well as a side of the awesome golden fries. Did not know that all the burgers are doubles, but that was a nice surprise and that sure did justify the price (still kinda pricey for burgers though, but WORTH EVERY PENNY). When your caller-thingy starts to buzz, you should def get excited, cos you about to get hit with (arguably) the best burger ever. When I picked up my order, I also got a few pumps of garlic aioli, because these fries deserve to be dunked in the best sauce possible. Nothing against ketchup, but you gotta hit the aioli. They have a bunch of picnic benches outside, so my friends and I were all able to sit comfortably outside (although a bit cold) and be a little rowdier than we could indoors. Good thing, cos we were all drunk. All of us were truly blown away by the burgers. AND the fries. We were just so impressed with how amazing these burgers are. AMAZING. So juicy, cheesy, hot, and that bun was the perfect softness and chewinesss omg. The pickles gave it a good crunch, the bacon, although not necessary, added a lil sump sump to it. Fries were perfectly crispy and delicious. Fuck I'm so hungry right now. DAMMIT! BE CLOSER! Alright, I'm all cursin and freakin out over here. Just means I'm obsessed and ready to kill for a Small Cheval burger.. sigh. Now I'm sad cos I can't have it. OK WELL, I'm just gonna have to go back to Chicago soon cos this simply won't do. TIL NEXT TIME!!

Pleeeeeease serve the au cheval hashbrowns and if there is more room, the chicken liver app. Those are the only two reasons I go back to Au Cheval, vs. just coming to Small, because Small has a way way WAY friendlier staff, limited wait, great outdoor space, is dog friendly, and an overall better, more positive experience. Burgers are good, beers on tap decent, but the app / sides could use a bit of work and they would surpass the draw of the 4 hour wait at Au.

I love Au Cheval, I love Small Cheval. I love burgers, I love fries, I love shakes. This place has it all. I'm so happy Small Cheval is in existence.  I don't dig on that long line, and I hope they change their ordering system to more than one register, but I know that the long line plays a part in their image, like "Hey guys look how long our line is..!!"
The line was long but the wait was not. Parking was a beast, but we finally found a spot. They were fast and professional. The food was so good, the chocolate shake simply amazing!!

Eat indoor or outdoor.  Very cool atmosphere and great burgers, fries, and shakes.  Small Cheval has never let me down.  It is my go to spot. You can get beer and booze.  You can have booze added to your shake.  Pop in cans.  Malort for your friends new to Chicago.  Two types of ketchup.  Burgers are two patty.  You can add cheese and bacon.  You can order burger house style - dijonaise, onions, and/or pickles.  Be sure to get water with your shake. Great tunes to listen to while you dine  - music not too loud (a few Michael Jackson - Off the Wall tunes).  The noise of the EL train outside reminds you that you are in the city and I feel adds to the experience.

This place is a one trick pony (not meant in a derogatory way at all)  but it is such a good trick. There was a study stream of customers the whole time I was here but that didn't stump the kitchen. Got a beer while waiting in line, ordered within a couple of minutes and was eating my bacon cheeseburger within 10 minutes. Top notch. Their garlic aioli is so good. Great experience.

I did not really like Small Cheval, however keep in mind I have never been able to get into Au Cheval for comparison. The food was forgettable - I cannot really remember being wowed by the burger at all. BUT that garlic aioli at the ready was a major positive! The outdoor seating space is reminiscent a la Parson's. I liked that - though we went when it was rather cold out. There was no room inside so we risked the cold.  I understand that they don't exactly have a full service bar. However I ordered a cocktail which I thought looked really good as I saw it get served to someone else. But the bartender/server literally just made it in the plastic cup and squeezed the cup a bunch to mix the ingredients. I have never witnessed a drink be prepared like this before. And guess what? It was a terrible drink and a rip off. Pretty disappointing. I probably will not be back.
This petite version of Au Cheval is so great! There was a line out the door, but they are so efficient and friendly!  Burger and shake... you cannot go wrong!

So over priced and lack of hospitality.  I am vegan so I had no food options.  Ok fine I'll drink.  My drink was a short pour and overpriced.  My hubby got a burger fries and a beer.  He didn't seem that impressed eating it and I asked him later and he didn't even remember it.  For a place that is suppose to have the best burgers in bucktown but is not even memorable.  Lame.  Even lamer walking out with no food for me and 40 bucks poorer sucked.  Go to AMK there burger is better and your not treated like a number

What can you say about a place that serves only one thing? You can say, they better do that one thing very very good - and Small Cheval does exactly that. If your looking for anything else other than a hamburger (or cheeseburger) fries and a drink, go somewhere else. This is all about just how good they can make a burger and fries. The burger itself is top quality meat they cook with this outer char that is slightly crispy and extremely tasty. The pickles, onions, lettuce, cheese and bacon are all equally top quality. The (almost) brioche bun somehow holds all of these ingredients together without leakage or deconstruction. Their combination dijon / mayo is amazing and delicious! Their fries are these slightly overcooked (a compliment BTW) crispy marvels that are really really good. I'm guessing they use duck fat or partially that. Once again their combination dijon / mayo and their homemade signature ketchup is killer.  So, I've had cheeseburgers all over the world. Small Cheval is absolutely in my top 10 and could be edging into the Top 5. That is a lofty declamation for sure!

Small Cheval is a little burger joint that boasts a simple, but yummy menu. I went with a friend to try it out after we kept seeing the hype on Insta. Simple menu, so we both ordered the cheeseburger with all the available toppings (which is like cheese and a mayo type sauce) and shared an order of cheese fries. We both thought it was a little overpriced for the options we chose. Super juicy cheeseburger which was very satisfying and the cheese fries were awesome. We chose to sit outside because 1) the inside is very dark, 2) it was summer, and 3) outdoor seating was very cute! Overall, it was a good experience, but slightly overrated.

Girlfriend suggested we go for a quick bite - glad we did. This is a nice, quick burger-joint which simply sells the barebones; hamburgers, cheeseburgers, fries, milkshakes, beer. Limited space to eat inside; had an expansive outdoor patio.  We ordered bacon cheeseburgers with fries and a Bailey's milkshake. The cheeseburgers were delectable. Two juicy thin-sliced patties that tasted the way I envision a Krabby Patty might taste. The liqueur in the milkshake mixed well and was just enough for you to detect that it was in the drink but not too overpowering. The fries were your average hand-cut fries.  Overall it was a nice spot to stop by for a good and relatively quick hamburger.

I'm not going to lie; I've looked into the apartments across the street, and the proximity of Small Cheval was a definite huge plus on the list of pros and cons.   Small Cheval is the perfect example of a place that only does one thing and does it well.   Great burgers, crispy fries with unlimited garlic aioli and the choice between Sir Kensington's and Heinz's ketchup, fairly priced drinks and food, and a great patio with a casual atmosphere and hardly ever any long wait times.
Must try this place out. Burgers are AMAZING. Make sure you grab a Vanilla shake. and do NOT forget to try the Garlic Aioli. Very Very chill environment with a real simple layout.
Awesome and makes ordering easy for the indecisive -great burger and fries, my kind of place! It's small so it seems really busy but the food was ready without too long of a wait.

I never had the patience to wait 3 hours to try Au Cheval, so when Small Cheval opened in Wicker Park, I was thrilled. Unfortunately, I was not able to try Small Cheval till about two weeks ago.  I was initially disappointed with the extremely limited menu and the lack of seating options (giant communal table with bar style seating on the side). I was however pleasantly surprised by the taste of my Cheeseburger and fries, especially with the Garlic Aioli on the side.

Apple is the largest company on the planet with a market cap in excess of 800 billion dollars, yet everything they manufacture can basically fit on your dining room table. While Small Cheval is not quite there yet in terms of Apple's size, everything they produce can basically fit on a cafeteria tray.  So what else do these two great behemoths have in common... Focus, Quality, Service and Execution. With their limited menu they can deliver great products consistently and the seamless service and Execution necessary to ensure a solid customer experience.  Also, Both companies also have cool accessories (e.g. Shots at Small Cheval) and stay true to who and what they are.  Oh BTW, did I mention they make a great burger with delicious house cured bacon, solid fries and a killer chocolate shake!

If you are looking for an amazing burger and fries, look no further than Small Cheval. At first, I was a little thrown by the fact that there was no menu, but after trying the food, I quickly realized why. We went at about 1 o'clock on a Friday afternoon, so we did not have to wait very long in line. I ordered a cheeseburger house style and split the fries with the other individual I was with. The burger was warm, juicy and melted right in my mouth. As a self-proclaimed sauce/dip lover, I was overly excited about the dip station to go along with my fries (&the sauce on the burger for that matter). With only 2 of us in our party, we were able to grab a seat looking out the window and I enjoyed it very much. However, if you have a group larger than 2/3, the seating arrangement is less than ideal. I cannot wait for my next trip back to Chicago, this will definitely be on the list!

I have a soft spot for places with limited menus, and by limited I mean less than 5 things on the menu.  Places like Small Cheval have lines out the door constantly. Could it be because the building is small?  Yes, but it might also be because of how well the food is.  Places with a limited menu are the best simply because they choose to perfect one thing.  They dont have to worry about preparing 10 - 20 different food items, as simple as it could be to prepare them all. Small Cheval's menu is 3 items - Hamburger, Cheeseburger, and French Fries.  Condiments consist of Dijonnaise, Finely chopped red onion, and pickle.  You may also order lettuce and tomato (not listed), and add $2 for bacon.  All burgers are two 1/4 lb patties. For what sounded like a flat top, the patties were cooked perfectly.  Adding mustard and ketchup helped cut down on the plain greasy taste.  Although they were well done, it was still juicy.  The french fries were not overdone, and crispy, and tasted amazing with ketchup. It is very affordable.  and they're seating is plentiful.  Inside communal table, looks to sit 20? and they also have bars lining the exterior walls, with outdoor seating as well.  Not many things wroung with Small Cheval.  Only thing I'd recommend is an option to lightly toast buns.
First time ordering the burger.  Way way overcooked.   Not a tasty burger at all.  The fries were very crumbly it was difficult to find a single whole fry.  Won't be going back very disappointed.

2 patty burger cooked to no specific temperature with American cheese food. I did not expect processed cheese food on a "gourmet" burger. Terrible French fry pieces with too much salt, cold and very greasy. Not a single full length fry.

This place will get mixed because everyone has a different idea of a delicious burger. With Small Cheval I've heard the hype, seen the long lines, and now finally got to see what it was all about.  Going into this restaurant, you must understand and appreciate the simplistic nature of the menu, ingredients, and atmosphere. Your not going to a 5 star restaurant asking for burger option toppings, no selection of ridiculous cheeses, ridiculous additional toppings like Mac N Cheese, chicken fingers, or pulled pork,  which beg the question is it still a burger, or even how do you want it cooked for that matter. Again appreciate the simplistic nature of the burger, the fact that your standing in line, and your not making reservations.  I went for the cheeseburger, comes with dual patties, Kraft Cheese, homemade dijonnaise, pickles and onion, on a plain buttered bun. I originally thought is this better than a 1/2 lb burger, medium with pepper jack, bacon, etc.... by the time I was done thinking I had eaten the entire burger. This may not be the best burger I've ever had, but it's the Perfect burger! Consistent bite after bite, cheese, meat, bun, sauce, and it was really good to a point I wanted to jump back in line for another!  And the fries, if you don't like these fries, don't come here then, shorter lines for me next time. The fries are ridiculous, get some Kensington ketchup or aioli garlic sauce you won't be disappointed. I will be back.  Simple, fast, and bottom line delicious. If your looking for that perfectly cooked 1/2 lb burger with your option of cheese and toppings, make a dinner reservation at not at Small Cheval!

Ive been going to Au Cheval since 2014! Before it the Food Networks Best Burger in America List (which we can now thank for the sometimes 3-4 hour wait). So I was ecstatic to learn that Small Cheval would be opening back in 2015. I knew my dreams had been answered because the whole wait thing I just couldn't do anymore. Small Cheval has disappointed me twice, once during  the Bacon shortage of 2015. And second about a month ago.. Because I was served REGULAR ASS BACON" IDK what happened... if there was a bacon shortage again, if y'all just ran out for the night, if y'all couldn't run on down to Green Meats to re-up. Whatever, happened I really felt like I was served bacon from possibly Jewel-Osco. There was no peppercorn pepper, or maple taste at all. I was hurt and still  am low key since I was waiting for that Bacon all week. All Im saying is next time just put a sign up saying "We're all out of Bacon" Just please stop serving this possible Trader Joe's, Mariano's, or Jewel Osco Bacon. Your loyal customers know and very well taste the difference!

The service here was great and the food was delicious but filling. The gentleman who took our order and picked up our trays was the sweetest human! I wish I knew his name. Thank you man in glass working the night shift on 5/4/17.

Really delicious, juicy cheeseburger. Fries were alright, not the best. Never been to Au Cheval so I can't really compare but this place definitely hit the spot. Plus, you don't have to wait 3.5 hours for a burger.

Ever since I went here for the first time, I have dreams that I own vats of their garlic aioli so I can eat it any time I want. This place is fun, loud, and delicious. If you're in the neighborhood, highly recommended.

The burger here is def NOT as awsome as the other reviews make it out to be.  It's OK - a pretty decent size for the $7-8 you're paying.  But the way the burger is marinated here - it lacked that juicy, burger taste.  Quite honestly, shake shack's burgers are tastier compared to here imo.  Also, kind of outrageous that they charge $8 for beer here when it's casual eat/sit down/take out type place with no service.  The fries actually tasted okay and you get quite a lot for the amount you pay for.  But overall, I'm still looking for that really great burger in Chicago.

Phenomenal  burgers. Order them house style and get a milk shake. You won't regret it. Don't forget the garlic aioli for dipping! Busy almost any day of the week but a great spot for outside seating when it's warm out. Just a short walk from the blue line.
I really liked the burgers here. It's a little crowded and we had to wait for a seat. Burgers are not huge, you may want to get more than 1... but they are good.

No fuss no muss! These burgers are sooooo yummy. They hit the spot every time. The golden fries are nice and crunchy and have the perfect amount of salt on them. Don't forget to dip them in the garlic aioli. So delish! Small Cheval has a nice outdoor area as well!

If you don't want to wait for 2 hours to have the best burger in the US (not my words - Au Cheval's) - and enjoy the awesome patio while you are at it - this is the place to go. Super cool and friendly staff - unpretentious and welcoming - unlike the sister restaurant. Definitely the go to spot for a burger!
The classic burger with an amazing chocolate shake. I got lucky with a decently short line. Loved that they even have Big Red soda!

Obviously not as great as Au Cheval but a VERY suitable replacement if you don't want to travel to the west loop or wait for hours.  The burgers are still delicious but don't give the option of the fried egg or the delicious bacon Au uses.  But the fries and aoli are still perfect and the seating area outside is very cute and trendy.  Thank god for small cheval

My mouth is still drooling over this place! Chocolate shake was rich and delicious. It balanced perfectly with the savory burger and fries! Highly recommend! When i arrived there was a line out the door and down the sidewalk no worries though! The staff works quick and that line shrinks in no time! 10/10

Best no-nonsense cheeseburger in the city, hands down. Although, it may not offer as many options as its big brother, it still packs a mighty punch. After all, you know what they say: "It's not about the size of the Cheval, it's how you use it." 5-star (if) the burger came with fries.

Mostly hype. Small Cheval is a good burger, sure. I appreciated the quality of the meat and the other ingredients. But... I thought the fries really sucked. I've had better fries almost everywhere. I don't understand why they were so flavorless. I also hated the giant communal table in the room. If you don't want to sit there, you can sit along a bar-type counter that runs along the wall, but then you're staring at the wall, which is weird. If you were grabbing a burger to go, I think this is a fine option. If you want to sit down and enjoy it, Small Cheval is not your jam. (I've attempted to hit Au Cheval twice in the past, only to hear that there was a 2 hour wait. If the food is the same, I don't see any reason to justify that wait.)
We've tried this several times since our take out. It's much better when you dine in. It's so yummy and the cocktails & milkshakes are delish. Wish I. Plus have this without the calories.

You can never go wrong with Small Cheval! The food is great, atmosphere is so inviting on the inside and out, prices aren't ridiculous, and they have a good selection of beer. This is one of my favorite places to go in Wicker Park, and the outdoor area is GREAT FOR DOGS. I bring mine every time I go. There is usually not a bad wait, but if you're lucky there is none at all. Definitely second to Au Cheval in taste of food, but the location and atmosphere of Small beats Au any day!
The cheeseburger was good. The bacon was overkill. The cheese was too salty for me. The price was extremely overpriced. $13+. Like M burger better.

Perfect. We arrived for an early dinner around 5 pm and the line moved very very quick! Great service. Great burger and fries but definitely not cheap. We got two burgers, two fries, and a drink. Came out to $35. But hey - you get what you pay for. They also serve shakes and draft beer.

Word of advice: The line can seem pretty intimidating when they're busy, but don't worry. It goes really quickly and you can get a drink while you're waiting. You order at the counter; wait a short bit for your food, and then sit inside (which is either at the bar around the place or the big family style table) or outside (they have a really nice outside seating area).  The burgers are so worth it. Definitely. I haven't had a shake from there yet, but I'll be back soon!  Also, the staff are pretty attentive and friendly. don't be afraid to ask questions when they're busy. Super efficient; I was surprised how quickly our food was done even with the big Saturday night crowd.

Been here a few times now and if say the burger is very good but doesn't quite love up to the one at Au Cheval. It is a bit cheaper and much easier to get your hands on so I'm sure I'll continue to come back. The two times I've gotten fries about half of them have been over the top crispy while rest were perfect. I usually get an extra patty as well.

Awesome place that lives up the hype! The menu is small as the name indicates, pretty simple menu as well. Even though in a small building they do have a decent sit down dining area, it is more community table than separate tables. The burger and fries are delicious, they got it down to a science here. One of the best burger and fry combos I've had. Truly gourmet stuff, once you try this place it will be hard to pass this up as your go to burger spot.
$25 for a burger, fries, and beer seems a bit over priced.  Specially since other than the sauces, the burger didn't seem that fancy.

I rate this 5 stars for being exactly what it appears to be: A burger place. It's certainly not the cheapest burger place, but when you walk in and see a menu with only 3 items on it (Hamburger, Cheeseburger, Fries), you know the restaurant is dedicated to the dish. Been here twice, got the cheeseburger home style both items. Simple cheeseburger comes with dijonaise, onions, and pickles. Full of flavor, just absolutely melts together in your mouth, finish it before you know it. Fries were perfectly made, borderline too salty... except that the garlic aioli dispenser was over and beyond above what it would take to perfect them. Mmmmm, creamy aioli.  They do also have an extensive beer and liquor list as well as the milkshakes. I grabbed a beer,  but that was nothing particularly special. Regardless, definitely coming back here.
Stupidly delish, nice size dog friendly patio. Good luck finding a seat inside on Saturday afternoon!
Back for a second time and yes, it's just as good or better than the last time. As long as all you want as a burger/cheeseburger you can't go wrong. Sooooo good

I almost don't want to post this because they are crazy busy as is.  It's burgers and fries plan and simple.  What sets them apart is the quality.  Good rotating draft selection.  We are far beyond addicted to their garlic aioli and do not get me started on their spiked chocolate shake.  I know what you are thinking McD's got a shake too, but it's about the proportions.  Outdoor seating area with the smooth relaxing sounds of the 'El' every 15 minutes. It's okay, if you live in the city you've already tuned it out, for those Suburbanites....Welcome to Chicago!  Plus walking distance from the 606 so you can work off all the goodness you just enjoyed.

Small Cheval approaches perfection. Their menu is simple. Burgers, fries, shakes, drinks. The burger is rich with flavor and perfectly seasoned. The fries are also very delicious and the house garlic aioli really seals the deal. This isn't a Kumas-style burger with piled high with ridiculous toppings--which is of course great in its own right. No, this is way more simple, and dare I say, even more delicious.

Damn. ..that was one helluva burger and fries.  Definitely worth the hype.  Love how they keep it simple,  because they do it right.  Would have loved a cold beer with the meal, but was in lunch break.  maybe a little on the pricey side, but worth it on occasion.

What makes a burger you might ask? Grilled onions of course!! Those caramelized strings add moisture and succulent flavor to any entree.  So, Small Cheval, why no grilled onions on those perfectly tender burgers of yours?

Such delish guilty food. I know the flavors of Au Cheval all to well, but when I was returning a car to Enterprise in Wicker Park and saw this installment, I hoped it was a sister property. Once I turned in the car, I quickly went to try this place, and I was 100% not disappointed  I ordered a cheeseburger and golden fries, and this cheeseburger still remains to be one of the betters I've had; dipping it in their garlic aioli I'm thinking was a good choice, since I couldn't stop after the first dip . They have sweets beer, and shots, which I didn't try, but I will go back soon on an empty stomach. If you have time, seriously go to their location on Randolph and have their fried chicken... oh sooooo good.

I've been to both Small and Au Cheval---Both very good burgers but on 2 different levels. I dont think you can substitute the experience of Au Cheval by going to Small Chevaul--However, the burger and fries at Small Cheval were still great. Seating is still pretty limited and cramped inside (went during the winter when the patio was closed) and I thought the pricing was just a touch too much for what you get---but still very good food. I'd split 1 order of fries between 2 people--unless you want to hate yourself after this meal

This place is great if you're craving delicious hamburger or cheeseburger with yummy French fries because it's how big their menu is.  They do serve alcohol.  Casual atmosphere. Fast service. Sit yourself kinda place. Can get pretty busy especially at lunch times.  Never need to big sister restaurant Au Cheval but according to my other half it's very good! So I will just have to see it for myself.
Hands down best burger I've had in a very long time.  Also we had fries and a shake. But best. Damn. Burger.

My boyfriend and I had been dying to try Au Cheval for the LONGEST time, and couldn't contain the excitement when we learned Small Cheval was a thing, and on our route home from work none the less. From all of the outstanding Yelp reviews and testimonies of friends my expectation was undeniably high.  We finally went yesterday on our way home, we each ordered the cheeseburger with bacon and a side of fries, I also ordered the chocolate shake. The fries with garlic aioli and house made ketchup were delicious and the shake was a thick and creamy delight. The burger on the other hand was just average. We've been hunting down the best burger and this falls third on my list. The sadly now closed Old Fifth burger ranked number one followed by VPT burgers. Small Cheval's burger tasted like a standard backyard BBQ burger, nothing to write home about.  The environment was really cool, staff was friendly especially the gentleman taking our order. I would definitely go back for a shake and some fries, maybe next time I'll even add a shot to my order. The burger I probably wouldn't go back for unless it was a more reasonable price based on flavor.

Simply the best cheeseburger in the USA. People need to stop comparing it to its bigger brother Au Cheval, this is a much faster and tastier experience.  The burger is the juiciest, cheesiest, most mouthwatering mouthful you will ever experience in your life.

THE BEST BURGER EVER.  It has a great environment with a huge shared table in the middle, so the wait never seems bad at all!  The menu is pretty simple, which is fine because the house style burgers are quite literally perfection.  I have gone the past two weekends in a row (WHOOPS!). I found free street parking just a block away.  If you haven't been... Run, don't walk!
Doesn't compare to the original on Randolph imo (only difference is the egg but it truly makes it a better burger) but when it's near midnight & you're hangry this sure as hell will do!

Pretty good burger overall. Pricey for what you get but it's yummy. Wish it was same as Au Cheval - would pay the difference but the original is hard to get in to often! Worth trying. Shakes are good - like the spiked flavors. Fries good but wouldn't mind a few more for the price (they're potatoes so they could afford to give a bigger serving!) Recommend with knowledge of these few things in mind.

Great place for burgers.  Just delicious.  My daughters barely take a breath before they hoover it down...atmosphere is diner-esque, and a bit pricey for a burger.  I highly recommend for a no nonsense burger joint with a shot and a beer.  But that is almost the entire menu!  Do not go here expecting options.  They do one thing for dinner.  And the do it well.  Burgers.
I order my burgers with one slice of cheese and the aioli on the side.  What a yummy burger though.  Salty fries.  Love this place.  No parking though, always a nightmare! Yum
I finally  made  it here last month.  GREAT  burgers and fries. But it's basic no frills. Drinks  were good. Very casual.

Loved this place! Only items on the menu are burger, cheeseburger, and fries plus a selection of drinks, and everything is delicious. For someone who hates making decisions and loves burgers, this is the perfect spot. The seating area is also super cute with a few counter top seats and a community table, and picnic tables outside with lights strung up overhead.

Let me just start by saying that I've not yet been to Au Cheval, so this isn't a comparison review, simply a straightforward opinion on this little burger joint.  Hubby and I were on our way home yesterday after a long, atypically stressful round of events for a Saturday. We were hungry and the thought of cooking or even browsing our freezer contents was a no-go. We needed comfort food and it had to be in the area. Throwing all caution to the wind, we decided to finally give Small Cheval a try, knowing full well that we might regret it due to the potential weekend lines.  We walked in at around 6:30, and we couldn't quite open the second inner door just yet due to the crowd. Neither one of us were willing to back out though, so we kept our knowing glances to ourselves. Surprisingly, it only took about ten minutes to find ourselves at the front of the line, and hubs ordered the house-style bacon cheeseburger while I opted for a hamburger, pickle only, and chose to slather one of their in house ketch-ups (not the Heinz) and the garlic aioli on my burger. We both ordered a shake and fries to complete our meals & were happily on our way home within maybe 15-20 mins tops! (Yes we decided to be gluttonous in the comfort of our own home as it's mere blocks away.)  We got home and dug in immediately. Hubby was so delighted with his bacon cheeseburger and kept remarking how awesome the cheese was. I had to sneak a bite, despite my aversion to onions, and I had to agree the they make a killer cheeseburger. I wasn't envious however, as my personal concoction of the house made ketchup, garlic aioli, and their awesome thin sliced pickles were the perfect combination for the burger! The meat patties were cooked to perfection, crispy on the outside and pink and juicy on the inside. Im all of 5' tall and I almost inhaled that entire burger. The fries were crispy and salty, even after the short car ride home, and just delicious dipped in the ketchup, aioli, or both - that said, the portion is huge, and we could've shared, especially with the generous burgers! The shakes were thick and creamy with an almost malt-like quality, which I love, and against my better judgement, I finished about 1/3 of mine before my tummy protested too much. I'm looking forward to revisiting that goodie in the freezer!  All in all, this place has such a small menu because they do everything to perfection, and with an effortlessly pleasant & speedy service. Props to people who eat in, as I was an unforgiving, greasy, and oh-so-delighted mess!
Good food, interesting seating. Friendly staff. Would definitely come again. Their garlic aoli is great.

Cute, charming, delicious. I don't think the burgers are quite as amazing as Au Cheval but they are still awesome and well worth the trip. Its nice to sit outside when the weather permits and the laid back atmosphere is great. One of my favorite new spots for a quick bite.

Uh-may-zing. I expected nothing less but was still totally blown away by Small Cheval. We waited in line for 20 mins last Sunday during the gorgeous warm February weather we're weirdly having. Everyone chatted excitedly in line about either A. How good it is or B. How good they expect it to be. When we finally got in the doorway, hubs grabbed 4 stools facing a window while the rest of us placed orders. I got a cheeseburger, homestyle (but no onion!), add bacon, fries, and a chocolate shake. Hubs got the same only +onion, and vanilla shake. The crew we were with got similar orders. One got a beer. The line moved quickly and easily and the guy taking our orders and money was cool without pretension, friendly without glomming on us, and very efficient. We got our buzzers and made our way to the condiment table. TWO kinda of ketchup! GARLIC AIOLI! COME ON. I loaded up on both and sat down to wait. A mere 10 mins later, our food was ready. We dug in immediately. Fries were salty, crispy, deliciousness and especially incredible with the garlic aioli. Then... the burger. THE BURGER. Crispy thin double patties, gooey melty cheesy, juicy delicious beef. Omg. Easily one of my top 3 burgers of all time. SO GOOD. Then after sufficiently stuffing myself with burger, I enjoyed the rich, creamy, thick milkshake. Again, amazing, and even more so with the dollop of real amazing whipped cream on top! I can't say enough good things about Small Cheval. It's small, it's affordable, it's casual, quick, quirky, fun, and SO DELICIOUS. If you haven't made your way here yet, go now! Now! Now!

I'm surprised I haven't written a review yet. So I'll just write my review based on my last visit this weekend. It was so nice out that I immediately thought of lunch at Small Cheval since it has a great outdoor seating area. The inside is pretty basic. It's a burger shack. Burgers, fries, shakes and beers. If you want anything else, go somewhere else. They derived from Al Cheval and the best burger in Chicago. I'm not decisive enough to say this is the best. But it is damn good. The fries are okay. The shakes are nice. The beer selection is good. The pricing is rough. You are paying for the name as well as quality. The service is always nice and it's an efficient system with buzzers and the condiment station. I'm a fan.
Simply the best burger in Chicago. Outdoor area is great but a bit noisy with the train overhead.

It's sort of hard to describe perfection but here it goes. From the perfectly toasted, buttery bun to the hamburger patties themselves to the dijonnaise to the perfect slices of bacon that topped the whole burger off, you would be hard pressed to find a better burger anywhere else around. This is not to even mention the perfectly complimentary golden, salty, savory french fries that accompany this amazing burger. Small cheval offers an amazing burger and fries combo that anyone who enjoys a good burger joint and hasn't tried it before definitely should take the opportunity to do so.
Best burger I've ever had. And I've lived in Southern California, raised with in n out. Get a cheeseburger with bacon and split a chocolate shake, HEAVEN

What a great place ! Possibly the best cheeseburger I have ever had, and I've had a few in my day! Quick, delicious. Most impressed at how intact the Burger stayed as I ate it, no mess everything was held together nicely in that awesome bun! I'll be back for 2nds!

Let me preface this by saying, I have no patience..  So, when I heard that Au Cheval had the most amazing burger but that the crazy long lines and no reservations would keep me from finding out for myself....curses!!!   So when I realized that small Cheval opened right down the street from my house I thought jesus had answered my prayers personally! OK, that's a bit dramatic but in all seriousness this place is really solid.  Granted, the menu is strictly burgers and fries but that's all you need.  Small inside but cute little patio in the summer.  The burgers are really tasty, make sure to add bacon, trust me.
Amazing burgers and fries! Community seating. Cold beer. I would recommend to all looks no for great food in a casual atmosphere. You may even make a new friend!

The burgers are not as good as Au Cheval. I've been a few times and maybe it was the weather but last time I ate here in the summer time the burgers tasted better - more like Au Cheval.  The place is super tiny on the inside and the music is emo AF. The shakes are amazing tho. I wish they had pickle spears... and I wish the bacon was at least a little more like the Au Cheval's.  I would recommend that you try this place but just know that this experience and burger is nothing at all like Au Cheval and really cannot serve as a substitute for the original Au Cheval.
When you want to eat unhealthy food, eat delicious unhealthy food. This is it. The cheeseburgers, fries, garlic sauce, milk shakes- worth every calorie.

This is my favorite spot for a burger! I like how it's a walk up counter and comes out so quick. The burger is so delicious nothing comes close the flavor is so unique. The fries are also really great don't forget to drench everything in the garlic aioli to make it complete.
Our go to cheeseburger place despite The plethora of burger places that is Chicago land. Perfect meat cheese and bun combo.

I am embarrassed to say I avoided going here because I thought there was no way it could be comparable to the original. I used to live diagonally across the street from Au Cheval, which was both a blessing and a curse. I only recently lost the 25 pounds I gained a year ago; a direct result of living in the West Loop. But I digress. This burger IS PHENOMENAL. It's not the exact same as the original. the bun is different for sure. The fries are different (don't think these are fried in beef or duck fat) but wonderful. I can't believe anyone could complain about a thing here because it was truly magnificent. I also love talking to the people at the front counter. They are always friendly and a joy. I'm going to be a regular here now. Guess I better accept some of the 25 pounds might come back. Spoiler alert: I'm more than okay with that.

I've always heard about all of the hype of small cheval and au cheval, I finally decided to stop by small cheval before a bulls game. Got the cheeseburger and fries . They were both exactly what I expected . So good. The garlic aioli was addicting as well.

I wanted to try Au Cheval for the longest time but I lack the patience required to wait for a table. Then one day someone suggested I go to Small Cheval since it was the burger I was after. This was a good suggestion! We went early. No wait! We ordered the cheeseburgers with everything plus bacon and fries. All was so good! Portions seemed normal then we started eating and realized how much food we had and it was a lot!  My bill for 3 people was $60 which is a bit much for 3 burgers and fries and no alcohol, but in reality we could have shared fries and skipped sofas. I liked the sauces and homemade ketchup.  Would we do it again? Yes.

Pretty Good. not quite as good as Au Cheval but obviously the wayy shorter wait time  (I only waited 5 min for my burger) and cheaper prices ($10.95+ $3.50 for bacon at au cheval vs $9.95 + $2 for bacon) made up for the difference in quality. The restaurant has a cool, laid back vibe where you can seat yourself on a giant community table or on a bar stool and pick up your food at the counter when it is ready. I actually liked the atmosphere more than Au cheval because it wasn't as dark and crowded.  Overall, I could definitely see the difference between Au Cheval and Small Cheval (the bacon was just plain bacon while Au Cheval has thick maple glazed bacon), the bun at Au Cheval was more firm and held it's shape more while Small Cheval's bun was more like a fast food burger bun. Honestly, I think I would have liked this place more if the burgers were a few dollars cheaper because it definitely did not seem like a $12 burger. However, this burger is definitely beyond a normal In-n-out or other fast food burgers- I think the secret is in the meat to cheese to bun ratio- all the flavors were really balanced in each bite.  The fries were a lot cheaper here than Au Cheval- fries are $5.95 at Au Cheval while $2.95 here and they tasted just like the fries from Au Cheval- super crispy on the outside, fluffy potato on the inside- I could get a giant bucket of those and a pint of the garlic aioli and have that be my diet for the rest of the month!

So good that I'm writing this review to let the world know how dank this is while my bf is still eating his burger (took probs 4 minutes to finish or less) #dank #thatgoodgood #wouldcomeagain #wishigotbacon

Greasy burger check. Crispy French fries check. A delicious, thick milkshake check. Garlic aioli, need I say more?! If you're on a low carb or healthy diet, prepare to break all those habits here. You walk in and order immediately on your left. Their menu has a total of three menu options: cheeseburger, hamburger and fries. Choose wisely. They do have a decent selection of drinks (soda, beer, certain shots and milkshakes) and a good condiment section. There's a large square table that's community seating and then seating all along the wall.  The burger was surprisingly two patties instead of one and it was covered in grease, including the buns. The fries are perfectly crispy but almost too salty. The milkshake was the best part of the meal and was just divine. Almost everyone there had a beer or milkshake and I highly recommend the milkshake. It's not too sweet but it's nice and thick, just the way I like them. Overall it was a good burger joint.
