Sooooooooooo good! Burgers are great, music is great, employees are great! Cute little beer selection and great aoili. I can't wait till it's warm again so I can nom burgers out on the patio!
Perfect cheeseburger! Not too oily. Tasted great, well cooked, good toppings. Fast service. Fries were yummy too! Will def be coming back for more!
Top-notch burgers,, relaxed atmosphere, great service.

I had been wanting to come here for the longest time and last night it finally happened. Yes, the burgers are everything and then more of what people say they are. This place is small indeed with bench style seating and a small menu, like 3 items small. But those burgers OMG. There are a couple beers available and some cocktails but I'll save that for another night, I am so glad I was able to enjoy this delicious burger, there simply are not places like this in the suburbs, a true neighborhood institution of classic grub.

Please please please do not come here as a substitute to trying Au Cheval.  I don't care what people say, the burgers are in different classes and the Au Cheval burger should be on everyone's bucket lists.  The buns are similar and you get double patties when you order a single.  Outside of that, you get downgraded on the bacon (not the iPhone sized pork belly glazed with maple syrup that Au Cheval offers) and patties seem to be a different blend (more coarse and less juicy) than Au Cheval.   With that said, Small Cheval's burger is good! It's just not a masterpiece. Small Cheval's patio is a great place to grab a burger and beer in the summer time so long as you can handle the blue line stopping your conversation while it passes every 10 or so minutes.  If you've never been, I'd check out Small Cheval soon because once these residential developments on Milwaukee and the immediate surrounding areas finish this place is going to be a zoo!
Good burgers, great fries, decent shakes!  A small version of Au Chavelle in a different neighborhood of the city. A must try if you haven't been. Will return.

The most delicious burger I have had in Chicago this far!! I got the cheeseburger with all the house toppings and it was incredible, complimented by delicious fries with aioli sauce. I would definitely recommend this place if you are going with one or two friends. Since it is all bar stool seating it is not great for a large group, unless you come in the nice weather when you can eat on the patio. Also, they have a fun craft beer selection that included some local breweries like Hopewell! I will definitely come back here soon!
Went to Au Cheval for my 21st. What an amazing meal. Absolutely will continue to stop off at Small Cheval for a casual burger.

great burger, definitely filling. added bacon. a little pricier than i expected and i just got a burger and fries. that aioli though! love when you can get a great tasting burger, top notch ingredients (the fries too!) and not feel greasy afterwards.
Great staff, great burgers and shakes. Love the patio in the summer we walk the dog here. Makes a great lunch spot if you want a food coma after :)

I went with 2 friends to this place, we ordered regular cheeseburgers, fries, and I ordered a Chocolate shake. Between the three of us we all agreed that everything tasted like it was sourced from the nearest McDonalds. Service was fine, and I liked the location itself, but it's clear to me that they are just trying to cash in on their recent cheeseburger notoriety. I've been to Au Cheval and there is no relationship I can see between the two aside from name.

I had never been to either restaurant but I heard it was the best burger so I wanted to try it.  The burger was just ok... very salty, the fries were good and plentiful to share and the vanilla shake shake was thick and very good. One and done.
Delicious burger and fries, the garlic aioli sauce is also really yummy. Good beer selection and great shakes, this is our go-to place in the neighborhood when we are craving a tasty burger.

For any Californians looking for their In-N-Out fix, this place gets the job done. Nothing matches the original (of course), but it is the closest any place has gotten out here in Chicago. Great burgers, fries, shakes, and of course, that garlic aioli.

There are 2 types of burgers.  There is the done up, gourmet burger with interesting flavor combinations that you might never have thought of.  Maybe they char grill a thyme and rosemary infused bun, and have a combination of five different artisan cheeses with pickled onion and a quail egg on it, or something like that.  I love burgers like that and they have their place when the mood strikes.  Then, there is your simpler burger where you are just looking for a great cheese, quality ground beef with a nice smokey flavor, a soft spongy bun with some top of the line basic condiments and some good ass bacon on it.  This place is the latter option and it is the best of non done-up burgers that I've ever had anywhere.

Great option for when you don't have 4 hours to kill waiting for a table at Au Cheval. Having been to both, I will say this compares fairly well, but does not beat Au Cheval. But what can??  Anyway, the burger here is delish as are the fries and sauces. Def get the bacon or you'll be sad.

Here's the million dollar question. How does this place compare to Au Cheval? I think Au Cheval is better.  But here's the other question: if you are in Chicago for a visit and you want to visit Au Cheval or Small Cheval, which should you go to? In other words, is Small Cheval similar enough that you can forgo that long ass wait at Au Cheval? If you are in Chicago for a brief period of time and want to try the famous Au Cheval burger that has topped all those best cheeseburger in America lists, do not come here. Go to Au Cheval and wait.  Because the burgers at this place are just not as good, and not similar enough to Au Cheval that you'd get close to the Au Cheval experience.   Why? The burger here has the double patties, but that's where the similarities stop for me.  The bacon at Au Cheval is much better, and they also let you add an egg to the Au Cheval burger.  One reason I love Au Cheval so much is because of that bacon.  Without it, it's basically just a decent cheeseburger without anything special. Add that egg, and to me you have the perfectly prepared ingredients that make up the perfect burger.  Also, Au Cheval has better side dishes, where you can add egg on your fries. Note that the fries themselves are otherwise are the same across both restaurants.  This place is basically a burger stand.  Very casual, where you go up to the counter and order your burger and then sit down at a big table or at one of the counter tables and eat your burger.  It is pretty no fuss and no frills.  You get your burger pretty quickly.  The cheeseburger here is $9.95, with $2 extra for bacon.  The hamburger is a dollar less, at $8.95.  Fries are around $2 for one serving, which can be shared between two people.  Probably one order of fries is good per two people, unless you are really hungry.  As a comparison, the cheeseburger at Au Cheval is $10.95 with an additional $3.50 for bacon.   The one thing I thought was pretty cool about this place is that they let you get alcohol.  For example, you can add bailey's to your milkshake. To me, because I no longer live in Chicago - I would just go wait in line at Au Cheval for that burger because there is nothing like it to me (not even at Small Cheval).  If you live in Chicago though, this is a fast and decent cheeseburger.
I think about going to this spot all the time. Garlic aoli is spectacular. I don't even use ketchup for the fries. I always add lettuce and tomato. Chocolate shake is a must.

I leave here STUFFED and SATISFIED.  This place is consistent, and the burgers with a side of garlic aioli is the way to go!  Seating is a little tight in the winter but the summer outdoor seating is one the nicest in the city.  GO HERE FOR THE BEST BURGER IN THE CITY!
The single patty burger with fries is my favorite treat! Burger is cooked just right, fries are perfectly crispy!

The best burger! Wrapped in lettuce to make it gluten free. And they make an effort to note the allergy and keep mine away from the other bread. Fries are safe to eat too and delicious with the garlic aioli.
Best burger I have ever had for now...! Great juicy patty that was cooked to perfection. Fries were amazing as well. Will be back and will try the shake too.

Cute and trendy aesthetic. Good music playing. There were just a few options here which makes ordering easy. I appreciated that they had a nice beer selection. The Seattle cider is really yummy, especially for the holidays. I'd say that burger patty itself was pretty average, but, the sauce was delicious enough to make this a great bite. Loved that the fries were super crispy. Highly recommend. Will be coming back.

Let me put it simply--if you want the famous au cheval burger without the au cheval wait, this is the spot. In the summer it's an awesome outdoor spot to eat with a finely curated tap list. The menu and offerings are straightforward--just burgers, bacon, fries and shakes--as it should be.

You are not so busy anymore ... why salty burgers and its ok not the best salty and yes salty...... also not cheap and the service is great, nice location great beer not cheap but have you tested your food lately.  try a mystery dinning company,,,,, i have eaton many times with you but the burger is SALTIER    NOW THAN WHEN YOU OPENED. CHEF ..... test your great food.   best burgers in Chicago .... you guys are in the top 50 not 10 for sure. fix your restaurant. you know how to do it ?

Pros: - Tastes just like parent company Au Cheval - Fries are amazing and crisp - Garlic Aioli sauce is in a dispenser, to take at your own wanting. Goes great with the fries and the burger - Very casual setting - Workers seem to love and support the restaurant's values - Very clean interior, cabin style Cons: - There's no option to add a fried egg like Au Cheval - When it gets crowded it feels like there's no room

This place is perfect if you are in the mood for the same flavor as Au Cheval, without the egg, or wait.  The Good: I was in and out within 15 minutes.  The taste was amazing, with the same flavor you'd get from the full restaurant.  The Bad: You can't order egg, and the bacon is thin average bacon.  Small Cheval does NOT serve the thick cut honey glazed bacon that really makes the burger at Au Cheval. In a pinch - there is no better place, but be warned your meal is going to be $15 with no drink.

Everybody is all about au cheval and there's so little chatter about this cutie pie. Small cheval is, IMO, better and faster. I find the taste here to be a little more peppery, and a little less rich than Au Cheval. It's also really easy to order here. The time from arrival to food in your hands is usually around 10-20 minutes, which is amazing. My favorite burger, my best friend- Thank you, Small Cheval

The little brother to Au Cheval. Smaller, less crowded burger joint.. yet still huge in taste! Came in on Friday evening, Not too busy.  This is your typical fast causal restaurant. Walk up and order your food and they bring it to you, super fast! Minimal seating inside.. huge community table.  Burger was delicious. Ordered the bacon cheeseburger .. "single" aka double.. juicy and flavorful. Cooked perfectly. They have a side bar of ketchup and garlic aioli (Delish!) small fries and their founders Ale. Great combo!  For those who don't know this. Mmmmmmmm mmmmhmmm. A single burger is actually a double .. a double is actually a triple..

Easily the best burger I've ever eaten. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars here is the fries were unbelievably salty. Like someone couldn't remember if they salted them (but had) and gave them a heavy handed salting for good measure. You had to wipe the salt off of the fries to even consider eating them. Service was awesome and super quick! My dinner companions said the shakes were killer too.

I wish I could get my money back. No, I wish, the order taker would have told me they changed their bun to service those with dairy allergies. That bun tastes like rubber and it ruins the taste of the burger. It's super fucking chewy. So, if you go there, know, it won't have the same taste because according to dude, the bun changed.

WHAT BURGER DREAMS ARE MADE OF! I came here with my friend a few weeks ago and have been drooling over it ever since. The service was quick and friendly, the outside patio looked great as well. The meat was so fresh and the flavor was incredible, not to mention how perfectly melted the cheese was with the buttery bun. The fries were perfection and I would bathe in the garlic aioli if I could. I can't wait to come back here! Plus they had Vernor's ginger ale, doesn't get better than that.
Place was perfect. One of the best burgers I've ever had. I thought my favorite burger was at My Brothers Bar in Denver, CO but not anymore.
Mediocre. Having had an amazing experience at Au Cheval I probably had unfair high expectations...still there's nothing overly exciting about this spot.

While I am not a fan of carryout burgers I have to say this one was delicious and that was after they had been made probably 15 minutes earlier before we got home. Make a stop at this place. It is well worth it. A great burger. Most likely one of the top burgers I have had if I would have had it fresh. The ladies who picked up our carryout were a bit slow getting home as they were sitting there having a beer while they waited. The fries are good as well.

Small Cheval is the offspring of its very well known parent, Au Cheval; a place I've been to a few times. I came here with two of my friends that were visiting me for the weekend in order to skip the unbearable wait at Au Cheval. Honestly, it's ridiculous. I've been quoted 6 HOURS. There was virtually no wait here.  I didn't realize it when we decided to come here, but Small Cheval's burgers are actually smaller than the original that swept Chicagoland. They offer the same two patties, but much thinner bacon and no egg. I truly feel I'm going to die after eating at Au Cheval, so I found this equally delicious version of their burger preferable. It allowed me to also indulge in some fries and a shake, and walk away without worrying that my stomach would explode.  The fries and shake were as notable as the burger, and both my friends agreed that this was the best burger they had ever eaten. However, none of us are avid burger consumers.  IN SHORT, come here. Get everything.

I love this place there is no 3 hour plus wait it is more like 15 minutes or less wait for a delicious juicy burger.   I can get my au cheval burger crave satisfied at small cheval. It will only set you back about $9.95 and you can get their famous fries so delicious! I like their garlic aioli my favorite dipping sauce with their fries.

If you have ~$15 to spend, craving for a double patty burger, with fries, and a chill place to hang out with friends - this is it. While the burgers may seem to be on the pricier side, this place is definetly something to try.  My friends and I were lucky enough to go on a not so busy night so there wasn't any line. I love the whole, order in the front, pay for your meal, and take a buzzer type of establishment because it makes it easier for individuals in a group to order and pay. Definitely a casual place for burgers and beers. Their garlic aioli was pretty bomb for something I suspect is just mass produced without any love. But that's okay, cause it went delciously on both my fries and burgers. I'd come back here for a summer night since outdoor seating was plentiful. Downside was that the CTA runs every other like 5 minutes and it can get noisy though.

These burgers are my favorite. I've been to Au Cheval also, I'm not sure if it's worth the wait when I can just go to Small and it's was closer to me! Burgers and fries always  The have shakes, shots and beers available as well. Staff is fun. Open seating policy, but even when it is super crowded I've always found a spot. They've also changed the layout of the inside over time. This is not a boring spot and I've never left less than satisfied. Last time I went I wished I had gotten another cheese burger to go... haha. I recommend getting cheeseburger with all the toppings. Don't skip out on the golden fries either. There are 2 ketchup options and an aioli option. I get a little cup of each and switch off dipping.

First of all, while you wait in line, someone asks you if you would like a drink while you wait - hell yes I do! Why doesn't every place ask you that question??? I had the pilsner local beer which was great and my husband had the local IPA which he liked as well. We both ordered cheeseburgers house style and shared a side of fries. We both took one bite and knew it was the best burger we have ever had. I did sub out the dijoinaise and added garlic mayo with ketchup and I'm glad I did. My husband contemplated 3 times if he should go back to the line and get another one :). Believe me, he would have if we didn't have plans to go to Mindys for hot chocolate and dessert. If you live in Chicago, you need to make this part of your weekly menu, if you are visiting, you can't leave Chicago without one of these burgers.

I was skeptical at first, due to the limited menu. How can anyone be that confident in two items on their menu (burger and fries)? I was COMPLETELY wrong. I will argue that this is the best burger in Chicago. There are plenty of great gourmet burger spots in Chicago, but this place is hands down the best for a classic, juicy, no fail burger with a side of fries and a milkshake. ALSO-- the outdoor patio is a perfect hangout with friends (and your dog!) Don't doubt. Just go.

AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!!!  what a great burger, the French fries, the garlic sauce, tomato sauce and the milkshakes are a perfect combination for a great flavor!  Unfortunately I can't give it a five star because I found very uncomfortable if not upsetting the really bad attitude of the guy who takes the orders, grumpy face all the time ( he is upset all the time!!!!) poor communications skills with costumers and more upsetting the way he looks (in a very upsetting way) at families with children.  My boyfriend and I were surprised of how unprofessional his attitude was towards them, every time a kid make any kind of noise he was upset about it his facial expressions were not quite friendly . Finally the guys in the kitchen were awesome! They had a great attitude !  Thank you for  messaging me ! DEFINITELY A FIVE STAR RESTAURANT!! Thank you for addressing the problem, the last couple of times I went there the guy taking orders had a nice attitude very very cool

Now that I think about it, Small Cheval tastes a lot like M Burger. But I gave M Burger four stars, not sure why but I do like M Burger more lol.  Burgers are good quality but nothing like "WOW my life has changed". Fries are good, and the garlic aioli is awesome. They also serve Sir Kensington condiments, which is great.  Will have to go to Au Cheval to try the life altering burgers, but this does hit the spot when you have a taste for burgers and too lazy to go anywhere.

My second time in Chicago and the first place that I really liked. Amazing burgers. They have every ingredient figured out. Before you even ask your question they have an answer because they know what people want. I ended up eating twice as much than I could.

This location has a limited menu but the food tastes just a good.  I had the cheeseburger with everything, fries and a chocolate shake on a lettuce wrap (gluten free option). The burger was tasty as well as the fries. The shake was a nice addition to the meal. We sat outside in the back and I enjoyed the atmosphere.

3 1/2 stars if considering things that arent food I was really excited to try this place. Ive always heard amazing things about Au Cheval's famous 'best in the us' burger so expectations were high. tdlr: Good place to bring large group of rich drunk friends on a friday night for an unusually creamy/overall meh burger and drinks. Come if you like mayonnaise. Get a shake. Cute atmosphere. Overpriced/overrated Burger: Single cheeseburger (2 patties) come out to a bit above $10 with tax and comes with dijonnaise, red onions, and pickles  The meat on the burger itself was nothing special and formed into thin patties cooked medium. The patties did have a decent crust on them and black pepper pepper on both sides (both are signs that they know what theyre doing) The cheese was between the patties (nice!) and on top of the meat. They used yellow american cheese which adds no taste (american cheese sucks and isnt cheese) but is melty  Bun was only a little sweet (good), quality, and came toasted Dijonnaise was REALLY piled on there and only tasted like mayonnaise with no dijon kick/contrast with the rest of the burger. I did think it was a nice that the red onions were chopped instead of sliced. Im not a fan of sweet pickles so I got my burger without them, and since theyre sweet I dont think theyd provide much contrast and would just be lost in the overwhelming creaminess Overall burger had very little/no contrast (taste or textural). If you have to add expensive bacon or a fried egg to a burger (recommendations i always see for au cheval) for it to taste good youre doing it wrong I didnt order the fries since they didnt look like anything special. The shakes did look really good and were a fair size for the price (considering the priceiness of the burger and basically everything else here) The staff here are very kind, have a good attitude, and move quickly and efficiently. The place itself is pretty cute if you care about that stuff (I honestly only care about food). Theyre open late and have a large patio with picnic tables and pretty string lights.  Small Cheval is on milwaukee walking distance from the damen blue line north of all the bars. The neighborhood is bucktown so expect trust fund hipsters, yuppies, and yoga moms I wont be coming back here but Im interested in trying Au Cheval's cheeseburger to see if its any better or if people in the midwest are just tweaking

I usually do not like burgers, I find them to be a big slab of flavorless ground beef with toppings, so I probably only eat them a couple of times a year... but after trying a cheese burger from this place I can't wait to go again! I am honestly not a big meat eater, and was a bit put off when I saw there were two beef patties on their burgers.... but man... I finished the whole thing! I didn't need to add any ketchup either. I did order the fries but I didn't think they were that special to be honest. Even though the burger was good on its own, I am happy to see they serve Sir Kensington products. I love the ketchup they make. This is a heavy meal though, so go hungry! I also tried their chocolate shake with bailey's.... oh... my God. My boyfriend had the chocolate shake but he preferred mine. It makes for a pricey shake (I believe $8 with Bailey's) but it's a treat!

This burger will be a party in your mouth. Ridiculously good. One of the BEST burgers I've ever had. Simple ingredients done very well. A bit spendy in my opinion but if the mood strikes me again for a burger, I'd go back b/c I know how exceptional it will be.

Came here last night with a few friends. Was able to quickly order and sit outside on the patio. If you can't find time to wait in line at Au Cheval, come here for the same famous burger and fries for a much shorter wait.  While I thought the burger was good, it wasn't omg good. Maybe I just had too much of an expectation? Certainly didn't seem like one of the best in the country...certainly wasn't the best I've ever had. The fries were good with the garlic aioli.  No need to rush back. I got to get the Au Cheval burger everyone talks about. Over rated. Giving four stars because nothing was wrong with the meal, just wasn't the greatest.

Really enjoyed my first time visit at small cheval! Although we got our food to go, really is a good spot, super casual, and not over crowded. Definitely hit my burger craving! The fries are super good - I want to say they are double fried? Idk what that even means - but either way they were super delicious! Also they have dipping sauces to grab including garlic aioli. As someone grabbing food to-go, I definitely appreciated that they had to-go cups with lids so that I could get a taste! It's the little things... They serve beer too! Nom nom nom

I'm a huge fan of the burger at Au Cheval, but I guess everyone else is too, so I can't get in there too often.  I went to Small Cheval and was excited to find out I can get my Au Cheval burger with a much smaller wait time.  This place is pretty simple; love that they have fun sodas in a cooler self serve and the outdoor patio is great--spacious and cute.  The burger is awesome!  Same with the fries!  The only thing that would make this better would be if they offered an egg on the burger like Au Cheval.  Hands down my fave burger.
The burger is way to salty! And why does it only come 1 way ? Also why a fucking huge community table taking up the entire space ? Why not multiple small tables ???

A double cheeseburger, fries and a can of ginger ale is overpriced at $17.  Food was OK, nothing special.  They have a patio.  You place your order with cashier who gives you a device which buzzes when your food is ready.  You go and get it, so no service except when dealing with cashier. I'm no longer curious about this small building I see on my way home via the Milwaukee Avenue bus.  Not planning on going back.
This is my go to burger spot.  Whether you want to sit down or take out, the food is always great.  Simple menu, liquor, shakes...  The patio area is huge now, and there is plenty of parking.
Best fresh, quick order double burger, Chocolate shake, and fries in a long time; a can't-miss lunch!

mmm found my favorite burger in Chicago!   Came on a Sunday afternoon around 1PM and the line was about 15 people out the door.  The line moves kind of slow since there is only one cashier but there was plenty of seating indoors and outdoors.  The burger and fries were ready fairly quickly and it was delicious, great patties and love their pickles.  The burgers come with 2 patties, I would have been pretty happy to have only 1 patty as the burger was pretty big with 2.  Only thing I didn't care for was the ginger soft drink, it tasted very artificial and left a bad after taste, forgot the brand but it was not Seagrams or Canada Dry.   Definitely will come back again.

Small Cheval isn't quite as great as the big brother Au but still does a fine job. I like the more casual/laid back concept Small Cheval offers. The burger was really good and had the same type of flavor. I think the bun was a little more crisp but it wasn't a bad thing. I didn't get the bacon but I hear it's not the same as Au Cheval's. My burger fix was more than satisfied so I would recommend coming here when you have an Au Cheval craving as it will hold you down. Service was fast and friendly. #RefereEats "I call it like I eat it."
mmmm nothing like 11am burgers and beer after a long weekend of pizza and beer visiting chicago :)
For 10 bucks, you absolutely won't find a better burger. So simple, so good. Fries are legit. 4 dollar beers. Fast service; beats waiting at Au Cheval to get your fix.

I choose this place every time over au cheval. The burger that most people wait three hours for is available here with little to no wait. There's shakes are wonderful and the employees are so nice. Every time I order a burger here I am able to have my meal within a few short minutes. This helps because the wait is absolutely unbearable since it is so amazing! Do yourself a favor and order it the way it comes because you will not be disappointed. I recommend this place to anyone visiting Wicker Park. The alcoholic milkshakes are just a plus. You may want to Uber because the milkshakes are a must try, but parking is available for others. Enjoy!
Burgers are good. Just not $12 good. Over priced for burger king sized burgers. Fries are good.
Addicted. This is located within steps of my house and I could eat here every night! So simple, yet so GOOD. The staff is super friendly and welcoming all hours of the day and night!

Great burger, beat in Chicago. Ha a nice afternoon lunch. Lots of good drinking options if you are up for a session. Definitely a cool layout- similar to a  classic Chicago dog/ burger joint.  Also enjoyed the outdoor seating.
Walked in, walked right out. Horrible service from the start. Came in and signed in, the hostess was incredibly rude, very obnoxious, steer clear, try small cheval in bucktown instead.

Ok, so Burgers are my thing. If I am trying a burger for the first time, I get it just the way they make it. I don't enjoy slathering a burger in so much ketchup or sauce, that you can't taste the beef.  This burger needs nothing on it. It has a luscious flavor. The meat is so flavorful. Their menu is simple, burgers, two kinds. Hamburger and cheeseburger and fries. They have achieved perfection. I think the bun is potato bread, with a golden crust. Dijonaise, pickles, and onions come standard on the burger. The cheese was melted perfect, and the fries were crisp yet soft enough.  The atmosphere of the place is awesome. One large room, with the kitchen open to the dining area. Tin ceiling, and liquor around the wall. They have outside seating, which is cute and allows you to watch the world go by.  They have a limited drink menu, with some liquor options. With the burger as perfect as it was, I regret not buying a cocktail here.  Try this place. If you love burgers, this is where you go.

These burgers are life changing. The garlic aioli? The fries? The milkshakes? God, just writing this review is making my mouth water. Their outdoor seating area is gorgeous if you get the chance. If this place were more affordable on my tight college budget, I'd be here more often but I've eaten here 4 times this past year and each time was phenomenal. A must try! Maybe bike there off the 606 to relieve any food guilt or coma this place will inflict upon you.

In every way this burger was *exactly* what I thought it would be and at minimum met my sky high expectations, would even say it exceeded them. Came here for take out around 7ish on a Monday. Place was 1/3 full dine in with maybe five or so ppl waiting to get their food to go.   Step up to the register and order Cheeseburger w Fries w all toppings offered. Also grabbed a Half Acre Beer//not.daisycutter, was given the buzzer and sat down at the larger communal table in the middle.  In about 7 minutes buzzer goes off, grab and go. Burger, Fries and Beer - $21 and change.   15 minutes later at home, open up and happy to see that this burger traveled quite well and it probably even set up better wrapped in its foil packaging giving it time to rest and allow all the toppings to sort of get happy together. Fries were also still hot and crispy. You know the rest, two seared patties cooked to a perfect medium in true diner style fashion.  The bun is perfect in size, taste, and look for all that is going on with this masterpiece.  They strike the perfect balance with all the ingredients - cheese, dijonnaise, pickle and onion (no bacon necessary imo) - still allowing the excellent beef flavor to shine through.   [X] Will be back -

On a recent visit to Chicago, I was excited when I passed Small Cheval.  I've always wanted to try Au Cheval, but could never stomach the wait time. Overall, decent experience.  The inside of the restaurant is designed to look like a shack...and it feels like a shack.  The outdoor patio is gorgeous, so I would opt for that. Burger: I went with no cheese and added BACON.  I also asked to add lettuce and tomato (available by request).  Overall, burger was pretty good but nothing to write home about.  I prefer burgers with lots of toppings, so it might be better for the "purists." Fries: Great and a huge portion!  The condiments on the side (aioli and two types of ketchup) were great as well. Chocolate Shake: Classic and delicious.  'Nuff said.

Honestly, I don't understand why people wait in 4 hour lines for Au Cheval (I'm guilty of it myself), when they can just come to Small Cheval for an infinitely better burger and little to no wait. I've now been to Au Cheval 4 times and Small twice and really don't understand what the Au Cheval fuss is about. Now that I've had both burgers within a week of each other, I can confidently say the Small burger is superior to the Au burger. Something about the patties, the flavor, and the buns. Both times I've been to Small Cheval I've been in burger heaven, and all times I've been to Au Cheval, I've left pretty underwhelmed. Maybe it's just me, but next time you consider waiting in a four hour line, consider Small Cheval as a worthy alternative.

I haven't been to Au Cheval yet. It's on my list but that wait time is cray. Anyways, stopped here after 606 trail walk and the ambiance is great for the summer. The patio is pretty awesome. The burger is simple and smaller than what you usually find at bar/grills in terms of patty size which is PERFECT for me. I hate fat patties. Why even have a burger. Just eat the slab of meat since you can't taste anything else anyways. I digress. These are basic ingredient burgers but everything tastes very good together. The cheese is gooey, the pickle is refreshing, the dijonaisse is unique. I really enjoyed their fries and the ketchup and garlic aioli they have. I don't give it 5 stars because I personally love creative burgers with different combinations of ingredients but overall I did really enjoy the meal and the service.

From a business standpoint, this place is genius.  $15 bucks for a tiny cheeseburger and some fries?  They must be sleeping on beds made of $100 billls with gold dubloons over their eyes and a headboard made of diamonds. I've been to the actual Au Cheval and the burger there is good.  This is not the same burger.  I find it fascinating that they are marketing it as such.  Have you been to 5 Guys?  Shake Shack?  Epic Burger?  Any sort-of-upscale fast casual burger spot?  If so, you've had this burger.  Better quality meat than McDonald's but not as good as Portillo's... and not nearly as good as a real restaurant quality burger.  Here, a sort-of-fast-food-burger will just cost you more. I do like the options to add booze to my shake, drink a shot with my beer, and sit at a giant picnic table with the sexy-dirty foodie hipsters of the city.  The atmosphere is good, but the food isn't anything special and anyone who is saying it is doesn't know their way around a pile of ground beef.  But if you meet the owner(s) you should probably try to marry them because they must be rich as fuck.

This place is super good. When i first went here i wasn't sure what to expect from the burger, but i definitely wasn't underwhelmed. This place is the "little brother" of au cheval, where I haven't been, but it has definitely stepped out of the shadow and established itself as a damn good burger restaurant. This place knows what it does best, does just that, and does it well. This is probably the best burger in chicago, and the fries are delicious too. The only problem with this restaurant is that it is a little pricey. It's about $12-13 for a burger, which is a little bit steep, but you're definitely paying for quality and good food. Worth a trip for sure.
I'd put this place on par with five guys. I had much higher expectations.

First time eating here read so much good reviews about small cheval.Well after finally trying the cheeseburger here I was very disappointed.It's an ok burger average at best.Price wise no surprise  a decent cheeseburger with fries and drink will cost you $20 at any high end burger restaurant.The chocolate shake was good though.

That Chocolate Shake: 5! Never fails!!! Cheeseburgers are always a hit! Hamburgers are always filling! The condiments... get them all!!! I wish I could buy their Aioli and Ketchup by the gallon! Fries: 4 Nice, large outdoor patio for those hot summer days!
hype.is .real. hype.is .real. hype.is .real. hype.is .real. shot bar, great burgers

Overrated and over-priced. Do not come here expecting a burger that will blow you away (which is what I expected given the name and price). Burger had no real flavor to it. Tasted like a fast food burger on a fancier bun. Also does not come included with lettuce or tomato.... for a burger joint that sells $10 cheeseburgers that seems pretty crazy. Paid $2 extra for bacon but could barely taste the flavor.  The golden fries came in a generous portion, but they were hard as rocks. Garlic aioli sauce and house ketchup were the best food items. I will say that the large outdoor patio space with string lights and vibey music deserves 5 stars. Still, not worth it to come back and waste any more of my money.

Finally got to this place last night, and I'm so glad I did. Service was great and fast, and the food was delicious -- everything I was hoping for. I ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and a chocolate shake with Bailey's, and it was American food perfection. The double patty burger was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of cheese, the fries were a great blend of crispy outside and mushy inside, and the shake tied it all together with its boozy, chocolatey creaminess on a hot night.  Yeah, it's pretty expensive. My husband paid the bill, so I'm not sure, but I think it was in the neighborhood of $65 for my meal, plus his hamburger with bacon, shot of Fernet, and chocolate shake, but I think it was worth every penny.

Again. Everything has been said. With that the cheeseburger with bacon and house style was excellent and perfectly cooked. The fries are utterly perfect - crisp and not greasy. However burger fries and shake with tip was $22. Ample outdoor seating And comfortable seating inside. Don't forget to get $3 shot! Great mix of customers too. Easy access from blue line if coming from cross town.
Virtuosity is the act of doing something common uncommonly well.  Simply an incredible burger, simply.

Lovely, subdued décor, both inside and out; the perfect place to sit out on the patio in the narrow window between summer and fall and enjoy a delicious cheeseburger, some super tasty crispy fries, and a reeeeaaaally delectable chocolate shake. Also, there's garlic aioli by the pump. Amazing! This is a classy joint. Highly recommended.
everything has already been said. it's awesome. it's expensive - but awesome.  fries all day, garlic aioli, and cheeseburger with bacon.

All time favorite burger place !  With only three things on the menu, it makes ordering food easy (:  I like my burgers cooked medium rare, but with thin patties it makes it a little harder to do that.  They could step up their fries game though. Nothing special, but is good with the burger.  Overall, amazing burger and decent fries

Went at 2:30 on a Tuesday with our 16 month old - they have highchairs, yea!  Small inside, bigger outside.  The cheeseburger was great, the fries were amazing as was the garlic aioli.  $42 for 2 cheeseburgers (1 w/bacon), 1 order of fries and 2 beers.

Loved it.  Good beer selection too.  Simple menu; like "in and out."  Ive eaten at Au Cheval as well; best burger in Chicago.  Small Cheval is a great way to get that experience w/o the crazy wait.  Great sister company; great idea.

If you get a full meal here it's going to be expensive ($20ish) but it is worth it! The burger with bacon is one of the best I've had (including the burger from big brother, Au Cheval). The fries are great too, especially dipped in the garlic aioli. Small Chevall will definitely hurt your wallet but end up leaving you satisfied anyway.

I was referred here by a local. I got a cheeseburger, golden fries, and a can of coke. Plus tip, this cost me about $20. That seems very high, even for a high-quality burger joint. The burger was good. I did not like the fries, but they did have a unique flavor that probably appeals to some people. I probably won't go here again, but only because of the price.

Can a Cheeseburger change your life? Here it can!!!!! Small Cheval you rock my world. The saddest part of this review is that I live in California and can't have this more often.To anyone not from Chicago, it's possible your next vacation should happen with the sole purpose of trying this burger.

Having a mini-me is awesome, right?  (Or it would be at least).  Yes, well we know it'd be cool and so does Au Cheval which is why they are "boss" enough to have a legitimate mini-me...and let me introduce Small Cheval.  Small as in the menu, but definitely not in the flavor...in fact, with the exception of the menu there is nothing small about Small Cheval - not the food, not the space itself, and not the personality of the restaurant.  Oh - you know what, I already lied to you.  Small Cheval also has small lines...and that's one small thing that I am completely okay with.  Unlike the mothership you can come to Small Cheval and expect get that juicy burger in your hands within a matter of minutes...instead of a matter of hours.  Hmm...to wait a couple minutes or a couple hours for my food???   I'm definitely not telling you to skip Au Cheval altogether, and in fact I would recommend you going there first, but my gosh - coming to Small Cheval is a better gig if you're looking for something to satisfy that craving but don't have the time and energy to wait at the mac daddy, aka Au Cheval.  The quality of the burgers here at Small Cheval are definitely on par with those that they are making at Au Cheval, but they differ just a little in that when requesting bacon here at Small Cheval you won't be getting thick-cut bacon and all that fancy schmancy stuff.  The toppings here reflect more of a sedated, typical "fast-food" burger but this is NOT a fast food burger.  You must not be so easily deceived.  It sort of has the fast food-feel, but with a funky, fresh twist.  Small Cheval is a great place to come and hang out with friends or family as they have a plethora of seating outside in addition to that inside.   Getting back to the food - the good stuff, the juicy stuff - well, it's just as savory and it hits the spot so perfectly.  As I had mentioned already - the burger is divine, but then again I fully expected that having already eaten at Au Cheval a couple weeks prior.  The burger definitely wasn't as decadent and yet the price for the burger was pretty much the same price - it's my opinion that the burger should have been a little cheaper seeing as how it was more of a "common" burger, if you will.  Your meal simply is not complete without those golden fries though - yes, it's regular fries, but they're fresh and good.  Who doesn't love fries, right?  What truly made my day, though, was the fact that they had a big honkin' dispenser of the garlic aioli which I gladly loaded up on for the purpose of smothering my fries in that yumy goodness.  And now, your meal still is not complete...not without a shake - a boozy shake.  You can get a chocolate or vanilla shake and for about $5 extra you can have them add Bailey's.  Believe me, you want to fork out that extra $5 - it will be the best damn milkshake of your life.  They are generous with the Bailey's in there too - depending on how much of a lightweight you are - you may very well feel it.   If you want alcohol, but not in your shake (but let's be honest - you want alcohol in your milkshake) there are a couple beers on tap and they have a row of shot glasses lined up on the counter so that you can order a quick shot while ordering your food.  Small Cheval knows how to get the party started.  Overall, its quite an enjoyable experience, especially while the weather is pleasant and you have the option of sititng outside.   Let's give a BIG shout-out for Small Cheval!

The next time that I have a craving for a great burger and shakes this is where I will be. This place is a bit different than your regular burger joint, when you first walk in their menu is all the way to the front by the register and there are only two food items (which of course narrows it down and makes it easy to pick). Right above it is their drink menu and if you happen to want an iced soda they will be sitting in a cooler(once again very different than any place I have visited). Food, food was great! The only cheese available for your burger will be sharp cheddar and if you do not like cheddar then I suggest you go elsewhere because what good is a burger with no cheese? They also have no alternative choice for the dijonnaise sauce they add to the burger but they do have garlic aioli which I added to my burger. The content of the burger was delicious. The burger was cooked to perfection and the ingredients are fresh and rich in flavor. They have an outside patio, where you can enjoy great food on a sunny day(inside seating is also available). Next time I am in a mood for a burger this is where I will come!

For a restaurant that's supposed to be the little sibling of the best burger in the city/state/world, I was underwhelmed. I haven't tried au cheval yet but hope it's infinitely better than this "fast food" version of itself. The only redeeming factor is the garlic aioli which helped add some flavor/juice to an otherwise plain and dry burger. I ordered the hamburger house style ($8.95), which doesn't include lettuce or tomatoes fyi. The fries ($2.95) are decent and serve their duty as an appropriate vessel to carry obscene amounts of garlic aioli into my mouth.  I do really like their outdoor patio though which has strings of lights draped across. Order and pay at the counter. The line moves relatively fast.

As a burger expert around the country I was really excited to come here. It's very basic I understand, but there are better places that you don't have to wait so long for or spend so much money that are better. I wouldn't come back and would say if you didn't make it you didn't miss anything. It's average at best, but pricey. Overrated. Now I can't say that worse than places like Five guys, they all kinda aren't great, but it's way more than Five guys  I'd check our Redhot Ranch which isn't far from here if you want a no frills burger, no lines and better. It's like the In n Out of the midwest.  And NO I don't have any affiliation, just helping folk out.

Just tried them for the first time today. It's definitely one of the best burgers in the neighborhood.  I took it to go, and the burger was still nice and warm. The fries were good with the garlic aioli, but most of them got cold on the quick ride home. I wish they packaged them differently for take out. I also had a chocolate shake, which was not bad, but probably wouldn't do it again. The burger and fries are more than enough. They were also pretty quick.

Shockingly, we did not order any food here because we were full from Big Star.  So we opted for one of their cocktails.  It was super sour and I didn't really enjoy it.  I would, however, come back here to try their burger and see how it compares to Au Cheval.  This place has a really cool outdoor area though!

the menu is basic... burger, cheeseburger, add bacon? that's all you need because it was yum. of course i had the works with cheese and bacon. why not? i knew it wasn't going to be like au cheval but i was still sad that i couldn't add an egg on top. all good though... it was delicious! i was slightly, maybe a tad "under the weather" when i dined here so i couldn't partake in the libations.... beer, cocktails, SHOTS! next time, next time. they also have milkshakes that i'd like to try. the star knock off was because of the fries. It was just too much to handle... I got tired of wiping down each one before taking a bite. they were waaaaay over seasoned and salty.

If you come here expecting Au Cheval's quality, you will be disappointed. Prices are on par, but the bacon is not the same thick cut... Also, the fries were hard as a rock. Burger was delicious though.
Blah, blah, blah...not that great.  Just OK. There are so many better burgers in the city- I wasn't impressed. For the cost- I would rather have a Lockdown or Kumas burger hands down!!!

All the perks of an Au Cheval burger without having to wait in line!. The fries were also so good. That garlic aoli... I want to put this stuff on everything. The outdoor area is great for summer and never gets too crowded. Good margaritas too! Best burger in Chicago IMO

Casual quint space, positive/welcoming vibes, small menu (not a bad thing!), $10 per person average but good quality items. No need to travel across town but if walking by in the neighborhood give them a try.

Best "fast food style" burger I've ever had in my entire life, hands down. There is definitely a difference between burgers like this (with small, thin patties) and big burger patties like Kuma's Corner. In terms of thin burger patties, this burger was amazing. It's the perfect blend of salt and seasonings. Five stars for the burger. The fries were OK - could be better. Nice to have fries with the burger, but not necessary and I would pass on the fries if you were on a budget. The shake was good too - but not any better than say Portillo's or any other fast food shake.  Atmosphere was cool. Small little one room restaurant with a big table with open seating and then seats lining the walls. Didn't have trouble finding seating at 8 PM on a Friday night (though it was raining). There is a nice outdoor patio too. Parking in the area was fine (given the rain though). Price overall is expensive - $50 for two burgers, one fry, one shake, two cans of pop, and a beer. To be fair, the burgers are AMAZING. I ate mine in 1 minute or less and wanted another one immediately after I realized what I had done! I'm actually craving a burger now that I'm writing this review...

Alright everyone, listen up: everyone in the general vicinity should stop going to Shake Shack, Five Guys, or any larger / lesser franchises right now and go get your burger fix at Small Cheval.  This is no In-N-Out $3 (or so) double-double, so there should not be any comparison to begin with. This is a completely different price point at about $10 for a burger. The buns are perfectly bouncy with some give, meat patty is juicy and perfect (a single order is two patties), and all the fix-ins just work. Should you want to splurge, go get a bacon add-on. A cheeseburger is just enough for me (and my gf!) Definitely go for some Sir Kensington ketchup / mustard and garlic aioli! Fries give off just the right amount of texture of crunchy exterior and bouncy starchy goodness. Yes it's different than the Au Cheval burger, but this place was designed as a local, casual hamburger bar rather than a full blown restaurant. Wait times are very short if any and are pretty consistent here and they make one of the best burgers (if only under their parent restaurant) in Chicago. This is definitely my stop to go for burgers and I highly recommend this place above all!

This location is a great taste of Au Cheval downtown.  The service and food is quick and the burgers and fries are great! I love the seating outside (except for the noisy Blue line overhead) because I can bring my dog and hang out while we eat.  It's got great soft drinks as well.  If you haven't been, you should try it! If you love a great burger and are looking for a off the beaten path place, or tired of run of the mill burger places, this is your spot! Enjoy!

The location is awesome. If you keep in mind what you going in for, you won't be disappointed!  The burger is great, it has double patties so whoever is trying to not eat that much meat should keep that in mind.  The price is good for this kinda burger, we got 2 cheeseburgers- 1 fries and 2 canned sofas and it set us back about $30  Nice play to just hang out and talk too

Really great outdoor seating area. It doesn't feel crowded outside at all. I could imagine that it would get really crowded on a cold or rainy day. They have 3 things on the menu. Burger, cheeseburger, fries. The shakes looked like a popular choice, but I didn't get one this time. The cheeseburger was great. Double patty on a fresh bun. If really hit the spot. The garlic aoli was nothing spectacular. The burger and fries were better without it.

Excellent burgers and fries - the best I've had in Chicago. The drinks were canned, which doesn't make sense to me - I prefer fountain sodas. If you're in the mood for a good simple burger and perfectly cooked fries, you should definitely stop by. Not a fan of the name though - Not sure why anyone would name a burger restaurant "Small Horse" makes me think of horse burgers...

Small Cheval is the perfect place if you're looking for a delicious burger and fries, but don't have 2 hours to wait in line at Au Cheval in the West Loop. We were in and out of Small Cheval in less than 20 minutes and were impressed by the quality of the food and service. However, it's not the same as Au Cheval (nothing can compare to Au Cheval's famous burger + they dress the burger different), but it was a solid experience and one we would recommend for those in the Wicker Park area.
Their burger has more flavor than that of Kuma's Corner. Not as thick but every bite is packed with flavor. Must try their fries and garlic aioli.

Knowing I was going to pay $10 for a burger AND being spoiled with In-N-Out, I was expecting a lot. The location is awesome. They have a really nice outdoor seating area with 10+ large tables, an indoor area with a ton of seating (and obnoxiously loud music)plenty of shade, and you get to see the train pass by every 10 minutes.  The food was alright, but nothing special. One of the parties on a burger was undercooked, and there was way too much sauce. The pickles and bun were really good, but the burger was just ok - nothing special. Stop by here for a quick bite, it's a cool spot.  The service left something to be desired. The guy taking orders wasn't very personable or welcoming.
The shakes are fantastic.  The cheese burger , wow.!!! And service is fantastic.  The ambience is great.  Au cheval had a three hour wait so we drove here and perfection. This coming from a foodie!

If you are craving a burger, go here! This place does not disappoint. Small menu, but all you would want: Burger, fries, drink or shake! Great outdoor patio seating. Would go here over Au Cheval any day.

I wouldn't go as far as to say that these guys make a bad cheeseburger, it's not like they're serving rancid meat, but the quality of this burger is definitely not on par with the price tag and the wait. The bun is fresh, the beef patties have a good melt-in-your-mouth texture, but the flavor profile is that of a typical fast-food burger.  All I could taste when I took a bite was salt, salt, salt and Dijon mustard.  There is zero beef or cheese flavor at all.   The cheese they use is cheap; it's got a great gooey melted texture, but it brings absolutely no flavor to the table.  I give them credit for blending their own homemade sauces and condiments but that's about where the compliments stop. The bottom line is that if I'm going to pay $10 for a burger I expect much more in the flavor department.  I think this burger is overrated and overpriced and I'd take a Shake Shack or 5Guys burger any day over this place.
Excellent burgers. Wish they were grass fed but they still get their beef from local farms. Milk shakes were excellent as well.

3.5 stars based on food alone but bumping up to 4 stars because I like the simplistic concept of the restaurant itself. The burger was definitely solid but I wish there was a little something extra in terms of flavor, either directly in the meat patties or with some sort of sauce. I say this only as someone from LA who holds In N Out burgers in the highest regard. Cheese was delicious and the bun was good too, although I would have preferred a little extra crispness on the inside of the bun. The fries here are spectacular. I just wish the kitchen had made them ready at the same time as the burger because I had to wait like ten minutes after my burger was ready to actually get my fries. Considering they only make two things here, burgers and fries, the timing on this really should not have been an issue. The place was not super crowded at the time, but I'll give them a pass on this, maybe they were down a fryer or something, who knows. The vanilla shake was tasty and I was delighted by the option to add baileys to it to make it an adult shake. Every place should do this. All in all, this is a good choice when you just want to sit down and enjoy the basics of a good burger, fries and drink without any fuss.

Is the burger amazing? Yes, but be warned they use regular bacon instead of the premium thick cut kind at Au Cheval. Are the fries amazing? Yes, nice and crunchy and the garlic aioli is fab. Are the shakes delicious? Yes.  Food aside, we will never go back because of the rude server behind the counter. We weren't sure where to bring our trays when we were done so we did a lap and settled on the counter where we ordered. The staff were busy and we couldn't get anyone's attention. The blonde server gave us a dramatic eye roll and said accusingly, "There is a trash can right over there where you can dispose of your garbage." Rude.

I really liked the burgers! It was so good and so juicy! But, to me it was just a more expensive In N Out. Which, they don't have any of those here... But, they have the same amount of menu choices, and the same concept. It was good, but it was a tad too expensive for the quality of burgers. I think I prefer In N Out just because it's cheaper, and I think it's a tad better.

Unlimited garlic aioli was the first thing that caught my eye. That and the hipster interior/outdoor eating area also drew me into Small Cheval. As for the food, the burger was good enough and the fries decent, but nothing more than 4 stars.

My favorite place when I just want a burger. This cheeseburger is my favorite. The flavors are perfect and the way it all just melts together is out of this world.  This place gets tough criticism because of its older brother. I will agree with everyone else that it's just not the same as Au Cheval. However, to me this fixes the craving without the crazy wait...and it's designed as a quick order and eat place so they are just on totally different levels. When you arrive here you will just jump right in line to the counter where you'll place your order and be given a buzzer. The buzzer goes off when your food is ready :) It should be noted that they only offer hamburgers and cheeseburgers here, but I did hear the person in front of me ordering a "kids burger" so it sounds like they have a smaller portion for the little ones.  This last Saturday when I visited, it was a little busy, so a server was walking through the line serving drinks if you wanted to order. This was awesome. What a nice touch. I ordered the Seattle Cider on draft and it was crisp and refreshing.  Let's talk food. The cheeseburger. So good. This is definitely an eat it right then and there kind of burger. I can't imagine it would be as good as take out if you're going very far. The first time I visited here my cousin and I split a burger. This only lead to me wishing I had my own burger. You probably need your own burger at this place :) IMO it's dressed perfectly house style, but here you have more flexibility with toppings contrary to its big brother Au Cheval. The fries are also crispy, delicious and well priced. Only 2.95 for a side of fries and my fiancé and I always just split one order. I also love that the condiments are self serve here, hello garlic aioli!  In my book Small Cheval is exactly what I've been looking for. Nothing complicated, just an amazing burger and fries.
Super fun, limited menu but everything on it is good. The patio is unbeatable for a summer lunch. Burger and fries were great, and their fancy aioli and ketchup were delicious!

I haven't been to Au cheval so I won't make any comparisons but the burgers and fries here are really good.  Super juicy and flavorful cheeseburger and awesome crispy fries...can't go wrong. Menu is super simple, which is great. Good local beers on tap.  I'll definitely be going back when I'm in the mood for a solid burger.

I don't see what the big deal here is...I seriously thought the hamburger was mediocre. Also, I think the prices are outrageous for what you're getting. There should be a choice to have more toppings on the burger if you're paying that much. I regret not going to Wendy's and getting an equally as good burger for a much better price. Honestly, the garlic aioli dipping sauce for the fries was better than the actual burger.

Great concept!  I went the other day, no line, fast service and great food. They had drinks on tap, great milk shakes and great beers too.  Yes, it's not quite the same as it's brother store (Au Cheval) but it's still an amazing burger. I think, if I can guess, the buns and meat seasonings are different. Either way, can't wait to come back!!

This burger is awesome! Seriously one of the best burgers I have ever had. Have to get it with bacon or you should start reconsidering your life choices. The menu is small just burger, fries and milkshakes. I've been to au cheval and it's pretty much the same burger. So skip the wait and head to small cheval for a great burger and yummy fries.
Expensive for a quick burger joint and not as good as the original. Cool setup though. Burger and fries are still delicious and they have the garlic aioli sauce!

This place can be pretty dangerous, as I live a 5 minute walk away. The menu is simple, burger or cheeseburger and pick your toppings. But they are so delicious. The fries are awesome dipped in their garlic aioli! They also have cheap shots, beers on tap, and milkshakes with the option of adding booze! There is a large family style table in the middle with seating around the edges of the restaurant or you can dine outside on their huge patio. I love Small Cheval and am always trying to convince my friends to go!

The little sister restaurant to Au Cheval got some game.  Sometimes you have to just take a step back and realize when a great burger is a great burger.   Small Cheval.  *Steps back*. Great burger.  See? But really, every nook and cranny of this burger has been detailed to the last grain.  The beef is succulent.  The bun has that firm yet inviting softness.  The cheese has a nice meltiness, but not too runny.  The onion and pickle give off that clean crisp flavor that you know there was care into selection.  The sauces... don't get me started...  **Sauce Side Note** Sauce on a burger is such an underrated aspect.  A well-made sauce can bring a burger to a new echelon.  It often goes unaddressed with just ketchup, mustard, mayo, or barbeque.  But if you want an amazing burger elevate the sauce and you will get there faster than a frat boy jumping off a roof.   **End note.** ...So Small Cheval's assortment of Homemade sauces are delectable.  From that garlic aioli to the homemade ketchup to the handcrafted mustard to the delectable dijonnaise.  All available at a friendly pump station next to the pickup counter?  Wow.  Saucin', Saucin', I'm Saucin' on you...

Beautiful, beautiful burger. Perfect for those days when you don't want to dress up and shower. Just put on an jacket and a cap and walk to Cheval. Simple unpretentious and fresh. The garlic aioli is the magic ingredient, same for the slaw in the burger. People are nice and the interiors are clever unlike its pretentious elder brother in west loop.  Perfect spot for early summer evenings to sit out under the string lights in the back patio and bite into a juicy satisfying American Classic. Fries please.....with the shake.
Not a lot to say other than the best burger I've had in Chicago.  Well done, SC...Well Done!

One of the best burgers I've had. Great fast service. The ONLY thing that bothered me and caused me to cringe was when the young man who hands off your food to you once your order up kept brushing his hair back with his bare hands (eewwwwwhhh). Needless to say that I immediately told him that I'd rather pick up my own basket of food once it is completed because I felt uncomfortable with what I witnessed. I did mention to him why (maybe should've) but...he was gracious and didn't mind me grabbing our food our own once it became ready for pick up. Just think that when your serving food to others, you should be mindful not to put your hands in your hair, nose or mouth!! But other than that, it's actually 5 stars! Great shakes and the fries with aioli garlic sauce were superb! Will definitely return soon! But I hope dude refrains from putting his hands in his hair in between touching people's food baskets or packing their to-go bags!

Have not tried au cheval yet. But this is hands down my FAVORITE  burger I've had in Chicago. Not really prepared to wait two hours for au cheval so I'll stick to this. Their garlic aoili is on point. Grab and burger and hang out in the back patio on a nice day. You won't regret it. Unless your lame and don't like burgers.

Wait, what?  I haven't reviewed this yet after many trips?   I admit, I've been to Au Cheval once and i didn't have the burger, so I can't compare the Small Cheval burger to it, but this burger is darn good! I love the atmosphere and the really friendly staff.  Everyone is so nice and friendly that when you are smooched in seats (if busy), you still don't feel too terrible about it. The burgers are delicious.  I hear they are slightly smaller than Au Cheval, and I don't know if I'd need any burger.  The cheeseburger is amazing - juicy, flavorful, perfectly covered in cheese.  Yum.  I occasionally dip in a nice helping of ketchup.  Yum.  The fries are also quite delicious.  I haven't gone for bacon, but maybe on one of the next trips. Good selection of beers and there's also a giant cooler for water if you're thirsty. I highly recommend the outdoor patio, but inside is just as cozy if the weather isn't nice.

Just went to Small Cheval for lunch an hour ago. It was our second time here, and I just had to put in a five star review for this place! I am not a huge burger person, but after we came here two weeks ago, I really craved their cheeseburger this afternoon! I'm officially hooked on the Small Cheval burgers! Food: Their menu is super simple, which I love! - Hamburger - Cheeseburger - add bacon - Fries - Milkshakes - A limited bar Cheeseburger: I haven't had their hamburger but their cheeseburger is the way to go. It's double patties, and they melt the cheese all over the patty, and the buns are toasted on the grill. Their "house style" includes this dijyonnaise sauce with some red onions - I love it that way, I recommend it. I also dunk my burger in the special ketchup and it's amazing! Sauces: They also have two kinds of ketchup, garlic aioli, and mustard. I recommend the garlic aioli and the ketchup thats not the Heinz kind - taste more salty and less sweet compared to the heinz. French fries: They make the french fries out of fresh california potatoes. They are thicker cut and cooked just the right amount, not greasy, just crispy on the outside and moist in the inside. The Garlic Aioli tastes amazing with the french fries. Shakes: Recommend the vanilla - they use good quality ice cream, you can see the vanilla bean dots in the shake - super yummy! Comes piled with whipped cream. They also have chocolate for the chocolate lovers - but I haven't tried that myself. Atmosphere: Inside the restaurant is extremely small. The real deal is sitting outside in their patio. It's much bigger than it seems from across the street, lots of big wooden bench chairs to be used community/family style. It's a great atmosphere, with nice lights and lots of people hanging out. It's very child friendly too - see a lot of people with baby carts as they can just put it next to the table.

Be warned.  This is a good burger, but this is NOT the AU Cheval burger.  They share a name only.  Whatever they do on Randolph to make their magical burgers has not transferred here.  Something is missing. Again, it's a good, tasty burger, but it isn't one of the best burgers you have ever had.
Excellent burger, fries and shakes.  Expensive but you get what you pay for.  Friendly staff too.

I now understand the reason for the long lines. Burgers and fries as simple as it sounds can be screwed up big time. Small Cheval does it the right way. Crispy and perfectly salted fries. I used the garlic aoli for dipping and the cheese burger had nice juiciness, good flavor and both were a good portion. Wish I had more bacon and wish I had 2 orders. But something simple made to taste so good. Can't wait for the next visit.

I loved everything about Small Cheval!  It's such a quaint and small burger joint. You order at the counter and there's several beers on draft ($6 - $8 for craft) There's seating indoors and in the back patio area. Burgers are a little pricy ($8.95 for a hamburger and $9.95 for a cheeseburger) but the taste and portion doesn't disappoint!  My friend and I split a cheeseburger and fries and sat outside to enjoy the gorgeous afternoon. The cheeseburger was superb, with oozing cheese and pickles between two juicy patties. The. Fries. Were. So. Good. They came out fresh and had the perfect amount of crispiness to them! Delicious plain, dipped in ketchup, and oh dipped in the garlic aioli... phenom. Which can also be found at the condiment station so you can enjoy yourself garlic aioli for days.  I thoroughly enjoyed the cheeseburger and fries. Would highly recommend Small Cheval for a great burger in Chicago!
i like to visit this joint every two weeks, the burgers are good and fries are ok. beer selection is  repectable and the hard-alcohol options are good. little expensive but worth every penni.

Epic. Best. No comparison. This is the definition of a quintessential burger and a blueprint burger shop experience. Patio. Small dining room. Menu with just one focus. That is your experience. This unassuming little dive will have a line but you'll move through quickly because the menu, well, is the way I like menus. What do you want? Burger, cheeseburger, fries. Add bacon. Yep. That is it. But oh that is where it begins.  The burgers are juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The bun is deliciously soft but holds up under the two patties and cheese that is oozing over the edges. The bacon is a perfect addition! However, skip the house mayo. Fries are perfectly crisp and fresh with each having slightly different textures. The flavoring is not pronounced so don't expect a heavy salt or upscale flavoring. Just good ol fashion, perfectly done fries. Drinks are out of can (grab from cooler), from the tap, or from the milk shake shaker. Seating inside or outside.  The price is heavy but I'll pay for it with these burgers! They are a five star place if the cost was a bit lower. 4 because of cost. Tips 1. Garlic aioli is wonderful on fries 2. It is two patties 3. Save the dessert and head around the corner to Margie's Candies 4. Cheese is great - do it! 5. Bacon is wonderful! 6. Fries are a tweener in terms of size for one or two people. Go with one and get a second order if needed.

We were 7 hungry and finicky ladies trying to find a place to have dinner that would make all of us happy.  The requests ranged from, "it must be affordable"  "it has to be quick", "It must be walkable", and "I'm tired of Mexican food!".  Ugh.  How was this Yelp Elite going to please everyone?  And just like that!  It was as if the stars aligned and the Yelp gods shone their light of grace on me and directed me to Small Cheval!  There was some hesitation about the menu, the heat and the distance from our airbnb.  But as soon as we walked up all the chatter stopped and Oohs and Ahhs began.  I heard praises like "Yay, a patio!"  "Pretty string lights" "SHOTS!!!"  One by one, each member of the gaggle ordered as they wished, they paid for it, collected their light up buzzer and made their way to the lively patio out back. Mere minutes later our table lit up with good news bearing buzzers and we loaded up on water, napkins and garlic aioli when inside.  We all DEVOURED our burgers and I personally snarfed the crispiest fries I've ever had  -- all of them btw.  Then washed it all down with Cheval punch that we were handed before we made it to the counter to order to sip and make the wait feel shorter - nice touch! The feel is super casual and fun, the service is happy and prices are affordable.  Most importantly, the food and drink was phenomenal! If you're in Wicker Park, this place is a MUST!

I'm straight. Not to say the burger wasn't good or anything but there's JUST a burger. Now obviously I came here already knowing the extent or lack thereof of options but I think I had this exclusive location and their ten dollar burger on a pedestal before ever having it. Maybe I daydreamed that it would have 24k gold flakes or at the least have more fresh onion on it than the little handful of chops. I really feel it missed the crunch and texture of raw onion rings. I also just don't have mad love for burgers that don't come standard with lettuce, tomato, and onions. It seems like people sweat the aioli but the gourmet ketchup was better. I had a chocolate shake and it was on point. Two burgers, one order of fries, one shake... thirty dollars. I've had single burgers that tasted like they should be thirty dollars but Cheval didn't add up for me. Don't get me wrong, it was an alright burger. I just don't think an alright burger deserves to be the only thing a dedicated location sells.

Good thin double burgers and crispy delicate fries! Garlic aioli! Fries don't need the garlic aioli, as they are always good by themselves, but it's my favorite part of going here. They have a lovely spacious outdoor seating area great for the warm months. We go here for quick, friendly and good service.

I grew up in a town with an awesome, greasy, extremely tasty burger joint that is my standard for all greasy burgers. Small Cheval gets five stars for being the closest approximation to this burger that I have found in all of Chicago. It is indeed slightly different than the Au Cheval burger, but still makes me really happy. The settings are simple, as is the food menu. Solid selection of drinks. Indoor seating is pretty limited, but they have a cozy outdoor picnic table patio. Plus, they have a garlic aioli condiment pump. That's right, a garlic aioli condiment pump.  Slight detractor is that all this tasty food and drink has a sneaky way of adding up and surprising you with a bigger-than-expected total amount for burger and fries.  Overall: yum.

Ok so they are different from the OG on Randolph, but different good. Simple menu. Happy service. Get the burger with everything. Get the fries to share with yourself. Stock up on waters and condiments at the self service station. Joy buzzer pocket toys to remind you to come to the counter for your noms. Shots.  Beers. More Shots More Beers. Go uber home.  You've been here for HOURS!

You really can't go wrong with this place. Everything on the menu is amazing! I'd recommend getting the burger house style, and you won't want to skip the fries OR a milkshake. Make sure to grab some garlic aioli for the fries, too!
A good burger, but I've had better in my 43 years. Way overpriced for what you get. I don't understand the lines around the corner.  Don't feel the need to go back.

How can you not like a cheaper and faster version of "Chicago's best burger" at Au Cheval!? It's not really quite as good as the burger at Au Cheval, or so I've heard, but it's one of the better burgers in the city of Chicago! And, this place has something that it's big brother restaurant doesn't.... simplicity and speed. If you want a trendy, fast, YUM-tastic burger... Come here now.  There's a short menu of a Hamburger or Cheeseburger (you can add bacon for $2) and delicious house made fries. No frills delicious greasiness! Done deal! PS- Don't forget that they have around nine different kinds of beer, Negronis, Margaritas, Peach gimlets, 3 different kinds shots (at least) and vanilla and chocolate shakes!  PPS - You can also order whole pitchers of beer! Yay! =) The more, the merrier!
BEST BURGERS! The cheeseburger is wonderful. I also loved all of their dipping sauces. Their patio is the perfect place to sit on a nice day.
The outdoor seating and phenomenal cheeseburger makes for an ideal late summer night stop

It was really good burger and we will come back but it wasn't the best burger. Me and my date git the cheeseburger and his was without onions but in the end both of ours came out without onions. The place was back for Saturday lunch, but it's a quick meal so people come and go pretty quick. There are outdoor seating too and the seating inside gave a friendly/family style vibe with a a big table in the middle. Don't get me wrong it's a good burger but it was a little too salty for both of us. I haven't been to au cheval but this was a good start. It was about 10 dollars per person with a small menu, don't let the small menu fool you, the bacon is thick, the buns a buttery and toasted and the garlic Aoli was amazing. So I would recommend it.

Oh Small cheval...... You try to be like your big sister au cheval but just not there yet. The place was packed when we went but we found seats really quick. The menu is super small. Just 3 items which makes ordering simple. We got the cheeseburger with the home style. The burger was really good. At times it was too salty which made it a bad experience sometimes. If You are watching your salt intake I would look some where else for a burger. The burger were a good size and tasted great. The bun was warm and toasted. The pickles tasted fresh and the bacon was thick. Overall it was a great burger but falls short of au cheval.

The burgers are almost as good at Au Cheval, but still sooooo gooood. This is counter service, so the wait is not crazy, only a few things on the menu, quick order and then get to choose where to sit. The outdoor patio is huge, its an amazing atmosphere especially for a weekend lunch.  The wait for food was not too long, which is a great plus. A must try.

Good burgers and great fries. Not as bad of a wait as the main location, I hear. So, if you're craving for a good burger, this is an option. Certainly not the best burger I have eaten or even close but not a bad burger. Has a cool, edgy feel to it, which I really enjoyed.

This is a Public Service Announcement We all know the burgers are great and the fries are impeccable. But I want to point something out...I don't like their bacon. It's kinda chewy and tastes more like pepper than bacon. Next time I get the cheeseburger I'm gonna save my money and opt for no bacon. As you were

Now you can get Au Cheval's famous -- justly famous -- burgers in Wicker Park, and without having to wait in line for two hours to fight for a table. Almost.  It seems to me that the burger here is in the *spirit* of Au Cheval's, but isn't quite the same. The whole thing is a little more orderly, a little more assembly-lined, and has just a hint of fast-food about it.  It's still an extremely good burger, the pickles and sauce and bun are still very nicely done, but you are a little more likely to think about it competing with Shake Shack.
