One other difference from Au Cheval is that you can't get an egg on your burger here.  I'm not sure they should keep "Cheval" in the name if they're not going to go around sticking eggs on things, but I guess frying eggs to order would destroy their ability to turn these things out at high speed. Bottom line: It's not going to replace Au Cheval in my life -- but I'm still glad it exists.

I was expecting more of a burger to be honest. I wish I had known that I could add lettuce and tomato. This information wasn't available on the menu, instead it was on the outside of the building on the wall.  The burger was pretty average. Meat was cooked nicely, but a bit greasy. Fries tasted fresh.

Please, $8 for a burger you can get at steak and shake? Plus milk shakes out of a machine not hand dipped? Ambience yes food no I went to Mariano's purchased a pup burger from the butcher they grilled it 5 times better and $ 3.00

Fantastic greasy burger and fries. Beautiful and large outdoor seating area - small indoor space. Best enjoyed outside during nice weather. They come by and will serve you a beer or whiskey while you are waiting in line to order. No frills menu: burger (with or without cheese), fries, and shakes. As well as a few sodas from the cooler, a small selection of whiskey plus perhaps a cocktail or two and 5 or so beers on tap. Haven't had the shakes yet but plan to - a table near us said they were really worth it.
Top five burgers I've ever had. Just my kind of place.

The highlights are pretty much the patio and the bun, as the burger was just average for me. The location is pretty cool - situated on a corner, with a simple & open interior and a secluded garden-style patio that is actually larger than the interior. But, this is a burger joint - so the food is what counts. While the burger was well cooked, especially for thin patties - it was entirely, entirely over seasoned. The overwhelming strong presence of salt was the primary flavor, which unfortunately didn't let the beef shine. I'm sad to say what I ate was essentially a nice & juicy cheesy salt-patty. The bun was by far my favorite part, and the savior of the experience. It would be a good sandwich to have for a late afternoon snack when you're having a late dinner - but double up on the water cups! The place was quick - both in paying and in preparing the food, and they had some good tunes playing while I waited. But, since the food was mediocre and, per other reviews here on Yelp, there is supposedly a better version of their food elsewhere, I would just recommend checking the original Au Cheval. Given the high praise for this concept, I'll have to reserve judgment until I conclude Chicagoans just don't know a good burger - but this was mostly a let-down, unless salty Shake Shack was the goal.

Outdoor seating. Burger looked delicious. Fries were great. Open late. Couple of things dropped ratings.. 1) Rats. We definitely saw at least one rat. It was running around behind the potted plants within the patio area. It destroyed any appetite we previously had. This brings my review to 3.5-stars.  2) Attitude. When I got up to the counter to order a drink, I ordered a straight vodka, which they don't carry (?). So I asked how big the house drinks were. The guy explained it was "a 5 oz pour." Cool man.. I don't really know how much that is (I don't think the average person has a really good sense of how much that is..). So I ask how much that fills in the cup - he got flustered and shrugged - which did not help me answer the question. To be fair, he didn't raise his voice or anything, but I was out with a friend and it was embarrassing for me to ask to begin with. So it only drops the review by half-star. This brings my review to 3-stars. So bottom-line, last night I had a 3-star experience. Would've probably been 5-stars on a different night. I'll probably try it again - and when I do I'll certainly update my review.

If I'm comparing Small Cheval with all the similar burger options out there, I'd have to say that it's okay. Don't get me wrong, a solid burger option for sure, but nothing out of the ordinary.  What I like: - If you just want a less sophisticated version of the Au Cheval special, you can get that burger with a lot less fuss! (Maybe minus some of the fancier ingredients like the egg, but I can't remember) - I also like the casual, communal vibe of Small Cheval - It's in Wicker Park, so duh, I like that  On the other hand: - If you want anything other than beer, burger and fries, you're pretty much out of luck Overall, I think Au Cheval is okay and likewise, Small Cheval is too. If you're in the area and looking for a good, classic burger in a laid back atmosphere, this is your place!

This is the best burger in the USA. I've been all over and this is the only burger that I genuinely crave whenever I'm in town. I used to think the Burger Joint at Le Parker Meriden, NYC, was it... But this burger holds all cards. The meat is juicy and flavorful. The bun is butter toasted. The ketchup has a certain twang to it... It's an orgasmic eating experience worthy of media coverage.
Top 5 burgers in the city, no question. For the price, there isn't a better burger. If you aren't up for the wait at Au Cheval, this will get the job done.
Quite possibly the best burger I've had this far. Make sure to add bacon, you will not be disappointed!

Super simple menu, everything was cooked perfectly.  Awesome condiments available and a few cocktails on tap.  Great little date night spot or for a large group given the picnic table seating - outdoor patio too!
Sooo good, can't wait to go back. And the line went by pretty fast for how packed it was. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the Fries were not that great.
Overall pretty good but not fantastic. The shakes are awesome but the fries were way too salty. The music was so loud you couldn't hear yourself think.

This is my most favourite burger. Here's why: - it's perfectly cooked, with the teensiest of pink remaining - the buns are not an afterthought: they complement the burger and toppings, and don't collapse. Also: are they glazed with butter? I don't know if I want to know the answer to this question, but also: YUM - get it 'house style' with pickles et al. Trust. Just do it. There are three options: hamburger, cheeseburger, bacon cheeseburger. Not to get all Goldilocks-y but I think the hamburger benefits from the cheese, the bacon is gilding the lily too much and so: the cheeseburger reigns supreme here.  The fries are an afterthought in this review (DEM BURGS THO) but really aren't second fiddle at Small Cheval: they are deliciously crisp, perfectly seasoned, skin-on taters. You should go for 'em. Bonus points: unlimited access to garlic aioli. This ain't no ketchup-mustard-mayo only joint. Watch-out: no options beyond fries for vegetarians. Yelp note: COCKTAILS ON TAP, whatddup old fashioneds (and other delicious concoctions!).

Violet Hour followed by Small Cheval is a winning combo! I got there on a Tuesday night around 9pm. There was no wait, and our burgers were ready in no time. They were really tasty, the meat was juicy, fries were excellent... you got the point ;-)
So Ive been going here at least once a month. I dream of their food. The fries are cooked perfectly. Garlic aioli is on point. Fast. Never too crowded. Great vibe. Eat here.

Really enjoyed Small Cheval. Service was good, and the burger (all the way) was very tasty, with a hearty side of fries.  Atmosphere is really cool, especially the patio, which was a great place to eat in the spring. They actually served Vernors...! Highly recommend this place

Great burger and atmosphere. Fries are okay. The only thing I'd knock a star off is for the price. Burgers should always be cheap! They do offer a lot of liquor for decent prices which is cool I guess.

A really great burger and fantastic beverage program (shakes, drafts and shots etc). Dinged it a star because their frys are weak, always. Love the focused menu (only burgers, frys and drinks) and the tight execution. If you're craving a cheeseburger, this spot (as well as the mothership, of course) needs to be on your radar.

Simply loved the burgers and fries, the customer service was by far amazing and very friendly faces to see as I walked in! Worth the wait and worth just siting in and eating there.  Also the ketchup and the garlic aioli, it gave the burger and fries such an extra kick! Just love, love, love the place.  Really looking forward in tasting Hogsalt's other locations!

The burgers are tasty. Not the best burger ever. The patties are thin, Well cooked; lightly pink in the middle.  Fries are yummy.  The patio and booze are a BONUS.  It's a Friday at 3.  They aren't very busy the service is quick.   You place your order at one counter, receive a pager to pick your order up when the pager goes off.  There is a large square family size picnic table in the middle  and diner  bar style steating along the wall.  We ordered 1 cheeseburger (9.95) with bacon ($2), fries (2.95) and a 7 acres beer(7) the total was $24 something with tax.

I was looking for a good burger. Read some of the reviews and decided to check it out. Went on a sunday night. It wasnt too crowded. There was a line. But the line moved quick. Ordered the cheeseburger and fries. Also got the chocolate milkshake with baileys added.  The burger was so good! Its a simple burger. No fancy toppings. Thats exactly what i was looking for. The fries would good, a little too salty. The ketchup was good too. Not heinz! Milkshake was amazing. Its thick unlike other milkshakes i have had before. Definitely worth the wait. Only thing that is a con was the pager system. The day i went i guess they were having issues. Mine and a couple others pagers werent working. So the food was sitting there for a couple minutes getting cold.
Your burgers are tasty. This format is far more easy to deal with. Also closer. The fancy burger dad is getting old, but their barebones delish burger doesn't get old. Yum!

Perfect greasy burger joint. Simple menu. Quick service. Milkshakes are killer and the various homemade dipping sauces are great on fries or even on the burger. Fries are a tad too salty but that's probably just me. Outdoor patio is fantastic too. Overall atmosphere is great.

So dang good! The boyfriend and I came here for dinner last night. I had a cheeseburger to which I added their delicious garlic aioli and he had a bacon cheeseburger. We shared a side of fries. Their burgers are solid and their fries are perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle. I'd definitely come back here again. The prices are a tad on the higher side.

My 9 year old loves burgers and fancies himself a food critic so when he said "this is my new favorite burger place" I knew I to give them 5 stars. The menu is simple. Burger or cheeseburger. Fries or no fries. And a great selection of beer. And the ketchup, Sir Kensingtons, is the best damn ketchup ever to hit my fry loving mouth.
Great restaurant!!  The burgers were juicy.  The fries were great.  I loved the staff because they were super friendly.

All I can say after eating here is, wow! The burgers were cooked to perfection and the fries were fresh and crispy (not overdone).  The wait however is another beast. Prepare to spend about 30 minutes or so in line and waiting for a seat. The seating arrangements are along the outside of the building and a community table plopped in the middle. When arriving, I didn't expect for that long of a wait, but I'm glad I waited!  The service was good, even though you're waiting in almost a painfully long line, servers approach to take your drink order while you wait (huge plus). You just make sure to add it onto your bill at the counter.  You MUST get the garlic aioli dipping sauce. I dipped my fries and burger in it. I honestly wanted to take some home with me. Absolutely delicious!!!!
There's a pump container of garlic aioli alongside the ketchup.  What more do you need to know?

The burger is top-notch and I would put Small Cheval in front of other Chicago favorites. I've never waited in line and the seating allows for easy in / out. In addition to the great burger, the food is reasonably priced.

I had always wondered what this establishment was because it looked weird from the outside, finally decided to visit and was I surprised. First off the decor was really cool it reminded me of a little cabin, then the food, oh my the food. You can't really go wrong when making a cheeseburger but small cheval went right, from the toastyness of the bun to how much the cheese is melted it is definitely one of the better burger places in chicago. Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because I've never liked their fries and it's a bit expensive for a burger joint. But definitely a nice spot to check out, I have yet to sit in their patio.

Small Cheval is the BBE - best burger ever. If you don't want to wait 4 hours at Au Cheval, especially if you are just going for the burger, switch over to Small Cheval. The menu has three items - Hamburger, Cheeseburger, and Fries. No more, no less. The hamburger is the best in Chicago if not the best you will find anywhere. The meat is juicy, the cheese is creamy, the sauce drips down your hands, and the pickles are crunchy. There is something special between those two pieces of buns. The garlic aioli pump can get real naughty real fast. Get the fries well done for crispy goodness.

What can I say that hasn't been said already. Got the cheeseburger with bacon, chocolate shake, and fries. Small quantity of fries, and just a regular milkshake. The burger, obviously, is where it's at.  Great bun, good patty, and just plain delicioso overall. Sit outside on the patio and grab a drink with a burger; you won't be disappointed.

Nice place. Cool outdoor area, very small indoor space. Can get busy, but not unbearable. Only downside is that it's pricey for a small burger joint. Overall, good place to go when you're craving a burger.
Best hamburger I have tasted EVER in my life. Like seriously that greasy brioche bun  with the extra mayo and cheese mmmm

Go to the main Au Cheval. Small Cheval isn't worth the price or quality compared to the main location. I was quiet disappointed. Yes, it has a trendy appeal and a nice patio but don't settle for anything less than the main headquarters.
Same burger as Au Cheval without the wait. One of the best burgers I've ever had. Decent beer list and shakes.

Great burger and the fries were ok. The menu is very simple and the place is small. The inside gets packed during lunchtime. There is one communal table in the center and bar seating on the perimeter of the restaurant. The outdoor area looks really nice. It is pricey for a burger but the price is written outside of the restaurant so you should know this going in.  Did not have a shake but they looked awesome!

Small Cheval is a pretty darn good burger joint. This younger sister restaurant to Au Cheval is a no-frills, pared-down sibling to its more elaborate predecessor. Only serving burgers, fries, shakes, and boozy adult beverages at a marginally smaller size, but doing it oh-so-well. Went here around noon on Sunday for brunch. And just a word of advice: please if you wake up early enough, get there before 12:30 pm, because this small place fills up pretty rapidly. We had new patrons hovering and hawking our corner spot like a predatory bird waiting for mice, prior to leaving. Yikes!  I got the cheeseburger, and my S.O. got the cheeseburger + bacon, tomato, and lettuce for $2 extra. We shared an order of Golden Fries and had two hair o' the dog as well. The cheeseburger at its base had two perfectly griddled beef patties cooked to Medium (my favorite cook for burgers/arguably the best! Thanks, Small Cheval!), a quick smear of dijoinaise, a smattering of minced red onions, a handful of tangy pickles, and melty, gooey American cheese. As for the double-fried Golden Fries, they were so mouth-shattering good. Like as soon as you bite into it, a nice crispy crunch would yield. A pitch-perfect amount of salt on it, too. Reminded me so much of Hot Doug's duck fat fries. R.I.P. Hot Doug's  :-( My only -- and I mean only complaint -- is that their use of the all-natural Sir Kensington's ketchup for their fries was just a touch too grainy and reminded me of flavored tomato paste. Sorry, y'all !!! But I am firmly a Heinz ketchup type of gal. Revision: There was a Heinz ketchup dispenser! It was just less vivid and appealing than the bright red Sir Kensingon's ketchup dispenser. Ooops! My bad! :/

Has a lot to live up to my friend said being voted best burger in the USA.  Burger was very juicy and lovely added bacon and the fries  were good.  A little pricey and it was way to packed felt a little hurried but all and all liked it.

If you've got a hankering for something resembling Au Cheval's burger, this is it. If you're also looking for the most overpriced casual meal for 2 in Chicago, this is also it. The good: Solid burger, good fries, nice small beer selection. The set up is cool, open seating, communal, a bar rail around the perimeter with stools.  The bad: 2 burgers, 1 medium fries to share, and 2 beers: $42. FORTY TWO DOLLARS. There are no waitresses, you order at a counter and come pick up your own food from the grill. Cans of soda are in a cooler on the floor. The burger is wrapped in tinfoil, comes in a plastic basket. Fries are in a paper bag. The beers come in plastic cups. The silverware is plastic. So for a restaurant where I get my own food wrapped in tinfoil, don't get a real plate, glass or silverware, and am not seated at an individual table, how the hell can it cost FORTY TWO DOLLARS for 2 burgers, a medium sized french fry and 2 beers?  If you want bacon on your cheeseburger it's an extra $2, so you can definitely make it a more expensive date if you're feeling a little kooky.

If you like grilled meat with toppings and bread on either side, you will like this. Double-decker hamburgers and cheeseburgers built with thin patties that remain juicy but not dripping. First bite was an absolute rush of flavor that overwhelmed the senses.  Fresh cut golden fries are pretty good and serve as a nice delivery vehicle for garlic aioli, mayo and gourmet or regular ketchup.  Austere decor is a bit divey but cozy. Their website shows several sit down tables but when we went there was one community table in the middle of the room with bar style seating around the perimeter.

(Read this with a little twang....) So this right here place is delicious.  Burger is nice, sloppy, and greasy. No distractions: just burger +/- cheese and a pickle. (that's what I know at least.) Smother your face. Mmm, just like that. Now dip your fries.  Ketchup. Their fancy ketchup with the little man in a monocle.  Holy cow, I think I eat more of this then the actual food. (But both are good.) If you want, order a pop, beer, or drink. They have it. (Just don't think you're going to get fancy and have a glass of wine. No room for that.) You'll see a lot of date-type/couple nights here. Don't go trying to bring a big group and expect seats for everyone. Be prepared to sit in a big a.s table and have to manipulate yourself so you're not awkwardly making eye contact with the stranger across the room. OR you can sit along the sidelines bar-type stools.

Dear Small Cheval, Thank you for being you. Don't ever change.  Love Always, Laura  I LOVE small cheval, would it be fair to say one of the highlights of moving to Bucktown was this fine establishment. I've never had Au Cheval, but those who have, have said they're almost the same (about 90%) there, I like those odds. The burger is juicy and delicious, and the French fries!? I also love the selection of dipping sauces, because what would a great burger place be without a million and 1 dipping sauces.  Warning: it's small and has communal seating, so it's best to go during "off times." Also typically tough for a big group, but nevertheless worth your while.

If you're looking for a good burger, beer and noisy, festive atmosphere. Small Cheval is a good stop. You walk up to the register, order and food is out quickly. No long wait like at their mother restaurant. However, it is NOT Au Chavel. Though prepared similarly, the burgers were not as good. Can't tell you exactly why, they just aren't. But matching Au Chavel is a high order. And on a weekend, you'll be lucky to find a place to sit, especially during the winter when the patio is closed. And be warned (or happy) this place is loud! Loud music, loud people. But also very social. The giant table promotes conversation and meeting people, so go expecting upbeat fun, not an intimate evening. A great sports debate broke out on our visit which left us all smiling.  Final warning... not a good choice for families for most of the above reasons. If your kids want burgers, get them to go, because even if you find a place for more than two to sit, it would be like taking your 8-year old to a boisterous bar after a Blackhawks game.
Small selection, big taste! This is Au Cheval's kid brother.  It is an old school burger joint but with high quality burgers, and awesome shakes! Culvers = No Steak & Shake = No Small Cheval = DUH!

This place is perfect. I absolutely love Au Cheval, so naturally I was ecstatic when I heard Small Cheval was opening.  I usually go at off-peak times and have never had to wait in line for more than 5 minutes.  The burgers are so delicious and satisfying, I don't know how they do it.  I usually just get the cheese burger house style with no additional add-ons, and everytime I go it exceeds my expectations.
High end walk in dinner with to die for burgers! No matter if you're in the mood for a beer or a great milk shake they got it all. You will not be disappointed!

The burgers here are great. However, we are in Chicago, and at $12 for a Bacon Cheeseburger, there are many places where BC's are excellent. As you'll read everywhere, it is not as good as Au Cheval (and there are not egg options to make it so). If this burger was $8-$9, I would walk over more than once or twice a year. Make no mistake, this will definitely fit the bill if you're craving a burger. But with advance planning there are better choices.

Burger did not live up to the hype kept biting and waiting for some flavor. The fries were way over salted. The chocolate shake was the best part. They are way over priced 19 bucks for a burger that isn't as good as wendys and portions from the dollar menu.

Having been to Au Cheval, i felt compelled to visit this location...This place has an interesting layout with adequate seating options and definitely no waiting time on a tuesday afternoon! The menu is so simple you really cant go wrong with what you order but in that degree that might explain why you dont have long wait lines because its in the variety it lacks that probably might be its draw back...I did like my burger for freshness and taste(when you go to a burger place and they get it right without you telling them how to cook your burger thats a good thing!), and the fries were crunchy which was also good with the option of getting unlimited garlic aioli at your discretion at the dispenser! They have 2 different ketchup one heinz and sir kensington! Prices are reasonable and service quick! Although as good as my experience overall, this is not a replacement for Au Cheval by any means(Wait lines? just line up 30 mins before it opens)...

Nice outdoor pub garden. Due to its close proximity to the "Blue Line" hopefully the music is at least as loud outside as it is inside.  The vanilla shake was good.  I'll try the cheeseburger again when I'm in the area and I'm craving a burger but, this is not a destination site. The flavor and size of the cheeseburger with bacon don't live up to its price. At twelve dollars, I shouldn't have to open my cheeseburger to make sure they didn't forget the bacon. No lettuce and tomato in this cheeseburger. Not an option on the menu either. Maybe it was on a secret menu. Anyway, a nice juicy slice of tomato would have improved this cheeseburger as it was a bit dry and tolerably salty. Next time I'll add some of that garlic aioli and see if it tastes better. Hopefully it won't make it saltier. That would suck.  The music inside was good. Maybe if I ate inside instead of having it to go I would feel better about the value. Nah, I'm there for the food.  If the burger sucks who cares if the music is any good. A good example of this is Burger Belly (previously Lead Belly).  For those of you that rated this burger five stars and said it was the best burger you've ever had, please get out and try more burger places. I'm not cutting you guys down but, if you love these, there are burgers out there that blow these away. Burger Belly is not one of them. Now get out there and continue your quest for the end all be all of burgers, I did.  Finally, if your wondering why I keep picking on Burger Belly.  It's because they recently burned me for the second time. I don't believe in third chances. Unless it's my wife. She can have all the chances she needs. Unless she cheats on me. In that case, all bets are off and I'll eat her liver with some fava beans and a nice Chianti. :)

Well I made my way to the old neighborhood in bucktown to stop at this Burger heaven. First off you enter a night club canopy into a picnic area of very happy people,and finally I know why they are so happy. You are instantly greeted which is nice,the employees are all genuinely nice people that take their time explaining your food options and beer options. Once you order they give you a buzzing device that once it lights up you know you're in for a treat. Your order is up in 5 minutes. Today me and my wife had bacon cheese burgers  which happens to be a Double Decker loaded with the works . It was so perfect that I had to take a photo of it to believe what I was seeing. To say the least it didn't survive long. Man this hands down has to be one of the best chef made concoctions to be plated. Let me not forget the fresh cut fries that are the best I ever had,perfect taste and such a beautiful crunch I told my wife too pinch me I thought I was dreaming, sitting at this big center table I thought we were invited to God's last supper. OMG OMG OMG .  IF you don't put this place on your bucket list you will never know what a great burger and heavenly fries are. Trust me make your way over there immediately!!!!! Affordable,succulent ,outstanding quality products,clean and superb service,friendly staff. Great tap beers and awesome whiskey

You get the quality and taste of the famed Au Cheval burger without a 2 hour wait. Line moves quickly and food is served even quicker because there's only a couple items on the menu. When there's no outside seating (closed during Winter), the interior seating can be a bit odd: bar seating along 2 walls and a huge center table that occupies 75% of the floor space, but wastes about 25% of it. But, you can overlook that for a Top 3 burger in Chicago.

I was SO excited when i heard about Small Cheval. The convenient location & the fact that there usually isnt a long wait to get in, definetly made me want to check it out! So i ended up going there Saturday night, found parking right in front & there was NO wait. I thought for sure the rest of my experience was going to be as smooth.  I ended up ordering a hamburger. And let me tell you...the hamburger tasted SO bland. Whenever i have a burger anywhere, i don't usually have to add cheese, ketchup or mustard to enjoy the taste. (I know, wierd). But in this case i didnt want my burger to go to waste. So i added ketchup & mustard and it ended up tasting just OK. The beef itself just didnt have much flavor.  I had high hopes for liking this place. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't special. I definetly appreciate the convenient location and i did like the set-up they had inside w/the communal seating. But the food was just OK.

COST: $9.95 (Cheeseburger) $2.95 (Golden Fries) $4 (Draft Beer) Let's cut to the chase, this is the BEST DAMN BURGER I'VE HAD IN CHICAGO. It's so good and you get so much food for the price. It's quite literally Au Cheval without the bells and whistles (and WITHOUT 1+ hour waits). It's probably good that Wicker Park is comparatively inaccessible via the Red Line because I'd be here every single meal time.  The patties are thick and juicy and beats In-N-Out any day. It's kinda like Five Guys taste wise but much better and fresher tasting. The fries are to die for. They gave you a heaping of these crispy on the outside, soft on the inside french fry gift-from-the-gods. I believe they do $3 shots of various amounts of hard liquor like whiskey or vodka. Also $4-6 pints of beer. Really respectable prices! But the dealmaker so to speak? Serve your own condiments! Yes I know aioli is just a fancy term for mayonnaise, but Small Cheval's garlic aioli is so good you'll wanna take their dispenser home (not really, that's called stealing!). I've been three times already, and I suspect - nay - I'll be back for more!

So I have to preface that my updated 1 star addition is not based on me eating here. Part of the downfall with my visit were the cold fries. The manager here on Yelp was very attentive and responded that the issue will be fixed as they were getting a new fryer. I have yet to try the  promised hot fries, but I figure since it's been months, I have to at least reflect the attempt of rectification/manager's awesome customer care.

Not the same... definitely not the same burger as Au Cheval.  I was excited to hear that Au Cheval opened another restaurant that just focused on their signature cheeseburger called Small Cheval. The idea was great since it would have a much shorter wait time and the option of adding lettuce and tomato. Sounds great in theory but after the first bite, I realized that the burger at Small Cheval didn't have the pure awesomeness and enchantment from David Blaine's demon magic at Au Cheval. The fries (cooked in animal lard) were still amazing but the burger wasn't quite at the same level.  Overall, it's still a great burger for $10. It's just a bit disappointing because I was hoping for the epic signature burger from Au Cheval without the wait. For the location and convenience of being a burger joint, it's definitely a smaller version of the superior and nationally ranked Au Cheval burger.

Mind blown! Absolutely awesome burger. At first we went to Au Cheval. We just wanted a burger and since the wait was too long, we decided to uber to Small Cheval.  The menu has two options, Hamburger and Cheeseburger as well as Golden Fries. I got the CheeseBurger and it was awesome. The bun is super fluffy and has a nice light butter glaze on it. It has perfect bun, meat (2 patties), veggie (pickle, tomatoe, lettuce), condiments (house sauce) ratio. I added bacon (for 2 bucks) and it came with two thick pieces of bacon. It just all came together and perfectly well seasoned. We also shared the fries. Double fried so very crispy. The have a garlic aioli condiment that you have to try. I didn't get a beer but it looked like they had a great selection. Definitely check this place out!

Get the burger with fries, not just because those are the only food menu items, but because they are two patties of greasy deliciousness. The outdoor seating area is perfect for sunny spring days. Draft beer selection is great and prices are reasonable ($4-7 for a beer). The garlic aoli is great with the fries. The house style for the burger comes with a special sauce, pickles and red onions: very tasty. Great spot North of Wicker Park six corners.
The house special cheese burger with bacon is incredible. Perfect for late night food. Do not miss the double-fried fries! And the garlic aoli too

This joint has a very simple food menu (and a rather extensive drink menu).   They make a mean burger and you can definitely tell the difference between a fresh cut potato fry vs. packaged fry (full transparency:  I am not a huge fan of the fry category so I am probably not the best judge of quality).   Chocolate shake was an excellent pairing to the burger.   They have a nice tap list of all of Chicago / regional greatest craft beer hits.  Atmosphere is clean and simple.   Staff is professional.    Couple drawbacks to the place: 1) A little bit pricey for what you get. 2) Music is playing quite loud. Overall, definitely worth checking this place out if you are in the mood for a good burger.
Great place. Amazing burger and fries. Service was excellent. $2.50 for a can of soda is an extraordinarily inexplicable price point though.

Yummy.  If you don't know already, they have a very short menu: burger or cheeseburger (with an option to add bacon) and fries.  They have a few drinks, including beers (and a cider), a few cocktails and milkshakes. The burger is darn tasty.  It has two beef patties, delicious cheese, the dijonnaise, pickles and some onions. The burger is so juicy and the bun can stand up to it. The bacon is thinner than the original and provides more of a crunch and texture to the burger. The fries are also good and easily shareable. They were crispy but yet soft inside and you got to taste the potato. Of course, they have the famous garli aioli for dipping. If you want to experiment, there are also other sauces available too.  Small Cheval is a great place to grab a quick bite to eat without the notorious 2 hour waits Au Cheval is now has.  So far, the most I've had to wait is about 10 minutes and got a seat by the time food was ready.  It is also a completely different experience with communal tables and has more of an "in and out" than "stay and hang out" vibe.  I definitely can't wait until it is nice enough to check out the patio. The staff are helpful and friendly.  Make no mistake: this is not the original Au Cheval burger and if you are looking for that, you might be disappointed.  However, there are similarities and overall, it is still a very, very good burger.  In fact, my husband prefers the small cheval burger. While the original still reigns #1 in my book, small cheval is at the top of a short list. Plus, I can get small cheval without the wait and hassle which is very good considering now I really want another.

First off, it's a completely different experience than Au Cheval so don't go in there expecting the same thing at all. You already know by now that there are really only three things on the menu but besides that they don't do the burger quite the same way it seems. It's still quite a fantastic burger but there was just something missing from the taste of the one at AC. The fries are thicker so not quite as much crunch but still quite tasty. The atmosphere is nice, much more laid back and kind of country highway roadside feel. And between waiting to order and then waiting for my burger it was probably only 10+ minutes combined so that was great. Cool to have both options available in different parts of town.

Just like its big brother, Small Cheval has some of the best burgers I've ever had. When you walk in you are greeted with a rustic, bare-bones decor. And I love it-I would rather a restaurant focus on their food than their atmosphere. My opinion.  The fries are the perfect amount of crispy and salty, and they are just as great dipped into the milkshakes (which are thick and rich) or their garlic aoli (a must try!). The burgers are worth the wait on the weekends when it gets busy. While you can only choose your standard hamburger/cheeseburger and there's not much to add besides bacon, they are juicy, flavorful, and incredible. They're usually medium rare and I usually prefer medium, but I can compromise for these babies.  If you're in the area, swing by and get a burger and go have a picnic on the 606. These burgers are worth every penny.

Fantastic Burgers. A little pricey but I can't stop the crave and when I crave I pay. So glad they opened this place.  Can't wait to check out the original. I've been told the bacon is to die for. That's next on my list!

The burgers are great, the milkshakes are fantastic, and the service is speedy and kind. The atmosphere is comfortable, and the available garlic aioli really completes the package. I'm looking forward to trying this place out when it's warm enough for the patio to be open. If you're craving a burger in Wicker Park, go here.

Great place to grab a quick bite and eat on the go - that was our original intent; however, since the place was so open and not crowded (during the time we went at least) we ended up eating our meal there. Food: They have a short list of items on their menu. I had the cheeseburger and the golden fries - pretty good! They have a decent amount of sauces in a help-yourself type availability which was nice when deciding how we wanted our burger or fries to be enhanced. But let's be real now, their garlic aioli is the real deal - add some to your burger and have a dipping cup for your fries - boom! Seating: There is one large communal table in the middle of the room, and seats across the walls of the room. For some reason, it reminded me of those outdoor communal tables they have at those original hot dog joints, in a good way. Parking:  There's meter parking around the restaurant. Tight streets.
Good lord was the burger amazing! Just as good as Au Cheval. The meat to cheese to bun ratio was outstanding. Fries were perfect with the garlic aioli sauce.

If you have tried for Au Cheval and don't want to wait the 2+ hours it's worth the cab/driver over to small cheval. The menu is plain and easy. Hamburger/cheeseburger fries and drink. If you want something else head somewhere else. My wife and I agree that the burgers are actually better than Au cheval. The milkshakes are very good but best to drink after you eat so not waste space that could be filled with a burger. I think the number one thing out of it all is the garlic aioli. It's very good and it goes well with the burgers and for dipping fries in. Don't be scared of the line. It goes quick and it is well worth the little wait. The only downfall is the limited seating in the winter (summer is different because they have outside seating). As a plus they serve beer!!!

If you're looking for an exact replica of Au Cheval's burger, maybe skip this joint and head to the West Loop. If you're looking for a tasty, quick, traditional griddle burger in the Wicker Park/Bucktown 'hood, then Small Cheval is your spot. Food is served relatively quick, mitigating the traditional wait you'd find at Au Cheval. I appreciate the quick turnaround because you never have to wait too long for a seat. Their outdoor patio is also a great spot to hang out once the weather warms up. I will say, while their burgers are delicious, if you're willing to travel a bit further south, you can find the exact same burger at Fatso's for a few bucks cheaper!

Delicious, perfectly cooked cheese burgers!! My husband and I went in to order food to go on a Friday. I was pleasantly surprised by the ambience and setup of the place. Bar stools on the outside near the Windows and a large community table in the middle. As far as our food order went, everything came out hot and the fries were seasoned just right! I definitely recommend this spot for anyone who wants a great burger in a relaxed atmosphere.

Cheeseburger heaven! I've been to Au Cheval multiple times and l love it, so had to try Small Cheval, and it so did not disappoint!   The cheeseburger with bacon was yummy gooey wonderfulness. The pickles, such good pickles!! The fries with the ketchup and the garlic aioli, perfection!   The shakes were flavored perfectly.  The atmosphere, the simplicity, and the speed of this place is great.  I will be back many, many times.

This place is ooey-gooey cheesy goodness! I love their burgers here, almost as much as the original!  I came in with my boyfriend on a Friday evening at about 6PM, and the line was surprisingly short. We only waited about 10 minutes, and they've got it down pretty efficiently there with one person working the cash register while the other covers the drinks. I ordered an old fashioned (obviously) and this is by far the largest old fashioned I've been served in Chicago. They put it in a large plastic cup and fill that puppy all the way up. My boyfriend opted for a beer on tap, and we chose two cheeseburgers served with the standard toppings (lettuce, tomato, dijonaise, and pickles) along with an order of the golden fries.  The food came out extremely fast, and we posted up at one of their bar seats with some of Sodikoff's amazing garlic aioli and Sir Kensington's Ketchup. The burgers were piping hot and have that traditional old-school burger taste. The pickles and the dijonaise were amazing, and even without the bacon, I couldn't ask for anymore from a burger. Fries are crispy and fresh and I'd definitely recommend only one order if you want anything else. Can't wait to come back, and next time, a milkshake will be in order!
Burger was very tasty but a little pink inside ! Fries portion was small ! But I will give them another try !

There's so much competition for good bar burgers in Logan Square these days, I'm hesitant to call a champ, partial as I am to the ones at Parts & Labor.  But the ones you get at Small Cheval are definitely in contention.  I like places that have a small menu of things that they do exactly right, and Small Cheval fits that description well.  They've also got fine dressings, good service (surprising, given how hectic the place can get late at night), and a decent selection of good beers on tap.  It can get a little crazy with the bar trade, and it won't win any design awards, but as a place to stop for a very good-quality burger, it definitely belongs in the conversation.
This place almost washes away my longing for In-n-Out.  For me, this is the better option than Au Cheval - dead simple menu, not quite as loud and much quicker.
Great burger.  From what I hear the lines get pretty crazy here.  Not sure I would stand in line for an extended period of time, but we lucked out and got our food within 5 minutes.

I've heard good things about small cheval!  If my sister, who is not a big burger person, said their burgers are good then you know they're good!! Even though its so simple, the ingredients are so fresh and everything just works so well together! The burger patties are thin so there are two patties and the cheese is delicious and if you get bacon, its a THICK, perfect slice of bacon. I can't wait to bring my boyfriend here and go HAM! I'm also pretty pumped for their outdoor patio!

Great burgers! The burgers here are mouth watering, melt in your mouth good. There's also a pretty decent group of beers on tap.  It can be a bit hard to find a seat when it gets crowded and hard for larger group to sit together but the burgers are worth it.

Oh my stars!!! My favorite red meat burger in the city!!!  I am not a big red meat eater and only indulge about twice a year.  However, since trying the cheeseburger from Small Cheval, I have been craving it again!!!  The place is a bit pricey so I would definitely make it more of a treat as opposed to my go to burger place, but the price won't deter me from coming back!!!  Can't wait for my next visit!!!

After a scooter loop on the 606, my two kiddos and I decided to stop at Small Cheval with our friends. We were served super quick, with an extra kind cashier. Then I realized that I had forgotten the fries! Terrible mistake--the superman at the expediter station took care of it pronto, helping me avoid the gargantuan line that had formed behind us. Of course the burgers and fries were perfection, and then my daughter spilled her chocolate shake all over the floor. Tears ensued, and that same expediter not only helped us clean it up, he ordered a new shake on the spot. Thanks Small Cheval, for making dining with kids not only bearable, but delicious. LOVE YOU.

I've been back a few times since my original post and can sufficiently say that the service and experience has greatly improved. I love that there's not much of a wait and cannot wait for the  spring / summer when the outdoor patio returns so I can grab a beer and enjoy a burger out there.

We all want it to be as good as Au Cheval, and the burger doesn't quite reach that epic dream of ours, but it comes PRETTY DAMN CLOSE. And with some pretty sweet benefits: shorter wait time, ALL THE GARLIC AIOLI YOU WANT, no tipping counter service = cheaper burger, and getting a bomb ass burger away from the west loop. The fries are every bit as delicious as the ones at Au Cheval and the burger comes pretty close. The space could use a little sprucing - it literally looks like they just stockpiled all of their condiments throughout the restaurant on random shelves, put up a menu sign, painted a mural on the outside wall, put a table in the center and called it a day as far as the redecorating of the space goes. I think they knew the masses would come no matter what the space looked like, but hey, the space needs a little more love. Give it a little more love!
Place is great.  Some over priced sides and additions to the burger itself so be careful. Not as good as Au Cheval but great location.  Pretty fast service as well.
Amazing burgers and fries!!! Burger was cooked to perfection. Loved how they had garlic aoili and deli mustard on the side for fries. Cute atmosphere and great customer service.

Last time I went, Au Cheval was an hour wait so being able to walk in Small Cheval and get my food within 10 minutes was awesome!  My cheeseburger and fries came to just under $15, which isn't much cheaper, but the speed and convenience is great.  Although not quite the same, the burger is very juicy and tasty. I had every intention of sharing my fries, but that didn't happen.  Initially, I wasn't sure if I liked them as they were very well done, but they have a great crunch and that definitely grew on me.  I'm convinced it's the chunks of sea salt that makes them super addicting.  My only warning is to watch how many times you come back!

This place is excellent. I recommend going on a weeknight to avoid a long wait.  I always get the burger, add lettuce, tomato and bacon, subtract the pickles. The fries are the perfect saltiness and crispiness, and all I have to say about condiments is two words: GARLIC AIOLI. I didn't even know I liked aioli until I went to Small Cheval. I will say that it tastes very, very similar to Au Cheval, but you are being unrealistic if you think you are going to get the EXACT same burger. You will get a much shorter wait time, an exceedingly chill atmosphere, and some delicious food.

Absolutely ridiculous! Holy ****! I just had an incredible meal. Fries were just as good. Price was definitely fair for that quality. Favorite Wicker Park location by far. Now I will have to go to Au Cheval.

Man this place was in phenomenal. The burger was pink just the way I like it. For under $15 you can have a decent double burger that will fill you up before you can finish the fries. The portion was just right for me(6'1 former football player) but my girl friend couldn't finish hers. The burger did not fall apart and I didn't have to deal with the grease dripping all over the place like at other burger joints. Overall A+
Great little place to stop in and grab an authentic burger and milkshake. Perfect for a casual date!

Best burger ever! Seriously can't wait to go back. French fries were super delicious and go great with the garlic aoli sauce. Burgers were just simply delicious and just the way I like it. Place is small and barely had elbow room. Perfect for a quick bite or carry out.

Cheaper version of Au Cheval. There's pretty much only 1 food item on the menu: BURGER. And you can add fries or a milkshake if you want. Prices are basically $1 or so less than that of Au Cheval. But there's not much of a wait because it's a order at the counter and find a seat yourself type of place. Seating is quite interesting... there are seats around the edges of the small restaurant, and then a huge table in the middle. It can get busy, but I came with 2 friends on a Friday night and only had to wait 10 min for seats.  The burgers of course taste great! I mean, if that's the only thing they make, it better taste amazing. The meat was juicy and chewy. The fries were real potatoes but way too salty. And the smoothie was pretty good - I got the vanilla one. It's pretty smooth and creamy. My friend did mention that the chocolate one doesn't really taste too strongly of chocolate though. I got a burger with fries and a milkshake, which came out to $18.  There's usually street parking available on Milwaukee.

Ok so I went here to the Au Cheval burger without the wait. And it was a very good burger, but for what I got for the price I was a bit surprised. So the burger is simple but very well executed. Brioche bun, perfectly cooked, pickles, cheese, onions and dijonaisse. Very tasty, the dijonaisse really makes it. I added bacon, because its bacon, that's extra. Fries were good, fresh cut done well and crunchy. I was on lunch from work so a can of pop, fine. But almost $20! They're getting four stars based on a tasty burger, but I have a hard time paying that when it was not the best burger I've ever had. It's up there, but I've had a better burger that cost me less. Sorry. Maybe Au Cheval is that burger.
Not sure why this place has such great reviews. Burger was so so at best. Kind of like McDonald's but with awful sauce. Good bear selection though. There are far better burger places in the city.
Amazing burger.  Just enough grease ao that it's not dry but also not overly greasy.  Plus we had a shot of Evan Williams when we placed the order!

If I could I'd give this place a million stars. I recently met the manager, Tyler. I asked him if they add anything to the burgers because they are so addictive. I once went three times in one week. I'm a huge burger fan and have tried many. The simplicity is what makes it great. It's two thin patties topped with thinly sliced pickles, djionase (sp?), and onions. I always top mine with garlic aioli. I literally have cravings for the burgers. The fries are great too. Always crunchy on the outside. Definitely know why it's rated the top in the US. I'll be back many times.

Super delicious! My favorite burger in Chicagoland since Chicago Burgerwurks in Brookfield closed. (RIP) It's a little pricey, but soooo good! My husband thinks they put too much salt, but I think it's just right. Shakes and fries are also great, especially the garlic aioli.

Earlier this winter, we visited Small Cheval for the first time while visiting our friends in Bucktown. It was a frigid evening and the restaurant was not that crowded. I ordered the cheeseburger and fries. The burger was deliciously gooey and enormously satisfying. The fries did not disappoint either. Cashier was down-to-earth and kind. I liked the casual decor of the place. Fun people watching too. I thought the meal was very good but after leaving, I wasn't saying, "This was the best ever." Just my personal feelings after listening to all the hype. I have not been to Au Cheval yet because I have an intense aversion to long wait times. I will see how it compares when I find myself in a more patient mood. xoxo
Simple menu- burger, cheeseburgers and fries- Amazing burgers with Sir Kensington ketchup!  Fabulous staff and quick service!  Great space and charm!

Wow what a great burger.  Five of us went there for lunch on a Monday.   My wife questioned the price of the burger but I think that was from usually getting mcdonalds for the kids.   When she took the first bite she dropped all objections.  To me it's the best cheeseburger in the city.   So much better than kuma's or any other if the burger places that get all the press.   These are not overloaded with eggs or other toppings.  They do it perfectly.
Great burgers and fries, solid selection of beers, casual atmosphere... and no crazy long waits like their parent Au Chevel.  The patio is really quaint for the summer.

Been in the area for only a few months, but been to small cheval three times. So amazing.  The limited menu ensures they know exactly what they're doing. The toasted bun and double patty burger are just a perfect combination. I also would consider bathing in the garlic aioli they have available in the restaurant.  Last time I stopped by the vanilla milkshake I grabbed tasted a little off, but unfortunately took it to go so wasn't able to ask about it.  Seating inside is limited in the winter with a big table and counters along the walls, so plan accordingly if coming at a busy time.

THIS BURGER WAS DANK SO DANK I got the cheeseburger (obvi) with bacon (suh crispy) and fries. They have a variety of delicious sir Kensington sauces and deeeeelicious garlic aioli for you to dip dem potatoes. This isn't at all the pretentious hipster burger (read: overhyped and not that good) I thought it was going to be - it was just a greasy tasty memory-making delight.

I was told these burgers were awesome. A single cheese burger with 2 pattys(thin for cooking speed), real cheese and a tasty bun. The meat dripped a bit and was kinda of harsh to look at due to the amount of condiments on it. the bacon was spot on and very flavorful but for 2 $ and change i would expect more than a 2 ounce slice. The fries were average and taste alot better with the garlic aioli(may be spelled wrong!) The order taker was trained well but sorry to say no eggs on the burger???  The ketchup and mustard were also tasty and were not the commons HEINZ brand. due to the lack of space a giant table was set in the middle of the place and if you come with a big group conversation will work if you speak loudly. a self serve water station with cups sat on the side if you don't feel like drinking overpriced tap beer.  The beers are steep in price and served off of a tap.   Now the tough question to ask your self if a double cheeseburger with a sliver of bacon,  some tap beer in a plastic dixie cup ,and a handful of average fries worth 17$ then this spot is made for you. FYI  plenty of people with beards, bicycles and piercings if you like to people watch...

Awesome, delicious, addicting. I dream of these burgers and I love down the street. I can't help but go at least once a week. Love the concept. They have one focus and that's burgers. The best I've ever had.

"Mmmmm, this is a tasty burger!" Jules Winnfield, Pulp Fiction. I can leave my review at just that.  Because really, if the burger can't stand alone, it's not worth a visit.  But I can talk a lot if you give me the space, so here I am, taking up the space. The Cheeseburger cooked to medium (you all should know by now that the regular cheeseburger is really two patties) is super flavorful, with just enough grease to make it indulgent. That's why I ask for lettuce and tomato so at least I get some veggies in.   You can ask for a single patty cheeseburger too, but why do that, unless you're ordering for your kid...and take it from my 4 year old, he loves their cheeseburgers too.  Their golden french fries are perfectly crispy and are a great vehicle for the garlic aioli...which is self-serve pump by the way, get some for the burger or your fries or both.  Trust.  My husband likes the house grainy mustard (also self-serve pump), it can add a vinegary element to your burger/fries and quite good too.  What else can round out a burger and fries but a milk shake, or better yet a boozy milk shake.   I have yet to try a boozy shake, but tried the regular chocolate shake and that was good.  I do also love the craft cocktails here too.   The patio is one of my favorites for lunch in the summer.  The planted greenery make nice walls to block out Milwaukee Ave's traffic noise. And there's plenty of seating.  Service is nice.  Super casual spot with elevated diner style burgers.  I've not been to Au Cheval yet.  When I vist I guess I can compare the burgers.  But really it doesn't matter, let's give a shout out to the little sibling. Small Cheval, you done good.

Burger is slightly above average. Fries were disappointing. Chocolate shake was solid. I have Au Cheval & Cochon Volant tied for #1 best burgers. Small Cheval is top 10 worthy, but definitely behind Butcher & the Burger.
Think: Big Macs, but like a million times better.  Awesome, crispy fries, too.  Who cares that they only serve one thing--they do it really well!  Only downside is that it's a bit pricey.

Great lil burger joint with limited menu and focused on the task at hand.  Pump out quality burgers and fries and beverages. Chocolate shake was tasty and my colleague had a beer on tap. It's small, clean and neat in what looks like was once a dingy neighborhood corner bar/pub. Friendly staff and quickly turned over seating makes this an easy quick "feed"..

#300, and for a very particular reason. the experience here is vastly different from au cheval, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. it truly feels like you're hanging with the hip, younger sibling (and i love being that sibling myself). i appreciate the minimal, down-to-the-point menu, and the food is excellent. but the *real* reason why i decided this deserved the big three-zero-zero? because. if you only get ONE thing here, it *~has~* to be a chocolate fernet milkshake. TRUST ME. i'll be waiting for those words of affirmation.

I haven't been to Au Cheval so I can't compare the two. I thought Small Cheval's burger was just OK. The buns got pretty soggy in the middle of my meal, which mixed with the melted cheese and created a sort of gooey mess. Taste wise, it was very well seasoned and the patty juicy, which further contributed to the gooey mess. I like the very simple menu. Hamburger or cheeseburger and fries. It's a no fuss or frills place. Great for after work when you're tired and don't want to think about what to order.

Burgers were on point. I also tried the spiked milk chocolate milk shake. Couldn't go wrong. Seating can get a little crowded. They opted for communal type seating with a big table in the middle and wall bars around the edges. Very different than au cheval, but the food is still great!

Pretty good burgers and fries. They have a sauce pump of garlic aioli, which was really good on the fries. The indoor seating was limited on a busy night but during the summer they have a very large patio.

Finally got a chance to try it out. It lived up to hype. Got in and ordered right away. They have High Life on tap so I was sold on the place immediately. The cheeseburger was cooked perfect. One of the better burgers in the area.
cheeseburger hamburger french fries 3 item food menu.  a simple burger done very very well.  not fancy but  definitely not boring.

After having one of the best burgers ever at Au Cheval last summer, I have been waiting to go again. Problem is Au Cheval is downtown, parking sucks, theres long lines, and its just not convenient. Then I heard theres another option right here in wicker park, done. The place is a little red hut, hard to miss. The inside is just as small. The menu is clear and simple. They have liq and beer in there. The burger is not as good as AU, but with all things considered, its a pretty damn good burger.
Easily one of the best burgers I've had in my life. A bit pricey, but worth it. Great vibe/mood. I would definitely come back.

Awesome burger!  Great margaritas!!!   Quick courteous service  with a nice ambience. You can only get burgers , fries and beverages, but who needs anything else!   Great alternative to the main one on Randolph.   Thank you to the management for opening the one!!!

Look, it's fine. Has the whole beer-and-a-shot thing going on. Seating arrangements don't make much sense unless Small Cheval wants high turnover, which is probably true. Atmosphere follows the same urban rustic motif as many other places. Burgers and fries are worth trying but not worth a repeat unless you live down the block. Not sure what that means, because you don't have a ton of options that close to you if you do. There it is.

I know the entire city is all up in hype about Au Cheval and trust me, they should be because its unreal. But waiting 2 hours to eat a burger and get 40 likes on your instagram is absolutely bananas. Small Cheval is the new Au. Is quick, easy and to the point. I went this past Saturday night at 7:00, got a high top along the window after ordering and waiting for maybe 2 minutes and had my food within 10. Burger equaled Au in every way. I was also here back in the summer and the outdoor area is real sweet. Very low key "fast food" place which is great if you just want the burger (Au Cheval has more options on their menu).

These folks make a good cheeseburger. I like the decor and the coziness of the space, too. The prices are a little steep, but in this case you get what you pay for. I've been told that Au Cheval is superior, but this location is probably going to be less crowded, so suit your priorities. I'll be back. it's conveniently located just a couple blocks northwest of the Blue Line station at Damen.

This is my first time at this restaurant and the reason I am giving it a 3 is because the staff was not warm and welcoming. Yes the cashier took my order and yea the service was quick but the cashier really wasn't friendly and the person that gave me my food just handed me the bag no thank you or come again or anything. He was talking to another staff person at the time just having a regular conversation not even work related didn't even turn to me to give eye contact just grabbed my bag and handed off to me without skipping a beat with the other staff member. Well I at least hope the food is good as reviewers say it is.

We went here on a whim and didn't even really feel like having a burger but are so glad we did!  It is now amongst our favorite spots to get some quick delicious food.  The burgers were awesome, juicy, and flavorful.  The fries were hand cut which is always nice and their garlic aioli on self-serve was definitely the clincher for how much we enjoyed our visit.  Not to mention the delicious baileys Irish creme milk shake, an impulsive and decidedly great order!

Very tasty burger!  Outdoor seating is nice in the summer.  Indoor seating is not very comfortable or inviting and music is too loud to have a good conversation, so it's not a place you will want to linger after you finish eating.

Oh sweet Fresca succubus! How well you go with this delicious burger. Aioli, you minx, wrapping my fries in your naughty embrace. Small Cheval - the Infinite Jest of hamburgerias. It loops back on itself until you find yourself being consumed by the very food you just ate. More please.

Went at 10:30 at night after we saw the line for Au Cheval was 2 hours. There was no line. We got our food 10 mins later. If all you want is the burger come here. It's the same company and same burger but just with less options for toppings. Great selection of craft beer according to my dad. And the burger and shake was absolutely amazing. Can't wait to come back.  Summary: A $9 cheese burger with pickle, onion, and dijonaise Awesome and friendly staff Really fast Come here if u want a simple au cheval burger and don't want to wait 2-5 hours Can't wait to be back, thanks Small Cheval!

The burger was at best average to me. It was basically a double cheese burger from McDonald's with higher quality ingredients, and greasier. I would take In N Out or Five Guys over this place any day of the week. Personally I would give this place 1 Star for how much I like the food, but that's only my opinion. I did come with a group of 7 people. Out of the whole group all but one agreed with me, and the one that liked it loves McDonalds, and thought it was average at best. The place is clean, food was made fast, we didn't have to wait to get a seated, and the staff was friendly. I just think the place is over hyped. I'm so glad we didn't wait 2.5 hours for Au Chavel, and came here instead.

The burgers here are as superb as those at the original joint on Randolph.  The chocolate shake is thick and creamy, and they have cocktails on draft.  The cocktails are fine but suffer a bit for being drafted.  Still tasty though. Solid spot overall.  Lines can be long sometimes but if you have an afternoon off 3 PM is a great time to stop by.

My boyfriend and I were en route for empanadas, but we couldn't wait....so we stopped here. Patience is not a virtue when one is hangry.    Anyway, it was just what we needed. I had a mouth full of protein earlier, but I needed more. I should have gotten lettuce and tomato on my burger, but there are lots of things I "should have" done in life.   Overall, pretty good. I was happy.

If you're just interested in getting the best burger in the US then go here. Its a much shorter wait but you still get a cool vibe. I don't eat burgers but I can vouch for their fries. They are perfect. Not soggy, too salty, or burnt. Just right. If we weren't here in the middle of the afternoon then I would have tried a cocktail.  This place is solid.
Great for lunch. The burgers are delicious, and if the weather is nice, you can enjoy the patio. Not sure how this place would be in the winter, though.

Showed up at 10:59am and was the only fool in line... Perfect considering I hate people, but I expected a small line on a Friday! Smaller joint and they only have two things on the menu: Cheeseburger & Fries. You can add their diabolical bacon for $2 if you want... which I highly recommend! The guy at the register was awesome and the order came out pretty quick. They have a counter full of great condiments as well as the famed "Garlic Aioli"! Make sure to try the "Natural Ketchup" on the far left... good shit. The burger was awesome, hot, cheese oozing out and plenty of pickles! The fries were also cooked perfectly and very tasty/ def using a different kind of HQ potato here folks. Only gripe would be the price/ it's $16 for DBL CB with Bacon and a sack of fries so be ready to bite the bullet! Parking on the side streets; skip Milwaukee and the "Pay to Park" scam. Must try joint! gdd
I'm obsessed.  Consistently awesome and the garlic aioli is insanely good. I can't wait until it's warm enough to sit outside again.

As opposed to the burgers at Au Cheval, this place uses beef fat to cook their meat. Au Cheval uses pig lard, apparently, and that was a no-no for me, religion-wise. But I had always heard amazing things about Cheval's burgers, so I was glad to pay this spot a visit with my friend during lunch hour. I had a cheeseburger with fries. I swallowed the cheeseburger and will have to go there again to remember whether the fries are worth writing home about. I remember the garlic aioli dip was to die for. It's quite pricey, but it's a damn good burger. There was harmony between the bun, the meat, the cheese, and simple condiments. Thank God it's a bit out of the way, as a line for lunch hour is pretty deep as it is. Outdoor seating is a plus, giving it a laid-back ambiance. The staff there seemed pretty upbeat. Also, shoutout to Abdul.
Love the late hours and menu is nice and simple. Make sure to get extra garlic aoili sauce!

I love this place. My roommate and I have this pact to go every month and we usually stick to it. I haven't been to the parent restaurant, but honestly I don't need much more to my burger than cheese and bacon. But that garlic aioli? All if it on all of the food.  Yes, it's pricey for a burger, but the bacon is worth it.

OMG. Simple perfection.  love the menu: Hamburger: Cheeseburger.  House dressed Cheeseburger, fries and a chocolate shake. Best I have ever had. Fries, fresh and crisp, not a drop of grease to be seen or tasted. Garlic Aioli for dipping is heavenly CHeeseburger, moist, not over done, juicy without dripping.  Go there. It is incredible.  Ok, a bit pricy for the trio, (burger, shake and fries, but totally worth it).

The burgers and fries are amazing, make sure to put the garlic aioli on everything. Service is pretty fast considering how busy they usually are. The only downside is it's a bit pricy for a burger and fries, but it's well worth the price in my opinion.

Amazing! Simply amazing.  I'm not sure what kind of magic they perform on their burgers but they're awesome! It's nothing fancy, just a nice little burger joint with a straight forward menu. The prices are on the premium end, but in my opinion, well worth it.  This has become a place that we literally get cravings for now.

if you can drop by during their off hours, this is one of the best burgers you can get in Bucktown. Their house mayo, aolie and ketchup taste great - get some extra to take home. Amazed by how consistently they nail the medium rare patties every time, especially considering how thin they are. The fries are crisp but not greasy. You may want to sprinkle some extra salt on though - but that's just me. I'll admit, I'm not a huge fan of the buzzers they use to alert you when your order is ready. What is this, Fuddruckers?

It was just another day at work, and I needed adventure. Time for a lunch break. It was cold and windy, almost too cold for the walk I made to Small Cheval, but nothing prepared me for the shift between atmospheres once I walked in the door. Holiday season was full throttle, drinks were being had, and connections were being made. It was the older clientele that threw me off. No one in here seemed unattractive to me, but then again, Parallel Lines by Junior Boys was pumping through their sound system. A song I hadn't heard since my apartment was robbed, and all my music was taken away. Even the staff seemed sexual. As the track switched to Feel it All Around, by Washed Out, I knew I was right. This place not only cranks out excellent cheeseburgers, they are sexual cheeseburgers. I'm not gonna lie, I was a little intimidated about not knowing what I was getting myself into. I stepped up to the counter and the man at the register already had that look on his face that said, "We only like customers who know what they want." I didn't know what I wanted. I had never been here before, and I tried to put on my best face that said, "Be patient with me. It's my first time." It felt like they were about to rob me of the last piece of innocence I had. Once I had that burger in my mouth, I enjoyed every minute of it.   They made me wait. While I waited, I felt my anticipation grow. Or was it my anxiety picking up being surrounded in such a small space by sexual holiday foodies? I couldn't tell. My emotions were all over the place. I finally found my second wind of confidence and began to look around the restaurant. Along with the Richard Geres (circa early '90s) in puffy Columbia Jackets (ribbed for your pleasure), I began to relax as I noticed maybe 2 other normal people, being painfully normal. A young couple, oblivious to their surroundings, trapped in their bubble of heteronormative lifestyle. They stood out like a sore thumb. I began to wonder if this entire experience was all in my head like a David Lynch film. There was a host, more like a Maitre d, who managed to make eye contact with me. I had forgotten about the vibrator in my had, which would signal that my order was up. He assured me everything would be fine. The wait would not be much longer, and my food would be everything I needed it to be. I'm glad I ordered my food to go. As soon as i got my burger, I ran. More like a brisk walk. I knew that burger needed a minute to cool down to a temperature that would allow me to swallow without burning my throat. I was breathing heavy, and for the first time, I exhaled as I charged through the doors of my work and into the break room. For a moment, I was alone, and I undressed, I mean unwrapped, that burger slowly.  Then I showed that burger who's boss, sinking my teeth in like Lorena Bobbitt. Alas, I was in love, and she was beautiful. Pink on the inside. Moist. Medium, just like the man at the register told me it would be. My entire daydream faded as quickly as the onset. "WHERE DID YOU GET THAT?" It felt so confrontational. I was guilty. I stumbled over my words. It didn't take long to pull my coworker into my world. She didn't need to touch or taste in order to tell I was having a love affair with a burger. She only needed her sense of smell and the visual of the melting cheese and immediately knew what was going on. Finally, she left me alone so I could finish.

Yeah, yeah , yeah, I hear that everyone enjoys the burger from Small Cheval's older brother, Au Cheval. What if you don't want to schlep yourself and your homies all the way to the West Loop? Our answers have been answered by offering delicious burgas in Wicker Park.  Amen! Small Cheval's menu is much more simple than his older brother. I walk up and see a line but its moving because the guys on the line are cranking these burgers out in record time. I ordered a burger, no cheese with all the fixins with the bacon, fries and a shake (don't judge me). The place is small with extended outdoor seating. Everything here is super simple pop-up-esque dining.  I love it. You order. You pay. You find a seat and eat. First you need to recognize the amazing condiments line. Shout out to the garlic aioli! I have already decided to dip my fries and slather that on my burger. Our order arrived and the first thing I do is bask in this mighty burger's glory. Perfectly cooked and not overcooked which a lot of burgers can be. Mr. Sodikoff aint goin' out like that. The dijonaise on the burger adds a different level of flavor and adding to the juicy flavor. The bacon really makes the burger in my honest opinion. This burger is not the exact same as its older bro, Au Cheval and thats OK with me. Small Cheval has its own burger identity and I am a fan. The fries where golden brown and(dipped in garlic aioli) made that whole trip worth it and my chocolate shake (ps. You can make it a boozy shake if you want) was the cherry on top of an awesome dinner.  Prices are reasonable for a quality gourmet burger. They offer all kinds of drinks alcoholic and non-alcoholic alike. Easy to get to with street parking.
I don't get it.  It is a mediocre hamburger in a nasty space. The foodies love Cheval. I left scratching my head.

Small cheval is a really good burger and a pretty decent patio.    I was just expecting amazing which im not sure that the burger was.  The bacon and the sauce definitely make the burger.  They've got schlitz was a bonus as well.

Small Cheval does have a very limited menu but it definitely has one of the best burgers I've ever had.  The fries were on point as well.  A+ for also have garlic aioli, mayo, ketchup, etc on the side for convenient access.  Would definitely go back again.
Burgers were delish... a little pricey.. but worth it.. for me... it was a little salty... but I usually like a little more bland than salty..... u must try their shakes

So this place has to be a cash cow. They simply churn out a very small menu, hamburger and slap some cheese on it and you have their second main entree, the cheeseburger. What a great concept! Sell one of the most popular burgers in Chicago in its own little hut...you have small cheval. If you haven't been here or its big sister Au Cheval, you're definitely missing out! Pit this on your bucket list. Also, the garlic aioli is an awesome touch. Now, If you're reading this Mr. Sodikoff, where can I find the pizza from the previous tenants?!

The part that I love most about this place is the simplicity of the menu. Do you want hamburger? Y/N Do you want cheeseburger? Y/N Fries? That's about it. Burgers were filling and made it hard for me to breathe later. The beer was on the pricier side. Walked away spending $30 on 2 burgers, a beer, and fries. Eeeeek. You can save money elsewhere, but if you're around, yeah this is fine.
The coffee milkshake is amazing! The great Cheval burger without the wait and the best service I've had with this company yet! Great job!

My favorite dish at Au Cheval is their burgers so instead of waiting for the usual hour I just head over to Small Cheval! I would save this for a recovery meal and for your hear day bc you'll want the burger, fries and the Shake!
Small Cheval is a amazing addition to the hog salt family. Delicious Burgers!, excellent service, and a staff that cares. Bravo Small Cheval!

After debating for hours about whether to go to Au Cheval or Small Cheval (here after referred to as Regular and Small, respectively, as per our nickname for the places), my friend and I took the plunge and decided to try Small this past Friday. She was insistent on walking and avoiding public transportation (an abnormal New Yorker) and Small was only a 20 minute walk, whereas Regular was an hour and 20. Small won by a landslide (considering the 35 degree weather). The menu was horribly extensive (just kidding) - a whole 3 items to choose from. But really, those three (or for my needs, two) items on the menu are all you need - fill your stomach with an out of this world cheeseburger and an order of their delicious golden fries and you'll be thinking about this meal for days, as I've been doing. Another one of the best parts is the 5-part condiment line, including 2 different kind of ketchups, mustard, mayonnaise, and garlic aioli. Yes, that's right folks, UNLIMITED GARLIC AIOLI.  My friend and I rated the cheeseburger an 8 - it was double-pattied juiciness, with a great dijonaise, pickles, and lettuce. It was probably the best burger I've had in a longggg time and definitely more than I expected from Regular's smaller sibling. To be honest, I would say that in some instances, this burger may actually be better than Regular's. Yup, that's right, I said it. Avoid the long lines and wait times at Regular and go to Small for a hella good burger.  And even though we were so full and ate so much we felt like vomming, we took the plunge and got a milkshake as well. Chocolate? Vanilla? Hm, vanilla. No, chocolate. Most people have chocolate. But I usually like vanilla. The debates continued so my friend went ahead and asked someone who worked there what he would do, and he recommended chocolate, so we went for it. When it came out, he also brought us a complimentary vanilla milkshake, which was so nice of him. That milkshake was so good. Chocolate won. Small wins.

This is the little brother of Au Cheval, of legendary burger renown. The burgers here are not as huge and amazing as the original, but still outstanding. The place is much more casual and much less busy. You order at the counter. If you don't go in expecting Au Cheval 2, then its a great place with a great burger.

If i was blind folded and had to taste test multiple burgers to guess where theyre from, I would guess Small Cheval's burger right every time! Truly a tasty burger!! Small place, so avoid busy times or take to go.

The cheeseburger was incredibly delicious and I absolutely loved the fries with garlic aioli dipping sauce. I wish I could eat more, but the burger was very filling. We went around 6pm on a Thursday and the wait was not bad at all. Loved the vibe. It was too cold to sit outside, but seems like its a great outdoor space in the warmer months. I would definitely recommend Small Cheval to any carnivore.

Yasssss! Why had I not come here sooner. Burger meat is just like Au Cheval's. Comes with Dijonnaise, pickles, and onions. You have to pay extra for bacon.
