Lettuce and tomato are complimentary if you choose to add it on. Very simple menu. Fries are ON POINT. Perfection. Thick, but not too thick. Every surface area of each fry was crispy. Love that they let you get condiments, including garlic aioli, yourself. It's an order, get a buzzer, and pick up your order kinda place. It is a little pricier than other "casual" burger joints, but you do get an amazing burger. There is a little bar with beer options. Friendly staff. One point off for no egg as an add-on option.  Btw, their bathroom soap smells really good. LOL
Delicious burgers, delicious fries. I'm definitely a fan. I wish they offered a smaller portion because I definitely cannot finish a burger this size!

If you don't want to wait forever for the real thing at Au Cheval, head over to here to Small Cheval.  Cool space and more room to eat and breathe compared to the cramped diner of the original.  Simple menu of hamburger or cheeseburger with or without bacon and a side of fries.  You spend more time thinking about what you want to drink than eat here and which condiments off to the side you want to use.  I was a tad disappointed in the actual burger, the bun seemed sad and not as toasted buttery goodness as the original, and the patty was on the dry side and not as juicy.  Sigh.  The crispy fries and the amazing garlic aioli were the redeeming factors.  I wish I could have tried one of their boozy drinks (the double chocolate martini caught my eye) or milkshakes, but that will have to wait for another time when I'm back on the dairy wagon and no longer nursing.  Or I can just go to Au Cheval, it really is worth the wait and trek.

If they didn't have Cheval in the name it would be a four or five star burger.  The burgers are perfect.  Juicy and flavorful. My biggest complaint is the bacon is not the same peppery bacon slab they serve at Au Cheval. It was two little half strips of bacon.  Plus you can't get an egg on it. I was hoping this would be a great way to get an Au Cheval without the multi hour wait. This is just a good burger, but costly.
Loved my coffee milkshake and burger!  Outstanding combo!
All I will and can say is I had one of the best burgers of my life here. Their chocolate milkshake was also a glorious treat.  Everyone should come here.

Nothing special. It's not terrible, but a hamburger is not worth nine dollars unless it's some kind of special grass-fed, locally sourced, organic thing. And three dollars extra if you want fries? You're better off going to steak n'shake or in and out burger.
Great burgers.    Quick and easy without the lines.    They keep it simple.   Cheeseburger or hamburger?   Wait was very short.
I go late at night during the week to avoid the crowds. Nothing is as delicious as this burger. Also love the patio.

I'm not huge on presentation or paying extra for anything fancy but I do love food. I think these burgers are still really good. I wanted a little late night snack so my friend and I split a burger and we liked it!

I usually wait for a few visits before writing a review... BUT.. the bad taste from my one Sunday Afternoon stop has me bewildered.  Many times I have driven by the large painted sign advertising the micro-menu, so when I stopped in and was told that the signature burger was not available at 3:30pm 'while they change over' ... I was put into shock.   The staff offered a shake as the only menu option in token consolation.   A G! D! burger shack... cinder block building with a service bar and simple seating has no room closing down a micro-menu for a change over seen in full menu restaurants.   This encounter with inflated self-worth and egotism has me doubtful that I will ever taste this burger that has been so well received.  -  update: I did stop in and was actually served ... tasted like what I remember Wendy's tasting like but 10 or 11 bucks for an OK cheeseburger that left me still hungry -I bet with a fry I would have been filled but that would have left me at $15 or so.

Great burgers and fries at Small Cheval.  The line was wrapped around the inside when we visited, but it probably only took about 20 minutes to get to the front and order.  Once ordering our food was ready super quick.  Love that you can get your own condiments including the Garlic Aioli!  I do think the burgers are better at Au Cheval, but for the quick wait,  Small Cheval is well worth it!

For those who don't want to make the trip to Au Cheval and wait 3 hours to be seated, this is definitely the place for you. You're limited to only burgers, however they are amazing. Highly recommend slathering some of their garlic aioli  on your burger. They also offer some cheap beers/liquor. Not a ton of seating available but they do have a nice patio out back.

One place I know that's probably best known for their sauce, but it's worth the trip! Garlic Aoli!! Dip your fries in it. Slather your burger with it. Or stick your straw in it! I just loved it and how they make all their condiments themselves. It really showcases their attention to detail.  Their fries were perfectly deep fried where it's not soggy and had that tiny snap in it with every bite. Plus the standard medium rare burgers were really above par than other rivaling places. And the $3.99 vanilla shake was really a steal for the sweet creaminess that it was.  But the burgers and fries, as good as they were, wasn't worth their asking price. If the burgers were a few bucks less or, honestly, slathered with their garlic Aoli, this place would be rated so much higher.  All in all, grab the cup for water and fill it with the Aoli and you'll forget whatever else you were having. Nice people, great location; this place is worth the trip back!

Finally went here today for a cheeseburger.  We got there about an hour after they opened and there was only one table open inside.  Luckily, it was gorgeous today and there are plenty of tables outside.   I had a cheeseburger with bacon and fries.  The food didn't take long to be ready.  My burger was awesome!!!   It definitely lived up to all of the "hype".  Was it the best burger I have ever had - maybe.  I honestly can't think of the last time I had a burger that delicious.  The fries were great too but nothing special like the burger.  You can only order a hamburger, cheeseburger and fries (foodwise).  The inside is pretty dark and small.  Street parking was easy but we were there early.  I had a vanilla shake on the way out.  It was yummy!  I want to come back to this place next time I am craving a cheeseburger.  I am always craving cheeseburgers so I will be back soon!

When I stuck my head inside to inquire if my dogs could sit at the very cool back patio, the manager smiled and said,  "Absolutely!". The place has such a great vibe! Totally yummy,  Cheeseburger  with Bacon,  fries and Chocolate milkshake with a shot of Baileys,  yummy again! Sat outside on a gorgeous night with my 2 Labradoodles (who incidentally were watched by 2 gorgeous angels named Alice &  Rebecca whilst I ordered) and we were all loving life!!  Everything was just exactly perfect!!!   Will return many times!!!  Thanks for reading hope this was helpful.

So this is the little, less attractive sister of Au Cheval huh?  If you ask me she looks plenty attractive, and can hold her own. I love that this place is just straight to business, which is making some succulent, make you taste buds do the whip and nae nae type burgers.   Burger and a shot is a nice touch, but I was on my lunch break, so burger and a Coke suited me fine.The burger was oozing with flavor, and that ooey, gooey, cheese on top was like icing on the beef patty cake.  This is a nice new addition to the Wicker Park dining scene They have a nice outdoor patio on warmer days, and the 606 trail is literally across the street. So you can, walk, bike, or jog off some calories if you wish. I already picture myself here next summer, basking in the sun with a burger in one hand, and a beer on the other. FYI: That garlic aioli is that crack sauce!

Rivals Au Cheval for it's burger and fries, no questions. Have been here twice now, burgers both times (it's all you can get). But the burgers...man.... they rule.  Top your char-broiled, cheesy, mayo, pickles off with some aioli from the complimentary condiments bar and you're on your way to a great afternoon in Bucktown.  Easy entry, solid food, great hipster selection of beers, and GET A MO**ER F**CKING MILKSHAKE.

Burger patties don't come hot and fresh, they sit in a metal tray.  The kitchen is tiny so there is a backup of some sort, causing the patties to sit on standby. Burger is still very good regardless but they need to do something to improve this.

I'm so glad I was able to check this place out before the cold sets in. I got here around 6:30pm on weekday and there were only 3 people in front of us. Awesome! The inside is small, dim and a bit noisy. The outside patio is cute and spacious and we luckily came on a warm fall evening. Not sure how accessible this place will be during the winter when there is not enough room to sit inside. The bf and I both got the cheeseburger with bacon and shared an order of golden fries. We both thought the burger was really good. The taste is veeery similar to au cheval's burger. The fries are crunchy and cut a little thicker. And the garlic aioli is addicting as ever. I feel like the amount of food was perfect. I had just enough space to grab some dessert afterwards. Overall, this burger is one of best burgers I've had. It's not as decadent as au cheval's, but it does the trick and it's much easier to get ahold of. I'll be back, for sure.

Very underwhelmed. Maybe it's because I've never been to Au Cheval, so I don't have a reference point; but I do know that 30 for two cheeseburgers and fries was a little excessive.  The burger was good. It reminded me of burgers from back home. The fries were...well, fries. Nothing to even mention. The aioli was really boring.  The service was really good for being self-service. Everyone was kind and helpful.  Do yourself a favor and just go to Parts and Labor. Same thing, cheaper, without the little-kid-trying-to-fill-big-brothers-shoes vibe (think "Stand By Me" but with more burgers).

Nothing like its predecessor, Small Cheval promises to underwhelm. The line is not nearly as long as at it's big sister spot... So that's a plus. At a bare minimum, at least I didn't have to wait as long to be disappointed. When they say, "no substitutes", what they mean is... We mostly pre fab your burger like on a conveyer. Henry Ford said it well.... You can have any color Ford you want.... As long as its black.  The people were really nice. But, it seemed to be a huge ordeal, and just not possible to avoid putting mayo on my burger. Hey mayo... F$&# you! That s#!+ is disgusting, and I have an allergic reaction to that horrible stuff.... Ok. Maybe it's partly in my head. Like most people's gluten allergies. Hahaha. But, I wasn't asking for a substitute. Only that you skip a step. I get that you have a small kitchen, and can't have all the things that one can order on their burger at the main location. But, they then proceeded to tell me that I could order two kids cheeseburgers, and reassemble them to make a single adult burger.... Oh, but it would cost me twice as much. Seemed a bit petty and insulting. That only said, "We can do what you're asking. But, we're too stuck up to actually do it."  I felt pretty embarrassed in front of my friends that, over the last three years, I've convinced they were going to eat the best burger of their lives. I had to order the mediocre fries, and pretend to be happy with them. But, the ketchup was fantastic. If you like mayo, it's probably not a bad experience. If you want more say in what goes onto your plate, check out Revolution. They have a great burger, that you can get without mayo.... I mean, seriously.... It's a food item that smells like morning breath. Hahaha.

As the little sister to the Au Cheval burger with just a little bit more of a fast food twist, this is the best new addition to Wicker Park. Our most recent visit was at 6pm on a Friday and though the line got longer at some points during our dinner, it was never out the door as the service is impeccably fast. The milkshakes are awesome, and the burger and fries are VERY similar to that of Au Cheval... The fries being the same style but just a bit thinner, and the burger seemingly only varying in the type of bacon you can add on top and the option to add lettuce and tomato. The quality, as expected, has been excellent during every visit and the service is very fast and extremely friendly.

After hearing so much about it, I finally braved the line that was out the door - knocking past children and the elderly alike to get my hands on this sweet, sweet meat.... And it was just okay. Food: I had the cheeseburger with bacon and everything on it, with golden fries. The burger was good, don't get me wrong, but it wasn't any better than the diner near my apartment. The fries were okay too - nothing special. Actually, my favorite thing at the restaurant was the garlic aioli sauce for the fries. Yum! Service: The service was fantastic. Everyone was super friendly and seemed very happy to be there. There is no table service though, you get a buzzer and come pick up your food. That's perfectly fine, just manage your expectations. Environment: The inside is pretty small, but they have a nice outside area with plenty of seating and tables - so if you go in the winter, it might be better to take out.

I have been wanting to try Small Cheval, I didn't want to wait in a long line for a burger..thankfully- at 1PM on a dreary Thursday -no line.  My order was simple enough, kind of like the menu- Cheesburger, with bacon, tomato and lettuce- Vanilla Milkshake- price- was just over 17 bucks with tax- OUCH! Let me start by saying the milkshake was 5 stars- perfect- As I was getting some ketchup and the garlic aioli(which is a nice add on), I was looking for some salt- none to be found- turns out they have one salt shaker for the whole place- the guy behind the counter explained they didn't think their food need any more seasoning than what they cook with- so I  skipped the salt on the burger- I suppose it didn't need any extra salt- The Cheeseburger- was a little under cooked for a thin burger (two of them) ..There was a thin piece of tasteless bacon- certainly not worth 2 bucks- couldn't even taste it.. So you have a ten dollar burger a four dollar milk shake- I skipped the fries in favor of my waistline.  I really think you get a better burger and shake at Culver's for half the price of Small Cheval.  Culver's is everywhere- Small Cheval is in Wicker Park- so if you're there- you are there.  I am glad I don't have to rush back to Small Cheval.

Tiny building with limited and cramped seating, but we were able to get some spots on stools fairly easily on a Saturday night.  Pro tip: there are bars nearby that would allow you to take your food if you want more space ie Map Room. Delicious cheeseburger.  Every burger is a double and that's how it should be everywhere in my opinion.  The meat is the star of these burgers with only classic toppings added, but the meat is fantastic.  The fries are great too!  I definitely recommend checking it out and deciding for yourself.
Had the cheeseburger with bacon tonight. Once again it doesn't fail. Please pay this place a visit. This might be my candidate for best burger in the city right now.

Alright, FINE! I was really hungry when I wrote my last review, and they were closed, and now there are hours listed. Mea culpa! BUT I still think a phone number to call and check would be tops.  Anywho, the food was great (excellently done smashed burger), beer was a good mix of high and low, and there's a fancy ass mayonnaise.  Also, the bathroom mirror said "Fantastic Man" on it, and that seemed like a nice thing to say.  Final Review Score: I give this place 4 1/2 Burgers and 3 orders of fries.

Don't come in here expecting an Au Cheval level burger and you may enjoy it. Think wendy's with less homeless people and twice as much. I got the cheeseburger with Bacon and you could barely taste it. That was a waste of $2. the fries were hard and, let's be serious here, the "garlic aoili" was just mayonnaise with garlic mixed in. Conceptually they're the same, but not really. The Margarita was terrible. I must admit the vanilla shake was the best I ever had at a restaurant. Props for that, but I would probably never come here again. Au Cheval isn't that much further away, just go there.
They don't have a big menu, but what they do have, they do well. Awesome cheeseburger for $10! Fries are PERFECT (if you like them on a slightly saltier side like me).

Stopped in her for lunch, of course burgers were delicious just like the Randolph location. Just crazy how two burgers and a shake can be over 30 dollars.....but price is worth the taste! :) fast service, and the chocolate shakes are sooooo good!

After a week of my wife proclaiming Small Cheval's cheeseburgers to be the best she's had in Chicago, I swung by for some takeout.  It should be noted that the to-go game is pretty fast at Small Cheval and the burgers hold up reasonably well. Only real complaint is that the hot fries are thrown in the bag kind of loosely and do not stand up to a 10 minute commute in the car. A simple wax paper bag would fix this. And while the burgers were delicious, they are NO QUESTION better right off the griddle vs to-go. This time around I added the tomato, lettuce and bacon options. No question it was satisfying 10 minutes after pickup but yeah... NO QUESTION these burgers are best eaten fresh. And seriously, no need for the tomato, lettuce or bacon. The default Small Cheval cheeseburger is perfect, as is. Jah Bless.

Perfection at its best. Perfect location, very thought out while choosing the area. I l o v e au cheval I do,  And I love wicker park, so I am grateful when I am out drinking I can grab a delish cheval burger and not wait an hr for it. The burger is great, no egg is not an option or those delish chicken wings at au cheval but if you want to grab a quick gourmet burger in the area go here. And the fries are amazing with the aioli dipping sauce, and drinks are served here omg. They are genius for this move.
Solid burger, but $50 for lunch?!! 2 burgers, both added bacon, we each got a beer and one order of fries (mediocre fries)....it's good but not $50 good.

man oh man. I was so happy when this place opened up near me. The ONLY reason I give this place a 4 star is because I compare the burger to Au Cheval's burger and I would say it's like... 82% there. I miss that fried egg so bad. Beyond that, this place is incredible. Burgers are perfect compared to anything else you can get around here. Been here 4-5 times since it opened and I don't plan to stop. One of my favorite sunday lunch handover treats.

So I had heard all the hype about Au Cheval's burgers and so was happy to hear about this place opening. The menu is simple. Either you get a hamburger or cheeseburger with fries. They also have soda and some beer options. The place got busier after we got our food which you get a buzzer to let you know when to pick it up. I thought the burger was really delicious, but my friends said it was not as good as the ones at Au Cheval. I would return again but its far from me and I wouldn't wait in line for it.

The perfect burger in every way.  Medium rare beef, awesome sauce, dexterous bread, crisp pickle. Small Cheval has burger simplicity down to a science. There is no amount of toppings that Kuma's or Lockdown could add to rival the flavor of these burgers.  There is no need for cheese, or even bacon on your burger; it does not need it.  Though the bacon they do use is a perfect thick and smoky cut. Small Cheval is to the point, and very much the best burger in the City! The cash register doubles as a bartender with $3 shots. They have unique local beets on draft. There are additional sauces on the wall that are quite impressive. The patio is going to be packed in the summer! Get on it!

Had very high expectation for their burgers. They are pretty good but not sure if I would want to pay $9 for those small burgers and a long wait. Their garlic aioli is so delicious though. Also, Still want to try their main location Au Cheval next time.

This is the place to go if you want a burger that is fast food style in Chicago.  So good. The fries were meh. The beer selection is more than adequate for an establishment of this type. That being said no way would I wait in line for 45  or more for a fast food cheeseburger.
Crack burger!! Go for the burger ! But don't waste your money or calories on the fires and shake !

Extremely cute place! Wait in line to place your order for a cheeseburger, hamburger and/or fries and they will alert you via restaurant light up buzzer thingy when your food is ready! They pour a mean old fashioned, very very good. Super friendly and upbeat cashier and bartender. Music is on point in there, semi loud hip hop, it makes me feel very cooool. Things not to miss in order of importance: chocolate shake with a shot of fernet!! Tastes all minty and chocolatey and makes the burger feast that much more indulgent. You know those giant pumps of ketchup you see at places with the tiny paper cups? They have those and they also have one with GARLIC AIOLI. Everyone's favorite garlicky treat. We even found parking right around the corner and seating immediately. Can't wait to come back and bring all my loved ones.

I was thrilled when small cheval opened just a 2 minute walk from my house.  Note to those coming at peak times-  the line can be intense. Stretching often around the block. If outside the line takes about 40 minute to get through.  If you have been to au cheval expect a slightly different experience.  Still very high quality burger with a killer bun and great homemade sauce. Unfortunately no egg option here like at the namesake and the bacon isn't the amazing thick cut stuff-  it is rather ordinary thin stuff.  However if you are looking for a great burger this place does the trick. Just don't expect best in the country burger. Go to the original for that. Think of small cheval as a vastly improved shake shack.  One cool thing people don't take advantage of enough is the boozy milkshake. Get yourself a vanilla shake with a shot of baileys and your world will be vastly improved.

After all this time and all the hype, I finally made to a Cheval restaurant. Small Cheaval. slimmed down menu so I indulged in the standard Cheeseburger and fries. This makes my five top burger joints in Chicago. creamy, juicy, deliciousness. I'm a fan of standard yellow mustard which was nowhere to be found. The fries had the best intentions, a little to crispy for me. I'm a fan and cannot wait to try the full menu soon. Great job, great atmosphere and the employees made the experiece great they were happy and inviting.
Classy, sassy and a little bit trashy, some definite Au Cheval vibe. And THAT BURGER. oh yes. You know the one.
The food at Small Cheval is very good. I love their burgers, fries and shakes.

My wife and I were visiting Chicago, wandering through Wicker Park and Bucktown over the weekend. We stumbled across and Small Cheval and my "I've got to try this spot" radar went off... My wife likes to stay on the straight and narrow sort of diet. You know the drill: veggies, clean protein, fish, etc.  What a man does for love...  After cajoling my wife and convincing her that we could deviate from "clean living" for a day, we walked in for lunch... And I'm glad we did.  What we experienced:  +Wonderful hospitality (Thank you Beau from San Diego. You were the best! And one of the guys going back and forth between the kitchen and patio was so polite and exuding great energy)   +The best cheeseburger I've ever had in my life. Seriously - it was amazing.  +A chocolate and Fernet milkshake that had me philosophizing on the meaning of pleasure. I know it sounds like an odd combination, but it was breathtakingly good.  +Perfect fries  Small Cheval - You guys are doing it right. Thank you for delivering quality on multiple levels!

This was a small, yet pleasing place, with a large price. The food here is very good, although there were not many choices. I had the cheeseburger and fries with a chocolate shake. The burger was very good. It was juicy and the cheese was very nicely melted onto the burger. It is a mouthful though, so if you come here make sure you are hungry. In my opinion, the fries were just right. The shake was thick and chocolaty. The catch is the price. A hamburger there is 8.95 and the cheeseburger is 9.95. The inside was a very cool experience, but unfortunately I was unable to see the outdoor seating due to rain. It is definitely a feast, but it comes with a price.

Well I am a fan of the original joint in the West Loop whenever I can get in there...LOL I heard all the hype about the opening of this place and wanted to wait to avoid all of the lines as I am not very tolerant of waiting.  Me and some buddies from the gig decided we would swing by during lunch ensuring we would not have to wait. We trecked it over from downtown and got there around 11:30 and there was maybe 3 people in front of us and we were able to order immediately. I noticed the fried egg doesn't exist here to put on the burger, but that ok as they still had the bacon for an extra $2. I got my cheeseburger (double burger) with everything including the bacon which is thinner at this location.The burger was as good as the original location and we got to sit outside on probably the last 80 degree day of the year. There is communal seating inside but it was too nice out. I regret not trying the garlic aioli as I heard it was pretty good. Im not a fan of the fries from the other location so I did not try them here. They serve beer, drinks and shakes here also to wet your whistle. Good place to stop in for lunch if you want to avoid the weekend or after work waits.

They serve a rather tasty, though unremarkable burger.  The drinks are okay. The fries are well-done, but my packet of fries contained way too many crumbs. The condiments were plentiful and of reasonable quality (the garlic aioli included).  The atmosphere is nice and reminds of the affiliated Au Cheval, but in terms of quality, Au Cheval is a step above. On a whole, this was a reasonable place to have a late dinner and a drink.

One of the best burgers I've ever had! It takes a lot to charm this pseudo hippie and veggie lover from California, but it happened here. It all started with Beau, the front man ( coincidentally from my hometown in Encinitas, CA), he sold us on the chocolate shake with some fancy liqueur in it and then the hamburgers did all the talking for the rest of the meal. Definitely worth the trip to Chicago ! Thanks for the awesome experience Small Cheval.

The burgers are fantastic, but not quite as good as at Au Cheval. You can't get a fried egg, so maybe that's it. But at least you don't have to wait 2 hours! Had a vanilla milkshake which was thick, creamy, and tasty. There's also a decent amount of outdoor seating.

Overall a good burger,   is it as good or as hearty as Au Cheval?  no,  not even close.. the bacon is not as good... the burger is smaller...    came with my girlfriend and planned on splitting the burger which is what we normally do at the mothership... but the burger was smaller, and I clearly should have just gotten my own...   you get the Au Cheval flavor,  a hint of it, but it isnt nearly as good... but that doesnt mean the burger was bad,   by all means the burger was still delicious,  it just doesnt have the same perfectness of mothership..   but hey, you dont have to wait nearly as long as the mothership,   if I had to wait 3 hours for this burger, i can tell you now please stop and go somewhere else, it isnt worth 3 hours wait for THIS burger...   can i say that about Au Cheval... yes I can say that it may very well be worth the 3 hour wait....  nevertheless,   this is still a great addition to the city..   i would come here again, if i just want a good burger without the 3 hour wait...     (although i just wish In and Out Burgers just come to chicago, then I wouldnt be going to small cheval,  I would just go to Au Cheval, and In and Out....  (sorry im just talking to myself.)
Good vibes and an awesome burger, fries and milkshake. Super friendly staff going to come back soon

This is the most disappointing review I've had to write to date. It actually breaks my heart. My best friend and I came here as huge Au Cheval fans and were very excited to try this place.  This place is nothing like the incredible Au Cheval. After an old fashioned & a pitcher of beer we were excited for our meal... HERE IS HOW IT WENT...  The burger patties were smaller and dry. The grease was soaked into the bun, which was not appetizing (I took one and a half sides off). I asked for extra lettuce and got ONE piece of lettuce. Now the fries...... NOTHING like Au Cheval!! They were small and lacked seasoning. After spending $70 for 2 people, I wish we had gone to a steak house for a real delicious meal. I'm giving it 2 stars because of the  service. The guys were nice and helpful!  Best of luck Small Cheval!

Delicious food, although probably over hyped. The fries with garlic aioli were the highlight but the burger is good too. Don't waste money on the bacon, it's thin and has no impact on the burger at all.

This place is nothing like Au Cheval.  Burger patties are thin and lack flavor. Fries are completely different, smaller, and lack seasoning. $12 for a burger with a few thin strips of bacon. Not worth it honestly. I DO NOT appreciate them trying to use Au Cheval's success to overcharge for mediocre food. Don't waste your time here! Chicago has too many excellent burger spots. If you try this place, don't say I didn't warn you, my fellow yelpers!!

I have tried unsuccessfully to get into au cheval in west loop at least a half dozen times. I was happy when small cheval opened a few blocks from my house so that. I could check out the hype. I LOVE burgers, so when I read that au cheval was rated the best burger in the country, I set my bar pretty high.  I will say that the staff is great. Very friendly and all seems happy to be there even though they are at full tilt with the constant crowd. The burger with cheese was very good the first time, undercooked the seconded time I went. Is it the best burger in the country? I hope not, but it is tasty and different than the burgers at at the Lockdown, Kumas or Trencherman, for example. I'd say it has a greasy Unami to it.  Fries are decent, but the ketchup and aioli to dip them in are amazing and help make the meal.  So, I am thrilled to have it in the neighborhood and I will continue to eat there, but i think there are burgers in the city that may top it let alone the whole country.

If you don't feel like waiting three hours to get a table at Au Cheval, this is a great alternative. Excellent burgers and fries for a great price. Just know that it won't be the exact same burger...there's no option to add an egg, and the bacon is your run of the mill thin cut. They do still have the garlic aioli on hand for you to dip just about everything in, so let that be of some comfort to you.  If you can avoid the wait at Au Cheval, by all means, go. If you want a delicious burger with a short wait time, come here. You won't be disappointed.

The burger is not amazing. However, it's a great, no frills fast food burger. The ingredients tasted fresh. The cheese was melted well. The fries were on the salty side. The shake was on point. It was the perfect consistency and a good balance of chocolate flavor without being super sweet.
Over rated burger.  Really nothing special.  There are better places for a $10 burger Greasy tasting with small bun.  Reminds me of a White Castle but a larger bun and more meat.

The burger wasn't right. The patty was thin with a thick and chewy bite. The flavor meter was lowest. I give it one star above one more, because it was a sunny day and there was a cute puppy that was sitting at the picnic tables, while I munched on the okay fries.

Yeah, Amazing. I've had it a couple times now. Its simple, they just sell a couple kinds of burger (with or without cheese and bacon). I get everything, just how a burger should be. Fries were great too. Also take as much of they aoli sauce as you can. Delicious!!

From a value standpoint, Small Cheval gets poor marks. You can get a classic burger over at George's for much less in the same style, with better bacon. The burger patties were a perfect circle, and didn't have crispy edges from the griddle. They were pre-cut, though I hope not frozen. Devil in the details and all that...  The patio here is nice and the fries are decent if not oversalted, but the whole experience left me wanting more, and thinking these guys are just milking their good press from Au Cheval. This place is just too tiny to be a relaxing or comfortable experience, you just feel like you're corralled in a chow line. Not planning to return.

I was really amped up for my first experience at Small Cheval. I had heard it was one of the best burgers in the city. When I got there the line was out the door and we almost didn't wait but it moved steady and slowly. A waitress offered us a beverage in line which I thought was nice but had us leave a tab open at the register. When we finally arrived at the register after a 35-40 minute wait in line we ordered, then reordered because we had a tab the guy behind the register wasn't aware of. Our burgers were soon ready along with our fries and shake. The burger itself was delicious but messy and not the best thing ever. We did enjoy it and probably would visit again. The patio was awesome and was a relaxing atmosphere. I just wish the burger with the add ons did not cost so much.
We just loved it. The guy who took our order let us try a few of the beers on tap before ordering one. Very friendly staff. The burgers were fantastic! We will be back.

Okay, I may be the only person here but I preferred the burger here at Small Cheval over Au Cheval. I don't know if it's the fact that I didn't have to wait 3 hours for a burger or the fact that I got to sit outside in a very relaxed environment, but it just tasted much much better over here. We got here on a Friday afternoon around 1pm and it was pretty busy as the patio was full so I was thinking I would have to wait quite a while but to my surprise I only waited inside like 10 minutes. Then when I asked the guy how long until my pager would be called, he said it would another 10 minutes which I thought is a pretty fair deal. However, my pager went off in like 2 minutes time no joke! Seriously score. I got to have this amazing burger in my hands within 15 minutes of arrival. I think that made it taste that much better. I liked the patio more than the inside maybe due to all those colored chairs and there were a few umbrellas where you can hide from the sun but this would totally be a great place in the evening if you want some comfort food or absolutely amazing burgers anytime of the year actually. Although I probably wouldn't sit outside in the winter and would grab myself a burger to go since I can imagine the inside getting tight very fast. The actual burger was delicious, I wouldn't say cheap since it's the same price as Au Cheval and fries are extra. I would make it a few dollars cheaper since it's not the same exact experience. The fries are so worth getting, super crispy and they have all their sauces you can get on the side including that much talked about garlic aoli (yep, get that). The burger itself super moist but not over done where the bread gets soggy, it's seriously the perfect all american burger and one of my faves in Chicago. I will definitely be back here and not sure if I'll be back to Au Cheval since the wait is just not worth it, but small cheval is definitely doing BIG things.

Definitely my favorite burger in the area. Here's why: -Holds together well (doesn't fall apart in my hand) -Tastes amazing (great pickles, melty American cheese, butter toasted buns, tasty greasy thin burgers) You can probably skip the fries (I like thick, crispy brown fries, and these are thin, crispy and tan) and the shakes are aight. Wait (from start to food-in-mouth) was about a half hour at 5pm on a Sunday. But for $13, you can get a great burger, a PBR, and can enjoy the fall weather on the patio. Will definitely be back!

You can't come here expecting it to be Au Cheval, otherwise you WILL leave disappointed. You just have to be in the mood for a super solid cheeseburger, fries, and a shake.  But honestly, to me, this burger was perfect. It was simple (2 patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato), perfectly complimented by their house ketchup and garlic aioli, and not in the least bit healthy or attempting to be overly "hip." Add on their golden fries (awesome) and a milk shake, and you've got classic, all-American food at its finest and most comforting (and especially great for nursing that Saturday hangover). They'll even spike your shake with Baileys (highly recommend) and serve you your beer while you wait in line... plus the awesome outdoor patio wins them that 5th star.  Small Cheval takes that old mantra of "do what you do, and do it well" to heart...they have only 3 items on the menu, but they sure do them well!!

If your a looking for an immediate laxative, this is your place , I know a burger should be juicy and tasty , but the amount of grease that comes with sure lets you know where those $9 dollars goes towards, beside the grease how about some under cooked meat mmmm yummy , first and last time I eat from this  garbage joint !!!!!
I love the ambiance of this place and the amazing burger.  The outdoor seating at night is chill and sexy.  Great place to have drinks as well.

Veryyyyy disappointing.  If it wasn't for the great patio attached, this would be a total wash. Honestly, wait the much longer time at the real Au Cheval and enjoy some cocktails on Randolph while you drool. The bacon that costs $2 extra here is NOTHING compared to the original and overall, we found everything to taste and feel warmed up. $43 for two beers, two burgers and one order of lazy fries. One of the bigger let-downs I've had in the city and I will not be back. Better luck next time, Hogsalt....

Very good burger.  One suggestion, please get a thicker pickle. You need it to cut through all the fat in the burger.  The ones they have now get completely lost.  Fries are odd. LOTS of tiny, tiny pieces. Not sure I understand this.  Best vanilla shake ever though!

Love the fries. The cheese burger is perfect. The line always moves quickly and the staff is super friendly. Now, I'm getting more tempted to go to Au Cheval which long waits always deterred me from trying. I'm glad Small Cheval is right around the corner from me.

The line was about 20 mins long but we were expecting it so it wasnt too bad. Upon entering the friendly host took our drink orders and delivered them to us in line so we could sip while we wait, that was a nice touch. He was trying to keep some people outside in line so the inside didnt get too crazy but it didnt work once he left his post as people would crowd in fast. Im sure they will come up with a better idea for better organization and less people hovering over you while you eat. The cheese burger was pretty darn good. It wasnt the best I had ever had by any means but it was tasty and the fries were too. Now, I am not a 'line waiter'.. I usually just go somewhere else rather then the new hot spot that requires lines... but wanted to see what the hype was all about and I will say it was legit overall. I probably wouldnt wait in line again but  if I arrived to no line, I would be stoked. Well priced for the hood too.

Deliciousness! I've been wanting to go to Au Cheval for quite some time, but have not been able to make it. I was so happy to hear Small Cheval opened so I could at least get a little Cheval experience. My S/O and I waited about 15 minutes on a beautiful Sunday afternoon, and decided to sit inside as outside was pretty full. We helped ourselves to water, aioli, and ketchup while we waited for our food and thought it was neat to see the burgers being freshly made.  My S/O and I really enjoyed our burgers and fries! I had a single cheeseburger, and he had a single cheeseburger with bacon both with everything! Our tummies were so happy! The burgers are soft, cheesy, and flavorful. The bun was a perfect balance to hold all the goodness inside. The fries were just how i like them, thin and crispy, not too salty. We will definitely visit again before the summer weather ends to enjoy the back patio! Hope to visit Au Cheval soon to experience the egg and bacon burger!

Wake up people... the reputation of the parent Cheval can only be worth so much!  The food plus the experience must be the best to receive 4 stars and this place doesn't come close. Lets see my $12 margarita in a plastic cup was worthless. I was expecting my burger to be a work of art. Similar to other top burger joints like Kuma's and Owen & Engine. The best burgers are created by masters and you get the opportunity to select one from the menu and enjoy something special. Not here, you get two slimy and thin pattis that soaked the bun with grease. No charred edges, no fillings like jalepeno or blue cheese, nothing just diner meat. A couple of greasy, tasteless bacon pieces, a slice of fake yellow cheddar and 10 bucks, you are done. Now if you want something better, you should ask for lettuce cause it doesn't come with and look hard for the special sauce, cause it doesn't come with. No, you have to squeeze the packets of mayo, mustard and ketchup, oh yum. Avoid this place like the plague, don't fall for the hype. Beer, burger, fries will set you back about $20. AVOID until they shape up.

My experience started out just fine. We were greeted by a friendly host who asked us if we wanted an alcoholic beverage. I ordered a hamburger with fries and a shake. This is where the trouble started... After eating most of my burger (which tasted fine), I started on my fries, which to my unfortunate surprise contained the kind of hair that doesn't grow on our heads. So, that was pretty much the end of my eating experience at Small Cheval, but the real experience had only just begun! Yep, you guessed it: FOOD POISONING. Nothing like spending Labor Day weekend locked in a bathroom because Small Cheval does not know how to prepare its food properly. Well done, Small Cheval - I hope this review makes you feel some of my pain.

You have 2 items on the menu: burger & fries. When you run out of one of those things this place seems a lot less desirable. Especially when this is hours before closing. Won't be returning not would I recommend.
Definitely on the pricey side, fries don't come with the burger, it's a grip extra for bacon, but soooooo totally worth it! Their chocolate shake is also really good. Will definitely be coming back!

In terms of food, Small Cheval is not QUITE it's big brother, but it is pretty darn close. Forget fancy toppings like truffle aioli, pickled okra, or balsamic emulsion. Small Cheval is what you want a good ol' American Cheeseburger to taste like, and in that, it is a success.  The pickles, onions, dijonaisse, cheese and bacon all work well in harmony to create the classic cheeseburger flavor. The bun is sturdy enough to hold on to all of this but doesn't take over by any means. The patties are juicy and flavorful. Yes, the bacon is thinner than Au Cheval's and no, you can't get a fried egg, but so what -- this was still a mighty fine burger. As for why this place does not get 5 stars, there definitely are some things it needs to work on: - The service is SLOW. You will not have to wait as long as you would for Au Cheval by any means, but there was still a line out the door (which I expected). However, what annoyed me was how slowly the line moved once you were inside. It's like the people ahead of me have never ordered a cheeseburger before. Which leads me to my next point... -During busy times, keep the burgers cooking. It took a little too long for us to get our food (about 25 minutes from ordering) Listen, I understand the whole, "Cooked-to-order" concept. However, when there is a line out the door and all you serve is burgers, it's not that difficult to realize that you're going to need a lot of burgers. As long as it's hot and fresh, I honestly don't mind if I get by burger only a couple minutes after I ordered it. -It's more expensive than it should be. It's not McDonald's, so I know I'm not going to pay McDonald's prices. But I shouldn't pay "sit-down restaurant" prices either. $10 (plus an extra $2 for bacon) for a counter-serve cheeseburger is a little too much. But obviously, it's not deterring people from lining up to get one yet, so who am I to judge? You would think that with all of the above negatives, my rating would be three stars, at most. But the burger is just THAT good, I am willing to overlook Small Cheval's flaws and indulge every so often.

I waited in line, since they opened there has be a line.  I love burgers and beer, so I was really excited when they opened.  I tried several time to get a burger but, I couldn't wait.  My husband and I planed on waiting in line today to get the burgers, we were so excited after all the hoopla. We liked the burgers and the garlic aioli is great.  Maybe it was too great of a thought that nothing could have lived up to the hype.  I won't wait in line again.  Good burger not great.

My coworkers and I went on a Friday afternoon for a quick lunch. Found street parking right away which was awesome. The menu is burgers, fries, and shakes and they do all three just right.The cheeseburger was perfect. I like mine medium rare and that is how it comes standard at Small Cheval, so if you want it cooked more you will have to request that. The bun was the perfect ratio of dense and fluffy and definitely helped keep all the goodness inside intact. When I went to get ketchup for my fries, I saw they had garlic aioli! Sooo good I just wanted to grab the whole container with. It was the perfect blend of tangy and sharp from the garlic and was so creamy. I put some in my burger and dipped my fries in them. Honestly,  I would go again just for the garlic aioli! We sat out in the patio which was spacious and quaint  and it was perfect Chicago weather to sit out and eat a good burger. The service was fast and friendly and food was great. I will be bugging my coworkers to come eat here regularly now!

Tried going to its parent Au Cheval many times, only to be forced away by the crowds and long wait times.  As a burger fan, I was excited that they opened another location on Milwaukee Ave.   Arrived about 1130, and there was ample street parking, and not a single customer in the smallish dining area.  My friends and I were very amped up to finally be able to try what has been touted as one of the best burgers in Chicago.  The menu is strictly burgers and fries.  I ordered the burger with cheese and bacon.  It is a decent sized burger-two patties, lots of melty cheese, and two short strips of crispy, peppered bacon. Now is it good, yep it's good....kinda like a really good diner burger, but sadly nothing special to the point where I will be craving this burger in the days to come.  What was a total and complete disappointment were the fries.  We had four orders amongst us, and they were all the same.  Tiny, and I mean the smallest I've ever seen tiny fries.  Not a single one was longer than my fingernail.  Had we not had 4 orders, I would have thought we had the remnants of what was left in the fryer.  They tasted good, but they are so small you need to eat them with a fork.  There is a garlic dipping sauce for the fries, that one of the employees insisted we try because he thought it was the best thing ever.  Considered yourself warned, it is beyond garlicky.  Trying to dip the teeny tiny fries in the sauce was a mess as you dipped your fingers with each fry. If I was passing by, would I stop for a burger, sure.  For fries, I would drive to the nearest hot dog stand or McD's.   They do have plenty of beer options, and you can get pitchers.

Au hail Small Cheval!  When it comes to younger siblings, this one definitely breaks the stereotype. While it may not be quite as great as the "master," Small Cheval is as close as it gets...but of course without the 4-hour wait. Other than providing the "next best thing" to the original, Small Cheval takes it to another level with its self-service condiment station. As a condiment whore, I can never get enough and you will definitely want to keep going back for the garlic aioli! Menu is simple, great food comes fast and shakes are amazing!
Good burger but didn't seem as good as Au Cheval.  Good attempt at trying and I'll probably be back.

Good food man!!! Good freakin' burgers and fries, fries reminds me of jimmy's hot dog fries. Milkshakes are on excellent as well. Quality spot and beautiful backyard patio area to hang out with your soon to be. Xoxo

LOVE this place! The service is always with a smile. Everyone is so nice. The counter service is fast an easy. You put your order in up front and pay, they give you a buzzer, you sit your butt outside on the patio and enjoy your drinks until the buzzer goes off. So far I've had really fast service. Love it!

Small Cheval is almost as good as Au Cheval, but lacks the long wait which is welcomed. I'm definitely a fan of the outdoor patio. The menu is about as simple as it gets, only serving burgers, fries, shakes, and booze.

I almost hate giving this place 5 stars because it's only a matter of time before more people find out about it and the lines get longer. But in all fairness this place is awesome! I believe Au Cheval makes the BEST burger in Chicago and probably the country so I was eager to try the burger only spinoff. As others have said it is not EXACTLY like Au Cheval but it is very close. The burger patties have the same taste as well as the cheese, pickles, and sauce. The bacon isn't spectacular like Au Cheval but it's also half the price as an added topping. The bun seems mostly the same and the fries are close enough. Both times i went the line was the length of the restaurant but it didn't take too long. At night it is slower because people are ordering more alcohol versus during the day when most people just want the food. Dining in is self seating and taking your order to go is also an option. As much as I love Au Cheval I'll gladly take this slightly altered version for a 20 minute wait from walking in to getting my order over a 2 hr wait to be seated.
Good burger and shake, fries were basically potato bits and left a bit to be desired. Patio was great for a nice day.  Burger-9/10 Shake-9/10 Fries-5/10

To preface: I am an Au Cheval lover. Yet, as most people, am deterred by the wildly long lines. Small Cheval is a casual version of it's mother restaurant, with limited interior space. Thus, the massive patio is a welcome feature. My girlfriend and I arrived at Small Cheval around 1pm on a beautiful Chicago Saturday, expecting to wait an unreasonable amount of time for the notorious "Cheval" burger. In actuality, we waited 15 minutes in line, and maybe 10 more for our food.  From line to food on our table - we only waited 25 minutes?! What a delight! The Burger: The famous cheese burgers were incredibly similar to the original, especially since we didn't add bacon or egg. Which is a fabulous thing. This is the best "quick" style burger you will find in Chicago, and it's not very close. How do they manage to cook those skinny patties to medium?!  The Fries: On par with the terrific burger. Crisp, fresh, and fittingly titled as "Golden fries." The Shake: This was the best vanilla shake i've tasted in Chicago. Hands down. Don't listen to the nay sayers, they're wrong.

$24 (+$2 tip) for a double cheeseburger with all the fixins', fries and a draft beer... The burger wasn't bad,  pretty tasty & the fixins' were fresh... Kinda steep for lunch though, especially with a serve-yourself, food in a basket format. I'd feel better about paying that price if it included table service. Gotta hand it to the proprietor... Finding something folks in the 'hood will flock to... Right up there with Big Star for overpriced, almost premium fast food that the predominately hipster crowd will pay extra for.

I haven't been to au cheval yet, but this place is not really worth the hype. I do love the little outdoor seating area and the burgers WERE really good, but not worth the wait or the price (not phenomenal).  Also no fried egg, boo, But I love the garlic aioli. I still want to try au Cheval, we will see...

Love this burger joint right off the 606 trail. Simple menu: hamburger or cheeseburger. You wait in line and then order at the counter. Add bacon if you want, and don't forget to ask for lettuce and tomato if you want them, too. The fries are delicious as are the drinks. The outdoor patio is dog friendly, spacious, and has a great vibe with its lighting and music on a nice summer night.

Okay--so I've never been to the original AC--every time we've tried, we ended up being too hungry to wait. That's why we were so excited to give Small Cheval a try. Underwhelming is the only suitable word to describe the experience I had today. Upon arriving, an employee wasted no time to greet us with an unusual "this is where the end of the line is." Which happen to be right where we were standing--behind a total of five other patrons. He further explained how we were blocking the condiment station which was at least 6 feet in length. I weigh under 150 lbs so I'm pretty sure I wasn't blocking much--nor would I have refused to step aside for any guests. The menu is is simple--which is totally okay. Be warned though, if you want standard burger toppings i.e., lettuce or tomato--you'll have to ask. Burgers were comparable to a well orchestrated McDonalds double cheese. Not to bash, I think both are tasty, but again, underwhelming considering the hype.
Great outdoor space for our short summers! Simple menu: hamburger, cheeseburger, add bacon and add fries! I love it! Burger was delicious...price was good to me...garlic aoli sauce was yum!

As good as the burger was, I find the facts that the managers are totally rude and unfriendly and that they don't have fries at 12:30p on a weekday, totally unacceptable. I mean, c'mon: you only have 3 items on your menu. There is no reason to run out of anything!

Small Cheval definitely redeemed the overcooked, well done burger I got at Au Cheval previously. My friend and I went on a Sunday afternoon and only waited about 20-30 minutes from the time we stood in line to the time we got our food. Already a good sign from the 1-2 hour wait I usually get quoted at Au Cheval. Our order consisted of 2 cheeseburgers with bacon, a shared basket of fries, and 2 beers. The burger was juicy, melt in your mouth goodness, with a thick slab of bacon, melted cheese, and crunchy pickles adorning every bite. Be sure to snag some garlic aioli to dip your fries in! We sat outside and the strewn patio lights along with sounds of the passing blue line made for the perfect Sunday afternoon! This place is walking distance from me, and is surely going to keep me coming back for seconds and then some! Important to note: this place is closed Mondays and Tuesdays as well as everyday from 3-5pm.

Disclaimer: I have had the OG burger at Au Cheval. Small Cheval comes close. Pretty darn close...but not quite. I think it's hard to replicate the kitchen they have at Au Cheval in what is a pretty small place at Small Cheval. The bacon is definitely better at AC, as is the bun. I don't know what they do to the bun at AC but it's magical. The patties I thought were just as good at Cheval Jr. and you still get two of them when only ordering a single. (I love that kind of math) I honestly really enjoyed Small Cheval as a stand alone restaurant from it's big brother in West Loop. It gives off the vibe of a seasonal summer beach shack with it's menu painted on the  outside wall and the huge outdoor patio in the back. Burgers, fries, shots and beers. That's it. Plain and simple. Do check out the dipping sauces though! Garlic aioli ftw. I would totally go back to Small Cheval just to enjoy a great burger and some shakes with friends while sitting outside in the sun. Hopefully it'll make the line at Au Cheval just a tad shorter for those still seeking the original.

I thought it was good. It's close to the OG, but not quite there. If someone visited me and wanted to try Au Cheval, I wouldn't take them here if it was their first time. At the same time, I would happily return to small Cheval.  I am a huge Au Cheval fan and believe you have to go there to experience the burger that has been so highly lauded. Like Sodikoff's burgers elsewhere (Bavette's and Dillman's), this burger has small differences and is certainly very good in its own right, but it's just not quite the same. And I believe that is by design. He doesn't want the Au Cheval to become Shake Shack or M Burger.  In all, this is a different experience than Au Cheval that's worth having (loved the shake), but I don't think you can walk away from it proclaiming that you've "tried the burger at Au Cheval."

I am a pretty big fan of this place! It's simple and delicious. There are only three things on the menu: Cheeseburger, Hamburger and Fries. However, they do have a lot of condiments, including the best garlic aioli! This burger is definitely one of the best burgers I've had in Chicago. Of course, it's not a crazy flavor combination (i.e. duck fat crispy onion rings with arugula, pomegranate, orange slices and almond shavings topped with truffle oil) - it's just a regular burger with their special sauce, cheese and pickles - but still, it's REALLY GOOD! The burger is perfectly cooked and super juicy. There is usually plenty of seating and the line moves fast, so don't be discouraged if the line is around the block. I think having essentially 1 thing on the menu makes it really easy to serve. The only downside is that if you want a drink, you will have to stand in this line (so stick with buying pitchers instead of glasses!). Also, there is an L line right here, so it can get pretty noisy. But all in all, great spot for a burger and a beer! UPDATE: They added a second terminal, so no need to wait in the food line for a drink =)

If you come here expecting an exact replica of an Au Cheval burger, you might leave disappointed. But if you can appreciate a solid burger and fries with a shot of whiskey on the side, then come on down. After reading about Small Cheval taking over Roxie's old spot, I definitely wanted to see how it stacked up with the real deal. It seemed like a good enough idea, giving burger lovers a chance to get a piece of the Au Cheval menu without having to endure that absurd wait.  We got there around 7 on a Friday night and there was a line out the door. It looked intimidating at first, but the wait wasn't actually too terrible. We were inside within 10 minutes, then another 10 minutes in the line inside before we ordered. We probably waited a half hour between when we got there and when our food was ready.  Ambiance: The inside is pretty much identical to Roxie's. It was small and had a real casual atmosphere. It's the same drill too: order at the counter and just wait for your order to be called. There were a couple tables inside and a pretty large patio outside with plenty of seating, which is a huge plus over the cramped inside of Au Cheval. You could actually come with a group larger than 4 for once.  Food: The menu is pretty simple. Hamburger or cheeseburger with the option to add bacon, then the only side is fries. Like Au Cheval the burgers automatically come with two patties. It's impossible to not compare the burger to Au Cheval's, so I'd have to describe Small's burger as a slightly toned down, faster food version of Au Cheval's. I thought the actual burger patties were pretty much the same. Just as juicy, and just as delicious. The bun was also really similar, with a really nice toasted outer layer but still a soft pillowy center.  The major differences come with the add-ons. The most obvious is the bacon. The bacon on Small Cheval's burger is definitely thinner and just slightly better than what you would find on any other fast food burger. It was still tasty and flavorful (I mean how could bacon NOT taste great??) but it was just missing that awesome sweet and peppery glaze on the outside and that thickness that made it a major component of the burger rather than just a topping. The second major difference is there's no option to add an egg. I'd throw eggs on everything if I could, so this was kind of disappointing. I wanted that golden stream of egg yolk running down the sides to make every bite that much heartier.  The fries that came with the burger were great. They were definitely thinner, but they were super crispy and salted well. I'd say the biggest upgrade at Small Cheval over Au Cheval is the self-serve sauce station. Giving me the freedom to take as much garlic ailoi I want is a very dangerous thing. I ate disgusting amounts of aioli that night. The garlic flavor was very potent and overall it was just amazingly rich and creamy. I slathered it all over the buns, I dumped some between the meat patties, and of course every bite of a fry was naked without a trip to the aioli cup.  Overall, I enjoyed the burger at Small Cheval. It doesn't match the greatness of the almighty Au Cheval burger, but it's pretty tasty in its own right. A cheeseburger with bacon and fries would run you about $15, which is a little on the steep end, but still only a little more than something like Five Guys, and it tastes much better. It's not a bad option to get a quick bite. Now if they only added the bologna sandwich to the menu, then I'd be here everyday.

OMG we lucked out a couple nights ago and were able to walk in with no line. Nice outdoor seating and no frills place but with amazing burgers and fries. The burger is double patty and the cheese is amazing but the garlic aioli is to die for. Put that in the burger and dip fries in it. Fries are skinny and crispy. They serve shakes, beer, and shots oh and soda to drink. Definitely an awesome burger place.

I have to admit, I've never been a huge fan of regular Au Chevals burger.  It's good, I just never understood the hype.  So when Small Cheval opened in my backyard, I wasn't terribly excited, other than for just the overall spectacle of it all.  And spectacle it is.  The line wraps around the building most nights.  Nonetheless, on a particularly nice night, a group of four of us decided to stick it out.  The result: the burger is not only different than the one at regular Au Cheval, it's BETTER.  SO good.  And the patio space is pretty awesome.  Inside smells like a diner, so not sure I'd love that in winter, but hit it up now while the weather is good.  Garlic aioli for the fries is the bomb diggity.  One star down for the negroni, which was $12 and kind of gross.  But everything else was spot on.

I've always wanted to try Au Cheval, but never have because of the waits. I love great food, but I am not one to wait a few hours for food when there are a million other delicious options in the city. If you're like me, then Small Cheval is perfect for you too! + Reasonable wait, we waited about 15 mins in line and maybe 10 mins for our food after arriving @ noon on a weekday. The line grew quickly after we arrived, but was almost non-existent by 12:45. Their lunch rush seems short and fast. + Yummy, gooey cheeseburger. We skipped the bacon based on mixed reviews. The bun is slightly sweet and very squishy - my idea of perfect. Patties were juicy and not too thick. Cheese is probably american, but makes it soooo gooey. + Fries are very salty, but crispy and golden. The garlic aioli you can get for them is the perfect accompaniment. I will definitely be back here. It's also whetted my appetite for going to the real deal at some point so I can try the fried egg.

Small Cheval was excellent. Came in on a Saturday night around 9 and the line was about 15-20 minutes of a wait. The beer selection was pretty standard, but had some great go-to beers on tap. I ordered the burger with bacon on it and a side of fries.  The Burger: All of the hype around it, I felt like it was delicious and was a fan. I would come back just for the burger again. I really didn't have complaints about the price or anything associated with the burger.  The Fries: Having a garlic aioli available as a dipping sauce and side for the fries definitely made them great. The fries were excellent on their own. Overall the experience was pretty great here. The outdoor seating definitely made it a great spot.

Got burgers, fries, and shakes for take-out.  Went early - before noon rush.  Delicious and hot at home.  Husband said shake was the best he'd had in a long time.  Seriously good hangover food (and, well, any day food).
More relaxed and faster than au cheval. The burgers are a little smaller, no fried egg, bacon is not as thick cut but still delicious!
Tried to stop here three times and they have been sold out of food all three. Would have thought they could figure out ordering the right amount of food by now. Disappointing.

I'm thrilled to have Small Cheval nearby, it's a major upgrade from Roxie's and I hope it's here to stay.  The burger is really good, not quite Au Cheval status but not far from it.  It's slightly smaller and a bit less rich, but still delicious.  The Donut Vault truck is there from time to time. Areas for improvement: line, a bit pricey, no veggie option

After attempting to try this highly anticipated burger in the hood 2x opening weekend, and being shut out each day due to running out of beef and then fries, we were super ready to hang in there and try again this past weekend. Knowing the lines have been long, my neighbor next to my house and I arrived at 4pm excited to relax and wait! Being pregnant we pulled 2 chairs from patio to start line by door. Staff cleaning the windows were super nice (initially) and opened door and said he liked our idea and we looked cozy! He reiterated they open at 5 sharp. All good! We shared we had been sharing the news with people walking by and even had talked a woman into standing in line with us. This nice staff man even checked on us again prior prior to 5 and at this time told those standing around they open at 5.  Our experience soon and unfortunately abruptly changed at 4:52. A woman came out and said we can't block the doorway. Huh? We were confused. We said, we r happy to put chairs back, we were waiting since 4 and I'm pregnant. She said you can keep the chairs but put them to the side so people can go in? Huh? She said we have been open for drinks and people can go in. This was news to us! She went on to say the patio is open for drinks and we can order them and then go in through the "back door" to get in line. Huh? This seemed weird. Her attitude was horrible and nothing she was saying to now the 3 of us was making sense. It seemed she just didn't want us standing in front and didn't explain we could start line in side.We found her very condescending. But, not wanting lose our place in line, and excited to try the burger, we followed her advise, after all, she explained she's the manager and only one with keys and runs the show, despite sharing with her the nice man that came out 3x with no issue.. She had us wait in the back by the back door. She said she will tell us a few minutes before they open so we can rush in and get in front of register, cuz there is a rush from the other door too. What? This sounded so unorganized and now choosing who has  special access or knows the secret? This was weird. It was 5 and she never came back to us. We simply walked in and stood in front of register, and we saw others come in from other door. Horrible!  $39 for 2 cheeseburgers, 2 fries, 2 shakes. I did get the bacon despite hearing bad reviews. I commented at register about reluctance with bacon and guys response was "the bacon is just thinner". I think that's where everyone is getting this phrase. Fact is, it's not the truth, the bacon does taste differ for whatever reason, if it's thinner it taste differ then Au Cheval and that's the point and I have had great experiences there, even posted on yelp. Regardless, burger was great. Fries disappointing. Prices super high for overall experience.  Bottom line: restaurant has a major issue when the staff is more talented than the main manager! I am confident Bucktown will not settle for this ignorant inexperienced attitude. I'm disappointed and frankly surprised this is who the successful restaurant group is trusting to start up Small. The attitude from main manager running this shop makes me never want to visit again, and I know my neighbor and random woman we met in mine was effected the same. Another random staff member helping at register was nice enough to give me owners email to follow up. Frankly, I feel uncomfortable based on how we were treated.I will stick to Au Cheval minus the drama and feeling unwanted with miscommunication of how to simply even get in this place at 5 sharp!  You: worth a try and know they are open for drinks from 3-5 (I think??) and go through back door and sneak the line.

Mediocre burger but am delighted they opened this shop in our neighborhood....and will certainly go back for a no frill burger with out of country guests who do not know any better. First, I love au cheval even though i would not rate their burger as the best in Chicago, let alone the country. Small Cheval, guys - why did you make the burger worse than au cheval and charge a dollar less? I'd rather you give me what i get at au cheval and charge me 3 bucks more for bringing it to my neighborhood. Business model is more of a machine shop, with burgers pre-cooked and waiting to be put on a bun to hand in to the customer within minutes upon order. So by the time i got my burger and sat that it was barely at room temperature.  French fries. OK. Milk shake. Nothing to write home about. Price for cheese burger, fries, and milk shake around $19 with a few dollars tip. Seems like low value when you can have a fancy juicy lovely higher quality burger at The Blackbird served by fancy servers for about the same price. I reckon going there with the family and seeing kids enjoy their food is a pleasure.  Again, I sincerely thank you for opening in our neighborhood.

There is nothing more white people love than standing in line for mediocre food and small cheval is the epitomy of that. People crammed into a line for three menu items and when they say everything that doesn't include ketchup and mustard just a heads up.  Granted I payed my dues and waited in line of course I was going to eat my bb (basic burger)  Nice and wet my burger took a swim in its own juices so it needed to be dryed off before I could eat. 10 napkins later and of course was charged way more than anticipated. I will glady moan and groan my way out of another visit.
Great burgers. Kind of expensive. Not same quality as au cheval. I wouldn't make it a regular spot.

I've been to Au Cheval so it set my standards high for Small Cheval. I went at 6:30 so I expected to wait in line. I only waited 15 minutes to order which is much better than the 4 hour wait at Au. It was nice to have someone ask my drink order while in line, the only problem was once you order and sit, you have to stand in line again to get another drink. Oh and if you want an egg on your burger, you won't get one. They don't have eggs at Small Cheval. If you're looking for a good burger and decent craft beer selection, go. If you're looking for an even better burger (with an egg) go to Au Cheval.

The Good: It's at the end of my block The line at off peak times is very manageable The patio is beautiful, especially at night  The burger overall is very tasty Service is quick and polite Three words: Unlimited Garlic Aioli Less expensive than Au Cheval The So-So The fries were a little undercooked for me, would have preferred a little crispier The burger patties seemed slightly smaller than at Au Cheval, so the bun beef ratio is a little off The cocktails looked a little pricy Bottom Line- If you have not done so, you should definitely go to Au Cheval for the full experience, thick cut bacon, fried egg, crispy fries, awesome music on the hi-fi etc.  However, this is a delicious, less expensive, more accessible alternative to the full shebang and should not be missed!

The burgers at Small Cheval are fairly average to start, so it's a slight overpay for the double patty cheeseburger, although I like that I can get bacon here for just $2 more. Yesterday afternoon, the fries were perfect at lunch service time and the chocolate shake was extra perfect.  Love the indoor space.  Love the outdoor space, but on a sunny day, I won't be sitting in the scalding sun unless I remember to throw some block on before soaking in the rays.  (Umbrellas?)  Love having garlic aioli on tap so that I can feed the beast.  Prices are where I expected them to be, and I think the shake prices are very fair right now.  (Even if I wanted cheap beer, there are a few options under $5.) I'll come back in about a month when the action dies down a bit--hoping that happens!--to see how the burger ended up.  Otherwise, I'll stick with Au Cheval and just come for lunch early in the week and avoid the massive wait that comes with dinner!

I've been to Au Cheval probably 25 times in the last year and a half. Whatever, it's good.  Anyway, my bar was set super high and was really hyped to check this out. I mean, it was good as it AIN'T THE SAME AT ALL! I liked walking in, ordering, sitting down on the chill ass patio, and getting the food in a fairly quick manner. I was just pretty bummed when I got it. Maybe I was too excited? I don't know. Probably. I just really like Au Cheval. But like, I would go again if I was in Wicker Park and wanted something quick. But I don't spend a lot of time there because I don't work at Groupon or do crossfit.

There is nothing to dislike except all of the people who will crowd this place and create long lines for me.  Came here on Friday the day before their official opening in an effort to beat the crowds. Thank God because when I walked by on Saturday at about 1pm there was a line, out the door, down the block. When I was walking my dog on Sunday, there were even more people waiting in line.  The burgers are almost as good as the ones at Au Cheval and that is good enough for me. They are the perfect greasiness, flavor, and patty to topping ratio. The fries are good too and the pump-it-yourself garlic aioli is worth it. I had the peach gimlet (which isn't really a gimlet since it's made with vodka, but I digress) and it was good as well. All of the alcohols come out of a tap (efficient!). I loved the outdoor seating (which I never got to enjoy while it was Roxie's) and it is dog friendly. No waiter service. Just order, grab a seat, and wait for them to call your number. Can't wait to come back, but not too often because I don't want to die of a heart attack.  Bonus: the Doughnut Vault van showed up on Friday night so we were able to add 4000 more calories to our day by purchasing their always incredible donuts.

This place just oozes je ne sais quoi... hipster food trap? Basically you are paying close to $15 dollars for a double cheese burger made with mediocre cysco meat (they openly admit it) and a soggy order of fries, at least mine were (how hard is it to cook fries properly, if they are so rushed maybe they need a bigger fryer, this place was obviously going to be jam packed). And then I am not served anything, it's all a to-go window, served shake shack style in a cardboard box. So Eco-friendly... Not. They can't be bothered to have plastic trays and wash them... I can stomach the kool-aid hype at the fulton market sit down restaurant, actually like that place, but this money grabbing location, it just doesn't do it for me.  I can get the same type of shitty red meat smashburger and better fries at red hot ranch for five bucks and wait five minutes instead of forty-five minutes for my food at Small Cheval. +1 star for the garlic aioli on tap.

Smallllll cheval. When I first hear about this I was so excited I put it down in my calendar. I wanted to go opening day. I'm glad I didn't. I heard they ran out of burgers by 4 PM. Not surprising. I was able to go the following day. I kept wondering how the line would be. It ended up taking 30 minutes to get to the cashier on a Sunday afternoon. It was lolla weekend so perhaps there were less people there than usually. I thought, 30 minutes is nothing compared to going to Au Cheval, where the wears vary between 2 to 6 hours. It's absurd. Chicagoans should have an express like for Au Cheval. I mean, WE LIVE HERE.  I just assume plenty of tourist go there because they have heard all the amazing things about it.  Anyway, this location only has burgers and cheese burgers (and fries+beverages). I like that. It keeps it quick and to the point. BUT NO FRIED EGG??? So sad when I saw that. I adoreeeeeee the fried Egg on my burger. It really takes it to the next level. Also not that I order four patties on a burger but I don't think you can do this here. But then again I don't know, it's no on the menu.  I do like this location because it is a quick fix for a delicious burger. I mean one of the best in the city  my only issue is that the menu is so limited which has its ups and downs.  I love Au Cheval becAuse of everything else there. Not just the burger. The bone marrow is amazing at Au Cheval and I've heard good things about their matzo ball soup. So is this place awesome? Yes. But you're getting the burger. And youre still waiting. Haha.

As a die-hard promoter of Au Cheval having the best burger around, I was ecstatic that Small Cheval was opening up in my neighborhood.  A friend and I went on Saturday 8/01, which was opening weekend but they turned us away saying they ran out of food. We went back the next day a little after 5 when they reopened to a note on the door saying they were sold out and would reopen at 6:30 (Hopefully this isn't what happens every weekend). They actually opened the doors again at 6, and the staff was extremely friendly and thanked us multiple times for waiting. They even start serving your drink order while you wait in line, which makes the wait a bit better.  The burger here is amazing, but I would still visit Au Cheval for the fried egg + thick cut bacon burger experience if this is your first time trying from this chain. The fries were so-so but made exponentially better with the garlic aioli dipping sauce.  My friend and I had a margarita and peach gimlet, and when the waitress went to hand us the drinks, she said she couldn't tell the difference, and after sampling them, neither could we. It was fine since both were $12 each drinks but disappointing they were so similar. They were strong though, so that's a bonus. Our total cost for 2 cheeseburgers, 1 french fry and 2 drinks was around $55. Was the meal worth the cost?
